href="/user/show/22224742-cassandra"><img alt="Cassandra" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476890938p2/22224742.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/981094303?book_show_action=false">Aug 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Cassandra" class="user" name="Cassandra" href="/user/show/22224742-cassandra">Cassandra</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=deep-stuff">deep-stuff</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=survival">survival</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=reads-of-2016">reads-of-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22224742-cassandra?shelf=bromantic">bromantic</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer981094303" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer808889673032757800"><i> <b>"If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals."</b> </i><br /><br />I can't really say much about this series that hasn't been said. Now that I'm reading the story of the boy who lived, I can say with certainty that I am the girl who has lived. Most books get a hype, and I can at least see where the hype comes from but usually it's a bit over the top. But Harry Potter deserves every single bit of hype it has. This series is jaw dropping, well written, and h</span>  <span id="freeText808889673032757800" style="display:none"><i>  <b>"If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals."</b></i><br /><br />I can't really say much about this series that hasn't been said. Now that I'm reading the story of the boy who lived, I can say with certainty that I am the girl who has lived. Most books get a hype, and I can at least see where the hype comes from but usually it's a bit over the top. But Harry Potter deserves every single bit of hype it has. This series is jaw dropping, well written, and has a cast that you can not help but loving dearly. I laughed, I cried, I giggled hysterically.<br /><br />I will be finishing this series this year.<br /><br />Infinite points to Rowling!</span>  <a data-text-id="808889673032757800" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1675725404" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1675725404" />    <a title="U+263EHayley" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22062635-hayley"><img alt="U+263EHayley" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468902668p2/22062635.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1675725404?book_show_action=false">Aug 02, 2016</a>      <a title="U+263EHayley" class="user" name="U+263EHayley" href="/user/show/22062635-hayley">U+263EHayley</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1675725404" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13242624639487054440">*This review contains spoilers but nothing you don't already know if you haven't been living under a rock for the last 10 years* <br><br>"<i>Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort...</i><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467419715ra/19591008.gif" width="240" height="336" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg">" <br><br><br>First off, I realized that I forgot to mention in my other reviews that I have been listening to the audio books this time around. THEY ARE A</span>  <span id="freeText13242624639487054440" style="display:none">*This review contains spoilers but nothing you don't already know if you haven't been living under a rock for the last 10 years* <br><br>"<i>Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort...</i><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467419715ra/19591008.gif" width="240" height="336" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg">" <br><br><br>First off, I realized that I forgot to mention in my other reviews that I have been listening to the audio books this time around. THEY ARE AMAZING. JIM DALE IS AMAZING. He does such a fantastic job with all the voices. All the different accents, sass and charm really adds depth to the characters and brings them to life. I absolutely adore his narration. If you haven't listening to the audio books I would highly recommend the investment! <br><br>This book was great and I loved every page of it (can I say that even though I'm listening?), obviously it's Harry Potter, though The Prisoner of Azkaban still remains my favorite. I absolutely loved the time Harry spent with the Weasley family and getting to know their dynamics better. They are hilarious and witty and fun and can J.K. Rowling write a book just about them, please?! With every book J.K Rowling opens our eyes a little more to the wonderful world she has created between the pages of her books. In this book we get to see more about the wizarding world outside of Hogwarts and England, what daily life looks like as a wizard, and we definitely get to learn more about it's past. The only non positive, I don't want to say negative because once again it's Harry Potter and there are no negatives, thing I would say about this book are the tasks in the Triwizard Tournament. They were rather lackluster and definitely more exciting and entertaining in the movie. <br><br>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is where the books begin to take a darker turn with the <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ rise of the Dark Lord and the death of Cedric  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> and I'm honestly scared to start the next one. To continue the killing off of beloved characters. <br><br>If you haven't read the Harry Potter books you should, even if you have seen the movies. 1. because you don't want to be <i>that</i> person, you know the one who everyone gawks at when they say they haven't read the books and 2. they are fantastic and tell so much more about the history and the interworking of the wizarding world.</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="13242624639487054440" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1675725404">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1675725404" title="Flag this review as </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1773252591" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1773252591" />    <a title="Lauren" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4617391-lauren"><img alt="Lauren" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479593418p2/4617391.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1773252591?book_show_action=false">Oct 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Lauren" class="user" name="Lauren" href="/user/show/4617391-lauren">Lauren</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=reread">reread</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=gorgeous-covers">gorgeous-covers</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1773252591" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4002371019542675733">Every time I start this book I remember all over again how much I love it. This book keeps you on your toes and there's always so much going on, you never have to worry about growing bored. <br /><br />The whole concept of the Triwizard tournament is amazing and I love that we finally get to see some foreign wizards and some glimpses of the other magic schools. <br /><br />This is where everything starts getting more and more complicated and when you realize how much forethought JK put into some of the story-arcs that</span>  <span id="freeText4002371019542675733" style="display:none">Every time I start this book I remember all over again how much I love it. This book keeps you on your toes and there's always so much going on, you never have to worry about growing bored. <br /><br />The whole concept of the Triwizard tournament is amazing and I love that we finally get to see some foreign wizards and some glimpses of the other magic schools. <br /><br />This is where everything starts getting more and more complicated and when you realize how much forethought JK put into some of the story-arcs that continue on through the remainder of the series. <br /><br />There's so much in this book that's left out of the movies, from Dobby's involvement, to S.P.E.W., to Sirius having an active role, all of what happened to Barry Crouch, Rita Skeeter, and so much more. I wish this book had been split into two movies, I feel like so much was missed. <br /><br />But I adore this book and my love for this series only continues to grow.</span>  <a data-text-id="4002371019542675733" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1773252591">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1773252591" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1773252591&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1773252591'><a id="like_count_review_1773252591" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1773252591?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">30 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1773252591" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1773252591" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=30&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1773252591&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1773252591" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1773252591, true, &#39;&#39;); J.K. Rowling is a writing goddess and I can't believe how much foresight and planning went into this series. She already hints at the horcruxes and many other things in this book that don't show up until much later. Definitely one of my favorites in the series (but I say that about all of them)! </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review345247771">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link345247771" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=345247771&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_345247771'><a id="like_count_review_345247771" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/345247771?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">768 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_345247771" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_345247771" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=768&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=345247771&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_345247771" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 345247771, true, &#39;&#39;); amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6405984-hira?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer576283128" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer660395270927929161">*To read more reviews by me visit <a href="http://hm-viewsnreviews.blogspot.com/" rel="nofollow">Views & Reviews</a> *<br><br>I seriously have no idea why I still review these books when I have nothing new to say. I mean... J.K. Rowling is perfect. This series is perfect. And I dream day & night of going to Hogwarts. So what I'm going to do is, I'm going to show you how I felt about this book:<br><br>When I started the book:<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820392.gif" width="320" height="289" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820393.gif" width="170" height="197" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820394.gif" width="350" height="197" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>During the book:<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820395.gif" width="319" height="167" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820396.gif" width="245" height="180" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820397.gif" width="200" height="148" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>At the end: <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820398.gif" width="300" height="190" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820399.gif" width="225" height="190" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820400.gif" width="245" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820401.gif" width="500" height="275" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820402.gif" width="275" height="145" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Umm.. Mam Rowling..<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820403.gif" width="319" height="131" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820404.gif" width="500" height="280" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>All in all<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820405.gif" width="500" height="225" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380415598ra/820406.gif" width="500" height="277" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Sorry for the lame review, readers. I just really don't know what to say..</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_68913564" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/68913564" />    <a title="Stephen" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1413439-stephen"><img alt="Stephen" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1311616811p2/1413439.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/68913564?book_show_action=false">Sep 01, 2011</a>      <a title="Stephen" class="user" name="Stephen" href="/user/show/1413439-stephen">Stephen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=award-nominee-hugo">award-nominee-hugo</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=award-nominee-locus">award-nominee-locus</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=multiple-award-nominee">multiple-award-nominee</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=award-winner-hugo">award-winner-hugo</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=award-nominee-bram-stoker">award-nominee-bram-stoker</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=potteresque">potteresque</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=2000-2005">2000-2005</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=comfort-food">comfort-food</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer68913564" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2202315580601046379">This was the beginning of my addiction to <b>POT</b>ter. I had previously <i>experimented</i> with and enjoyed <b>POT</b>ter on 3 different occasions, but could easily have walked away and never touched the stuff again. Then, under some pressure from some <b>POT</b>ter<b>HEAD</b> peers of mine, I tried the newest blend called <b>the Goblet</b>...and everything changed. As the warm, easy, potato chip prose crossed my blood-brain barrier, euphoria ensued. My inner child was smitten. <br /><br />I...was...hooked and I...was...happy. <br /><br />Ignore the so-call</span>  <span id="freeText2202315580601046379" style="display:none">This was the beginning of my addiction to <b>POT</b>ter. I had previously <i>experimented</i> with and enjoyed <b>POT</b>ter on 3 different occasions, but could easily have walked away and never touched the stuff again. Then, under some pressure from some <b>POT</b>ter<b>HEAD</b> peers of mine, I tried the newest blend called <b>the Goblet</b>...and everything changed. As the warm, easy, potato chip prose crossed my blood-brain barrier, euphoria ensued. My inner child was smitten. <br /><br />I...was...hooked and I...was...happy. <br /><br />Ignore the so-called "experts" who say <b>POT</b>ter is brain cell killing pap. DonU+2019t listen to those jaded, book snobby squares. Most of them are wound so tight they wouldnU+2019t know a good book if it sat on their face and wriggled. <br /><br /><b>POT</b>ter makes you feel good. <b>POT</b>ter makes you smile. <b>POT</b>ter makes you joyous and giggly. Hell, <b>POT</b>ter makes you want to use the word giggly. <br /><br /><b>POT</b>ter is enjoyable and fun. That's enough for me. <br /><br />So what made <b> the Goblet</b> so much more addicting than the rest of the <b>POT</b>ter I had tried. Part of it was that I had already seen the movies (up through Order of the Phoenix) before I got my hands on genuine <b>POT</b>ter. The first 3 were fun but I felt like I had already "been there done that" as they were pretty faithfully adaptated for the screen. Still enjoyable, but not enough to put the <b>POT</b>ter monkey on my back. <br /><br />Then came <b>the Goblet</b> of <b>POT</b>ter and it was a big, huge, tightly-rolled fatty at 750 pages. The cut, diluted movie strain couldnU+2019t hope to be as potent as the primo original and the story was finally given the room to breathe and take on an epic feel. It was completely addictive. The world-building details started coming fast and furious and the characters were given considerably increased depth. Add that to RowlingU+2019s breezy, U+201Cear friendlyU+201D prose and I found myself spaced out for hours turning the pages and still hungering for more. <br /><br />ItU+2019s high praise indeed when I say that 750 pages did not contain a single dull, ploddy moment. This was fun and wonderful and a pleasure to experience. It deserves to be recognized for the iconic work that it is in the realm of YA fantasy. <br /><br />Is it popcorn? Certainly. <br />Is it a joy to read? Definitely. <br />Is it one I HIGHLY RECOMMEND to all lovers of feel good, comfort food? YES. <br /><br />5.0 stars. <br /><br />Winner: Hugo Award for Best Science Fiction Novel (2001) <br />Nominee: Locus Award for Best Fantasy Novel (2001) <br />Nominee: Bram Stoker Award (YA) for Best Novel (2001)<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="2202315580601046379" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review68913564">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link68913564" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=68913564&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_68913564'><a id="like_count_review_68913564" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/68913564?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">260 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_68913564" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_68913564" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=260&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=68913564&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_68913564" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 68913564, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">62 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/68913564?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_68913564' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/68913564/comments?reverse=true">View all 62 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_143450041" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Alli" href="/user/show/7145369-alli"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471869157p1/7145369.jpg" alt="7145369" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/7145369-alli">Alli</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer10020569338891610570">Love your review, but I have to disagree with you on one point. As a book snobbish square type I don't consider this popcorn. Rawlings might not have</span>  <span id="freeText10020569338891610570" style="display:none">Love your review, but I have to disagree with you on one point. As a book snobbish square type I don't consider this popcorn. Rawlings might not have the beautiful words that sing to us like, say, Tolkien, but after book 4 you can't convince me that she doesn't offer a meaty four course meal that serves up an extraordinarily well written, uber imaginative, I-can't -put-this-down story. <br /><br />I'm shelving Dickens for book 5.</span>  <a data-text-id="10020569338891610570" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Nov 27, 2015 05:37AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_153189665" class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_108852901" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/108852901" />    <a title="Raeleen Lemay" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay"><img alt="Raeleen Lemay" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475215415p2/3452652.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/108852901?book_show_action=false">Dec 14, 2014</a>      <a title="Raeleen Lemay" class="user" name="Raeleen Lemay" href="/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay">Raeleen Lemay</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=own">own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer108852901" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1208458491927537041"><i> Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You </i><br /><br />SO I HAVE A FEW NOTES ON THIS ONE:<br /><br />-at the beginning, Voldemort says to Wormtail, "I will allow you to perform an essential task for me, one that many of my followers would give their right hands to perform..." OMG J.K. ROWLING FORESHADOWS EVERYTHINGGGG<br /><br />-when the Weasley men come to Privet Drive through the Dursleys' fireplace is just.... priceless. Yet ANOTHER scene that I wish had made it into the movie.<br /><br />-We get to meet Bill in this book (way e</span>  <span id="freeText1208458491927537041" style="display:none"><i> Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You </i><br /><br />SO I HAVE A FEW NOTES ON THIS ONE:<br /><br />-at the beginning, Voldemort says to Wormtail, "I will allow you to perform an essential task for me, one that many of my followers would give their right hands to perform..." OMG J.K. ROWLING FORESHADOWS EVERYTHINGGGG<br /><br />-when the Weasley men come to Privet Drive through the Dursleys' fireplace is just.... priceless. Yet ANOTHER scene that I wish had made it into the movie.<br /><br />-We get to meet Bill in this book (way earlier than in the movies, I might add), and Mrs. Weasley is very disapproving of how Bill looks. I love that Bill stood up for himself and was like NOBODY GIVE AN F HOW I LOOK, AND NEITHER DO IIIIII. It was a nice thing to throw in there.<br /><br />-Dobby is also in this book more, and seeing how different he is was really fun.<br /><br />-Harry and Ron fighting made my heart hurt so much.<br /><br />-All of the drama at the Yule Ball just made me SQUEEE because it's so obvious that Ron and Hermione like each other and they just don't want to admit it and GAH. THE FEELS.<br /><br />-I also love how much Hermione stands up for what she believes in, which you can particularly see in this book. She wants justice for the house-elves, she won't let Ron get away with being an idiot (like when he says he just wants a pretty girl to go to the ball with), and she is especially confident in this book as well. Malfoy and many other people are constantly teasing her, but she is completely above it, and for that I admire her.<br /><br />-WHEN HARRY IS LISTENING TO HAGRID AND MADAME MAXIME AND HE SEES THE BEETLE? IMAGINE IF HE HAD JUST STEPPED ON IT? WOULDN'T THAT HAVE BEEN GREAT?<br /><br />-I completely forgot about the part where Harry sees Barty Crouch on the Marauders Map! He was so close to finding out something big, but then things got crazy and he didn't, but WHOA. SO CLOSE. <br /><br />-Cedric's death hit me a lot harder than it ever has before... He was such an amazing person, and I wish that he could have survived so him and Harry could have been buddies.<br /><br />-VOLDEMORT FORESHADOWS HORCRUXES IN THIS BOOK. TWO MORE BOOKS UNTIL HARRY ACTUALLY LEARNS THOUGH.<br /><br /><br />ok so I think it's safe to say that this is one of my favorites in the series for sure. Probably in the top 3. </span>  <a data-text-id="1208458491927537041" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1547772364" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1547772364" />    <a title="Aj the Ravenous Reader" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader"><img alt="Aj the Ravenous Reader" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453105148p2/30248594.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1547772364?book_show_action=false">Feb 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Aj the Ravenous Reader" class="user" name="Aj the Ravenous Reader" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader">Aj the Ravenous Reader</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Aj the Ravenous Reader by: </span>      <a href="/user/show/31461418-alienor-french-frowner-of-badger-and-snake">Alienor U+2718 French Frowner U+2718 (of badger and SNAKE)</a>  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=lol">lol</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=classic">classic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=love-love-love">love-love-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=wholesome-reads">wholesome-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1547772364" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11854098810661018219"><br />Normally, I congratulate myself for finishing a 500 + page novel but after reading 734 pages of this book, my only reaction was <b>U+201CHow could it already be over?U+201D</b>The more I read Harry Potter, the harder I fall in love with <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a>. I couldnU+2019t grasp how she could make this most fantastic series with the most complex and most expertly planned out plot, you could tell she was so sure of the story the moment she started writing the first book. Her attention to detail is more than impressive and th</span>  <span id="freeText11854098810661018219" style="display:none"><br />Normally, I congratulate myself for finishing a 500 + page novel but after reading 734 pages of this book, my only reaction was <b>U+201CHow could it already be over?U+201D</b>The more I read Harry Potter, the harder I fall in love with <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a>. I couldnU+2019t grasp how she could make this most fantastic series with the most complex and most expertly planned out plot, you could tell she was so sure of the story the moment she started writing the first book. Her attention to detail is more than impressive and the diversity and the realness of her characters are just unbelievable. Every single character (even inanimate ones) is fully developed. <b>I am just absolutely, completely, astonished! </b><br /><br /><b>ONTO THE RANDOM STUFF</b><br /><br /><b> Lol higlights</b><br />1. George and Fred and their skiving snack boxes. These boys are just too funny. <i>U+201CMaybe HarryU+2019s next task is to attack Percy while heU+2019s in the shower.U+201D </i><br />2. Professor Dumbledore and his twinkling eyes.<br />3. Hagrid and Madam Maxine- a match made in erU+2026the mountains?<br />4. When is Vicky short for Viktor? When RonU+2019s jealous. Lol.<br />5. U+201CHerm-own-ninnyU+201D says Krum. (Bahahaha!)<br />6. Socks that screamed loudly when they became too smelly-HarryU+2019s sweetest gift to Dobby.^^<br />7. Dobby calling Ron U+201CWheezy!U+201D<br />8. Super cute Pigwidgeon being called U+201CPigU+201D (Bahaha!)<br /><br /><b> Grrr inducing moments/characters </b><br />1. Fleur Delacour, I am not very fond of ze way you act although I find ze way you talk fab.<br />2. Ron, you could really be an idiot sometimes. <i>U+201CCaught on, have you? Took you long enough.U+201D</i><br />3. Draco, you foul creature! DonU+2019t worry, Harry. IU+2019ll make you a personal badge IU+2019d wear all the time saying Harry Potter is the best. Rub the badge and itU+2019ll change into U+201CHarry Potter is the bestest!U+201D<br />4. THAT RITA SKEETER!<br />5. He who must not be named is officially back! *shivers*<br />6. Harry, you could be a pain sometimes, you know? All the danger signs are there. Your dreams, your scar, your name out of the goblet. Why wonU+2019t you listen to Hermione?<br /><br /><b> Woah moments </b><br />1. Harry against the Horntail: Way to go, Harry!<br />2. The triwizard tournament of course<br />3. Basically all the tasks! Harry is awesome! 50 points to Gryffindor for answering the SphinxU+2019 question.<br /><br /><b> Hermione moments </b><br />1. Hermione, her big heart and brain for the SPEW, I mean S.P.E.W.<br />2. <i>U+201DSo basically, youU+2019re going to take the best-looking girl whoU+2019ll have you, even if sheU+2019s completely horrible?U+201D</i><br />3. Her relentless support to Harry.<br />4. Hermione and the Yule Ball.<br /><br /><b> Sherlock thought </b><br />1. I was almost sure itU+2019s <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Mr. Bagman <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> who was the culprit. I was terribly wrong. IU+2019m no Sherlock after all.<br /><br /><b> Crying moments</b><br />1. Ron and Harry made up. (I was positively howling right along with Hermione)<br />2. J.K. Rowling says U+201Clet the killing of noble characters beginU+201D <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Cedrick!  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> *wails*<br />3. Harry and his big heart. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ The twins really deserve the bag of galleons.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Let me give you a Mrs. Weasley signature rib crushing hug.<br /><br /><b> A few of the many things the movie got wrong or missed to include:</b><br /><br />1. Winky & Dobby & Mr. Bagman.<br />2. Went on ruining the mystery of the story right from the beginning. Ugh!<br />3. Rita SkeeterU+2019s most well deserved punishment.^^ All thanks to Hermione.^^<br />4. Wormtail being all smug.<br />5. HermioneU+2019s ball dress should have been periwinkle blue!<br /><br /><b> P.S. Harry's first attempt at romance happened here so it makes perfect sense that I'm posting this review on Love Day. What's more perfect is I get to greet my smart and sexy French Friend, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/31461418-alienor-french-frowning-pumpkin">Anna</a> a HAPPY BIRTHDAY! I hope you're having the best day, my awesome friend! I was going to read something else for you but I can't keep my hands off Harry Potter. I am positively hexed. Lol. </b></span>  <a data-text-id="11854098810661018219" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer577785744" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3676376024132281507"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1399313847i/9533492.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Death had always been a major theme of these books, but <i>Goblet of Fire</i> was really the turning point of the whole series. Not only did Voldemort return, but we found out that the Wizarding World is much larger, and <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Cedric is killed <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>.<br><br>The characters become more real yet are still stuck in flux between child and adult, which is apropos seeing as how this book is literally in the middle of the series. </["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr     <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=male-pov">male-pov</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"    <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2745288-wendy-darling?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1423283686" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14638772333089864298">I'm apparently the crankiest person on earth, because this was my least favorite Potter book yet. (AZKABAN being my favorite!) It's mostly because:<br /><br />1. There is too much tournamenting for my taste. <br />2. I hate the house elves. :O<br />3. The word "quietly" is egregiously overused. It loses its effectiveness because it appears so often.<br />4. There are moments when Harry and Ron behave like stereotypical stupid boys (I know, I know, they're 14...doesn't mean I can't be annoyed with them.)<br /><br />The book gets an extra</span>  <span id="freeText14638772333089864298" style="display:none">I'm apparently the crankiest person on earth, because this was my least favorite Potter book yet. (AZKABAN being my favorite!) It's mostly because:<br /><br />1. There is too much tournamenting for my taste. <br />2. I hate the house elves. :O<br />3. The word "quietly" is egregiously overused. It loses its effectiveness because it appears so often.<br />4. There are moments when Harry and Ron behave like stereotypical stupid boys (I know, I know, they're 14...doesn't mean I can't be annoyed with them.)<br /><br />The book gets an extra star because the last 10 chapters were very good, though, and I loved:<br /><br />1. that Hermione gets a makeover, but then matter-of-factly says it's too much trouble to straighten her hair every day.<br />2. the creepy thing in the blanket <br />3. Cedric! Poor brave boy. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[WHY DID NO ONE TELL ME. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="14638772333089864298" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer364767734" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14433234296156211385">Reread in December 2015 for #HarryXmasToYou<br /><br />Seriously so many things I forgot because it's so different from book to movie! It's so good still though. I loved Dobby in this book.<br /><br />Reread in December 2014 for #HarryXmasToYou<br /><br />Again, so great. Lots of things I forgot! Like Ludo Bagman as a character, the Weasley's coming to be Harry's family for the third task, and just how things actually happen in the book since it varies in the movie. Things start to get dark after this book!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1306639991?book_show_action=false">Jul 22, 2016</a>      <a title="P " class="user" name="P " href="/user/show/25327841-p">P </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=favorites-2015">favorites-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1306639991" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7404295220554936442"><blockquote> <b>U+201CIt is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.U+201D</b> </blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456635411i/18259617.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Re-read -</b> Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire steps up from the previous ones very well, it's the darkest book I've ever read since Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. Who knows ? Harry Potter grows up and becomes a boy who has to take the responsibility on his shoulders, he never wants to be selected, he never wants glory and prestige, yet the world turns against him anyway.<br><br>I love that this book isn't a children's book any</span>  <span id="freeText7404295220554936442" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>U+201CIt is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.U+201D</b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456635411i/18259617.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Re-read -</b> Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire steps up from the previous ones very well, it's the darkest book I've ever read since Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. Who knows ? Harry Potter grows up and becomes a boy who has to take the responsibility on his shoulders, he never wants to be selected, he never wants glory and prestige, yet the world turns against him anyway.<br><br>I love that this book isn't a children's book anymore, in my opinion, it becomes hastily intense and has more dimensions than J.K. Rowling had ever intended. She did a great job when she wrote this book, I could see her intention for the book to be a mature one and she made the right decision for doing that. I'm so pround of her and so she becomes my favorire author EVER !<br><br><blockquote>  <b>U+201CIf you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469170080i/19787394._SY540_.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><blockquote>  <b>U+201CIt matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.U+201D </b></blockquote><br><br>Not only this book is full of adventures, but it hides some messages for you to discover. Isn't it the best way to teach our children via books ? Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire has everything I've asked for since the first time I read. Until now, the book is like a gem and I think of it as my treasure because it's so precious my eyes hurt to look at.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1456635411ra/18259618.gif" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Many things happen in this book such as a tragedy and deprecation, but it's the way our lives go on, right ? So I embraced this book like a teddy bear and told myself that perhaps something really bad would happen, but it's just mishaps and it would pass like a rainy day.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>U+201CRemember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.U+201D</b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1456635411ra/18259619.gif" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>#TeamKrumione<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434476124ra/15227492.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>More at <a target="_blank" href="http://goo.gl/kNcx2n" rel="nofollow">http://goo.gl/kNcx2n</a></span>  <a data-text-id="7404295220554936442" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2933855-brina?shelf=rereads">rereads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2933855-brina?shelf=j-k-rowling">j-k-rowling</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1560647610" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15499031379427361590">This is at least the 10th time I have read Harry Potter. I feel like I am doing a disservice writing a review of this book. That being said, I usually reread the entire series around this time of year when I am waiting for spring to start. It is like revisiting an old friend and brings a warm feeling to my heart. In my last review, I equated reading Potter to warm apple pie with vanilla ice cream on top, basically the ultimate comfort read. <br />My favorite section in this book occurs in the last 150</span>  <span id="freeText15499031379427361590" style="display:none">This is at least the 10th time I have read Harry Potter. I feel like I am doing a disservice writing a review of this book. That being said, I usually reread the entire series around this time of year when I am waiting for spring to start. It is like revisiting an old friend and brings a warm feeling to my heart. In my last review, I equated reading Potter to warm apple pie with vanilla ice cream on top, basically the ultimate comfort read. <br />My favorite section in this book occurs in the last 150 pages. The first time I read the series it was my favorite book because of all the action and new characters. Digging deeper, I have come to love book 3 more but value book 4 as it acts like a segue to years 5-7. Harry comes face to face with Voldemort at last and leaves behind the rest of his childhood innocence. Dark times await in the near future, and Harry must keep his friends close at hand. As the Hogwarts Express leaves Hogsmeade station, we grow apprehensive of the journey that Harry has just embarked upon and look forward with excitedly to the next installment of J. K. Rowling's magical world.</span>  <a data-text-id="15499031379427361590" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_990492304" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/990492304" />    <a title="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess"><img alt="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477111902p2/30510075.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/990492304?book_show_action=false">Feb 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" class="user" name="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" href="/user/show/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess">Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess?shelf=fantasy-sci-fi">fantasy-sci-fi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer990492304" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13442297529205295924">I've read this series more times than I can even remember. But every time it feels like the first time all over again. There's always certain details that I forget between my re-reads and movie watching and it's great to revisit and remember why this is one of my favorites of the series. I loved how much foreshadowing is in it and knowing what's coming, certain parts just break my heart. I decided to do the audio book by Jim Dale for the first time ever. Oh my was it great! Definitely recommend</span>  <span id="freeText13442297529205295924" style="display:none">I've read this series more times than I can even remember. But every time it feels like the first time all over again. There's always certain details that I forget between my re-reads and movie watching and it's great to revisit and remember why this is one of my favorites of the series. I loved how much foreshadowing is in it and knowing what's coming, certain parts just break my heart. I decided to do the audio book by Jim Dale for the first time ever. Oh my was it great! Definitely recommend it! So much love for this series!!</span>  <a data-text-id="13442297529205295924" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review990492304">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link990492304" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=990492304&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_990492304'><a id="like_count_review_990492304" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/990492304?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">91 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_990492304" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_990492304" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=91&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=990492304&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_990492304" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 990492304, true, &#39;&#39;); was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar    </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1779100873" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11112780626570906066"><a href="http://s1279.photobucket.com/user/Christyb23/media/Book Reviews 9/stencil.facebook-post_zpsild6eqh4.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476888442i/20894055._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo stencil.facebook-post_zpsild6eqh4.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> was my most anticipated read of the seriesU+2026 ItU+2019s my favorite movie (I KNOW I KNOW- the books are SO MUCH BETTER) and itU+2019s where the books really start to get intense. Even though there was a part that brought tears to my eyes, its not as sad as whats yet to comeU+2026 <br><br>I feel like this book is the book of transitioning for Harry, Ron and Hermione. This is the last book of their childhood. If the movies follow the books as well as I hope, shit really starts to get r</span>  <span id="freeText11112780626570906066" style="display:none"><a href="http://s1279.photobucket.com/user/Christyb23/media/Book Reviews 9/stencil.facebook-post_zpsild6eqh4.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476888442i/20894055._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo stencil.facebook-post_zpsild6eqh4.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> was my most anticipated read of the seriesU+2026 ItU+2019s my favorite movie (I KNOW I KNOW- the books are SO MUCH BETTER) and itU+2019s where the books really start to get intense. Even though there was a part that brought tears to my eyes, its not as sad as whats yet to comeU+2026 <br><br>I feel like this book is the book of transitioning for Harry, Ron and Hermione. This is the last book of their childhood. If the movies follow the books as well as I hope, shit really starts to get real after this one. There is a lot of depth to this story, the characters and it gets a bit darker than the first three. I love the Tri-Wizard Tournament aspect and the new characters we meet. Once again, I listened to the audio book and the narration was fantastic. If youU+2019ve never read the books before, or your a long time fan- I highly recommend these audio books. The narrator does a fantastic job. I love getting lost in the world of Harry Potter and canU+2019t wait to read more <3 </span>  <a data-text-id="11112780626570906066" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1243659348" />    <a title="Kai" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/41788524-kai"><img alt="Kai" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1243659348?book_show_action=false">Oct 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Kai" class="user" name="Kai" href="/user/show/41788524-kai">Kai</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=finished-series">finished-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1243659348" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1657363500239639017"><i>U+201CDifferences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open.U+201D</i><br /><br />There are so many chapters and characters and details that make this book special. Here are some of my favourites:<br />1. S.P.E.W.<br />2. Hermione in every scene ever<br />3. The house elves and the kitchen scenes (I'm honestly so in love with the kitchens. Every time they tickle the pear in the portrait I get all excited)<br />4. Durmstrang and Beauxbatons<br />5. The Yule Ball and the fact that Harry thinks Hermione i</span>  <span id="freeText1657363500239639017" style="display:none"><i>U+201CDifferences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open.U+201D</i><br /><br />There are so many chapters and characters and details that make this book special. Here are some of my favourites:<br />1. S.P.E.W.<br />2. Hermione in every scene ever<br />3. The house elves and the kitchen scenes (I'm honestly so in love with the kitchens. Every time they tickle the pear in the portrait I get all excited)<br />4. Durmstrang and Beauxbatons<br />5. The Yule Ball and the fact that Harry thinks Hermione is a girl he's never seen before<br />6. The fact that Ron has a huge crush on Krum while Hermione stays utterly unimpressed and as soon as Krum takes her to the ball the situation changes, Hermione likes Krum and Ron rips him (well, miniature him) apart<br />7. Harry's fight with Ron. Not because I enjoy them fighting but because Jo perfectly captures the feeling of anger and frustration that I have everytime I'm in a similiar situation.<br />8. The Wonky Feint. I'm still laughing.<br />9. Rita Skeeter's reports. I love to hate her.<br />10. Severus Snape cold bloodedly claiming he can't see a difference when Hermione's teeth are half a metre longer than usual. This incredible man.<br />11. Molly Weasley being such a good mom to Harry. Got tears in my eyes just thinking about it.<br />12. Hermione's triumph over a vicious beetle.<br /><br />Still, the book is not my favourite in the series, the reason being the horrible graveyard scene in the end. It's just a little too much to take for my poor Potter heart.</span>  <a data-text-id="1657363500239639017" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1243659348">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1243659348" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1243659348&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1243659348'><a id="like_count_review_1243659348" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1243659348?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">129 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1243659348" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1243659348" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=129&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1243659348&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1243659348" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1243659348, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">9 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1243659348?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1243659348' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1243659348/comments?reverse=true">View all 9 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_158573009" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Tania Stevenson-Noyes" href="/user/show/46948498-tania-stevenson-noyes"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/46948498-tania-stevenson-noyes">Tania Stevenson-Noyes</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer18356797675945128774">aaahhh someones got a crush!! Kia nd Hermione sitting in a treeU+2026 KISSING</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Oct 30, 2016 02:15PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_158595475" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Kai" href="/user/show/41788524-kai"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1433887331p1/41788524.jpg" alt="41788524" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/41788524-kai">Kai</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer11641888936351336292">@lydia the books are so rich of detail I forgive you</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Oct 31, 2016 04:57AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1243659348' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1243659348, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_5475722" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5475722" />    <a title="Susan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/332008-susan"><img alt="Susan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1188658740p2/332008.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/5475722?book_show_action=false">Sep 04, 2007</a>      <a title="Susan" class="user" name="Susan" href="/user/show/332008-susan">Susan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer5475722" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18350737861670621877">Now THAT'S a book! The groove that J.K. Rowling starts to find in HP 3 is fully realized in 4. Partly it's that the kids (and therefore the readers) are getting older so she can delve into more adult, complex themes and situations, and partly it's that I think she's really finding her voice. We finally got our very own HP's, I am happy to report, and it's so funny to look at them all side by side b/c of the HUGE leap in size between 3 and 4. Then they get a little tricky b/c while 4 and 5 look</span>  <span id="freeText18350737861670621877" style="display:none">Now THAT'S a book! The groove that J.K. Rowling starts to find in HP 3 is fully realized in 4. Partly it's that the kids (and therefore the readers) are getting older so she can delve into more adult, complex themes and situations, and partly it's that I think she's really finding her voice. We finally got our very own HP's, I am happy to report, and it's so funny to look at them all side by side b/c of the HUGE leap in size between 3 and 4. Then they get a little tricky b/c while 4 and 5 look to be about the same length, the font in Order of the Phoenix is much smaller, hence a longer book. I just started that one and it honestly feels longer already. More of a book book and less of a fun afternoon's diversion. But I like these books as they get both darker and longer.<br /><br />But to focus on Goblet of Fire specifically for a moment...again, not that I think I can bring anything new to the table in discussing these books. Nevertheless, I'll throw a few ideas out there just for your reading pleasure. One thing that struck me, as I mentioned before, was the increasing maturity and complexity of situations and themes. Clearly having someone die is a huge deal and I found that whole series of events really moving this time around. I may have last time as well, but I don't remember. In a way, though, some of the more complex issues feel jarring next to the goofy concepts she originally created. Calling non-magical people "Muggles," for instance. It's just a stupid word and yes, it sounds funny and makes kids laugh, but sometimes it's hard to take all these people seriously. "Mud-bloods" on the other hand is vicious and definitely drives the point home. I just wonder if she was to do it over again if some of those terms or ideas would change a bit. Yes, we'd all like to revisit what we did/wrote when we were less sure of ourselves and our voices and ideas, but of course we can't and neither can she. And what do I know? She claims she always knew what would happen to Harry, so maybe for her "Muggle" is the ideal word.<br /><br />Since, as usual, I find it impossible to discuss the books without referencing the films, let me just say that although I hated Dobby in the movie (2?) and was glad to see him mostly cut from subsequent screen incarnations, I really loved him in this one. The dialogue is actually quite funny and Hermione's whole S.P.E.W. thing just cracks me up. Yes, I know a lot of people hate it and find it annoying and whatever, but I love it. Of course she would have a cause like that. That's who she is! And poor Winky. They're weird creatures (and OH how I love Kreacher in the next one!) and I can't decide whether I am with Hermione or everyone else on their "plight." Either way, I like that they exist; they provide a bit of moral ambiguity in a world that is mostly cleanly divided between good and evil. You might wonder about people, but for the most part they end up squarely one or the other. Other than Snape - another great piece of moral ambiguity whose complexity grows from book to book.<br /><br />I also continue to marvel at Rowling's ability to write about the teenage mind. Ron and Harry's fight is spot on, as are Hermione's various reactions to it. And oh these poor boys having to ask the girls to the feast. I wish I had known when I was in middle school how truly hard it was for boys to talk to girls like that. Although I probably wouldn't have cared, being the good self-involved teenger that I was. <br /><br />I still want to go to Hogwarts.</span>  <a data-text-id="18350737861670621877" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review5475722">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link5475722" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=5475722&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_5475722'><a id="like_count_review_5475722" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/5475722?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">73 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_5475722" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_5475722" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=73&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=5475722&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_5475722" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 5475722, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">7 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/5475722?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_5475722' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/5475722/comments?reverse=true">View all 7 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_104791671" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="PurplecU+00F6 U+00F6lcat" href="/user/show/32094355-purplec-lcat"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/32094355-purplec-lcat">PurplecU+00F6 U+00F6lcat</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer15847187330372616484">0-0</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 22, 2014 12:41PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_109481987" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Adonia" href="/user/show/33063782-adonia"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1410300664p1/33063782.jpg" alt="33063782" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/33063782-adonia">Adonia</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer8218328353355433366">Great review! you could make someone want to read this book just by that review!            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28636277-juliana-zapata?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1275394424" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7001803898419415219">Como todo el mundo me advirtiU+00F3 este libro estuvo mU+00E1s oscuro y la historia se complicU+00F3 bastante. Ame leer como empieza la adolescencia de los personajes, los celos de cada uno en determinadas situaciones y la forma en que afrontaban estas situaciones.<br /><br />Amando profundamente la historia y a todos sus personajes, leerlos crecer ha sido maravilloso <br /><br />ReseU+00F1a Completa: <a target="_blank" href="http://bastvilard.blogspot.com/2015/06/harry-potter-y-el-caliz-de-fuego.html"
