</div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1731044958" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1731044958" />    <a title="Kristina Horner" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3070540-kristina-horner"><img alt="Kristina Horner" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1425746408p2/3070540.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1731044958?book_show_action=false">Sep 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Kristina Horner" class="user" name="Kristina Horner" href="/user/show/3070540-kristina-horner">Kristina Horner</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3070540-kristina-horner?shelf=childhood-books">childhood-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3070540-kristina-horner?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3070540-kristina-horner?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1731044958" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10407026891088272943">This book was so much darker and sadder than I remembered - the crazy thing is, Goblet of Fire was always my least favorite as a kid because between the Qudditch World Cup and the Twiwizard Tournament, I just associated it with being the "sports one". But this book has SO MUCH GOING ON and it made me feel way more feels than I remembered, and it all really hit me in ways I hadnt expected. <br /><br />I'm so glad Harry has Molly Weasley, and Hagrid, and so many other wonderful people in his life. I couldn't</span>  <span id="freeText10407026891088272943" style="display:none">This book was so much darker and sadder than I remembered - the crazy thing is, Goblet of Fire was always my least favorite as a kid because between the Qudditch World Cup and the Twiwizard Tournament, I just associated it with being the "sports one". But this book has SO MUCH GOING ON and it made me feel way more feels than I remembered, and it all really hit me in ways I hadnt expected. <br /><br />I'm so glad Harry has Molly Weasley, and Hagrid, and so many other wonderful people in his life. I couldn't believe how real the argument between Dumbledore and Cornelius Fudge felt at the end, when Fudge refused to believe Voldemort was back. I had forgotten so many details about Winky's part in the book, and Rita Skeeter, and the overall delightfulness of Hermione's weird relationship with Victor. <br /><br />I enjoyed this reread immensely. Favorite book so far of my adult reread of Harry Potter.</span>  <a data-text-id="10407026891088272943" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1731044958">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1731044958" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1731044958&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1731044958'><a id="like_count_review_1731044958" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1731044958?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">71 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1731044958" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1731044958" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=71&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1731044958&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1731044958" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1731044958, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">5 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1731044958?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1731044958' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1731044958/comments?reverse=true">View all 5 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_156537110" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="tharcblack" href="/user/show/27690977-tharcblack"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1407931706p1/27690977.jpg" alt="27690977" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/27690977-tharcblack">tharcblack</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer16375760811360878059">This is my absolute favourite book of all the series. It's the middle one, the turning point, and the one where Harry did NOT actively seek out</span>  <span id="freeText16375760811360878059" style="display:none">This is my absolute favourite book of all the series. It's the middle one, the turning point, and the one where Harry did NOT actively seek out trouble, yet all the trouble found a way to get to him. It's just amazing.</span>  <a data-text-id="16375760811360878059" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Sep 08, 2016 06:16AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_156810637" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Eddie Owens" class="section">      <div id="review_128162676" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/128162676" />    <a title="Katya" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4324634-katya"><img alt="Katya" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1285183076p2/4324634.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/128162676?book_show_action=false">Jul 27, 2011</a>      <a title="Katya" class="user" name="Katya" href="/user/show/4324634-katya">Katya</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9789544466213" href="/book/show/7339102">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=horrible-best-friends">horrible-best-friends</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=horror">horror</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=teen-lit">teen-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=2011">2011</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=oh-come-on">oh-come-on</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=kudos-for-the-worldbuilding">kudos-for-the-worldbuilding</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=for-nostalgia-s-sake">for-nostalgia-s-sake</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4324634-katya?shelf=the-harry-potter-challenge">the-harry-potter-challenge</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer128162676" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5798028128285611997"><b> Here be warned: This review contains cursing. </b><br /><br />Greetings, loved ones, and let us talk of a young witch named Hermione Granger.<br /><br />Hermione is, and always has been, a delight to read. Not necessarily because she's a girl, but because she is the only character amongst those 14 year olds who actually has a good head on her shoulders. <br /><br />When I was young and gullible, I hated this book. Hated how it killed off Cedric and how bloody the series got afterwards. I hated it enough to renounce the franchize. Now</span>  <span id="freeText5798028128285611997" style="display:none"><b> Here be warned: This review contains cursing. </b><br /><br />Greetings, loved ones, and let us talk of a young witch named Hermione Granger.<br /><br />Hermione is, and always has been, a delight to read. Not necessarily because she's a girl, but because she is the only character amongst those 14 year olds who actually has a good head on her shoulders. <br /><br />When I was young and gullible, I hated this book. Hated how it killed off Cedric and how bloody the series got afterwards. I hated it enough to renounce the franchize. Now that I re-read it, I still hate it, but for all different reasons. Cedric, on second reading, is as dull as toast (so I guess the movie casting must have been really spot-on). Harry has finally started to shed his unnatural maturity, and has turned just as obnoxious as most boys at 13. Ron is a wanker. So it's beyond me why Hermione hasn't stolen the spotlight here, as she is easily the most relatable character of them all.<br /><br />Let's look at her character - she is from a muggle family, but through hard work she has become the best student in the school. She studies hard, follows the rules, but makes exceptions when the circumstances are right. She comes off as stuck-up at first, but looks after her friends. She keeps her promises, even though she barely has time to take care of herself. And yet Ron is Harry's best friend, not her.<br /><br />Why?<br /><br />Harry and Ron are much closer than Harry and Hermione. In the previous book, Hermione was at odds with the boys not one, but twice, and that put a serious hinge on their friendship. Even so, that doesn't nearly come close to the drama that follows Harry and Ron's falling out in this book. And then, when they do make up, Hermione is once again pushed back as a tercery best friend, even though she sacrificed her efforts and sleep in order to help Harry learn a spell that would save his skinny ass.<br /><br />Hermione is defined by her intelligence. It falls squarely on her shoulders to help the guys when they're in a pickle - whenever they discover that rushing at an obstackle headfirst isn't going to cut it, they turn to her for advice, and she's also acutely aware of issues of inequality. In this book, she actually starts an organisation to help house elves! She stands up for Hagrid when Rita Skeeter takes a sling at him, and she kept Lupin's secret for months in book three simply because she believed he was a good guy! And where do her efforts to promote equality lead to? They're used for comedic relief.<br /><br />It's equally disgusting how little the boys seem to appreciate her. Not only do they refuse to take her seriously, they consider she's for granted. I mean, sure, Harry has lived with his relatives as an upper middle class brat (a much abused middle class brat), but Hermione's parents are dentists and yet she has a better awareness of social issues than he does! Is Rowling trying to suggest that young activism is only for women, because only women seem aware of these issues?<br /><br />But that's not even the worst this book gets. On the Yule Ball, Harry and Ron take ages before they realize Hermione is a girl, and thus, qualified to be a dance partner (obiously, they can't go with each other, altough it would be most logical, what with all the sparks flying among them). Hermione, though, refuses to be taken for granted. She knows she deserves better than to be a go-to girl, and she does - she gets to be Viktor Krum's date, and she damn well got someone who appreciates her! But are her friends happy for her? No, they're shocked, and in Ron's case, offended, that she dared *gasp* make plans without them! Ron goes as far as to make a scene - in which he (not for the first time) makes Hermione cry. This was supposed to establish some beginnings of the love between Hermione and Ron, but, quite frankly, it just makes Ron look like a wanker. <br /><br />After Rita Skeeter's article, Hermione becomes the target for bullying which, in some cases, turns rather dangerous. Grown-up witches send her hate mail packed with all sorts of deadly stuff, one of which makes the skin of her hands fall off. Ron's commentary? She should have seen it coming, messing around with the paparazzi like that. I bet the bumrag was happy she got punished for liking Krum. But that's not even what's most disturbing about this thing - it's that witches who have never even met Hermione before are willing to take Skeeter's word for it, even if the woman's as trustworthy as a snake. Even Mrs. Weasley, whose own husband got blackened twice in "The Daily Prophet", believes her! Nice message for female solidarity, Ms Rowling, real subtle.<br /><br />Again, I ask, why can't Hermione be the hero of these series? I don't think I'm alone in thinking it could be so much <a href="http://globalcomment.com/2011/in-praise-of-hermione-granger-series/" rel="nofollow">better</a>. </span>  <a data-text-id="5798028128285611997" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review128162676">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link128162676" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=128162676&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_128162676'><a id="like_count_review_128162676" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/128162676?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">66 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_128162676" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_128162676" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=66&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=128162676&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_128162676" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 128162676, true, &#39;&#39;); But the reason hermione isn't the main character is because she's too perfect.</span>  <span id="freeText1714238580436363939" style="display:none">I agree hermione is amazing and the boys can be real prats towards her. But the reason hermione isn't the main character is because she's too perfect. What's great about Harry and Ron is that they DEFINITELY have flaws. And most 14 and 15 year old girls and boys aren't as perfect as hermione. Also hermione's efforts to stop unfair social issues aren't comedic relief. Rowling does a good job of bringing both cards to the table regarding elf rights. Hermione has a good point elves are abused and are taken advantage of. But Ron also has a point. They LIKE it. In a demented way they like it. So she does a very good job of bringing all sides to the issue and how complex it is. It really make the readers think. Also as regard as to why Harry is close to Ron as opposed hermione, it's because they're on the same level. Harry's maturity level is closer to Ron so of course they connect more. Hermione is a step above maturity wise so i feel like the boys have a harder time connecting. Anyway, I agree hermione is AMAZING and deserves better treatment but I also think it's realistic how Rowling writes it (as sad as it is).</span>  <a data-text-id="1714238580436363939" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jul 05, 2016 07:26PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div id="freeTextContainer16654426118050736472">Harry Potter changed my life. If I hadnU+2019t read Harry Potter when I did I would not be the same person today. What I am today, in a part is due to Harry. I cannot really say enough to make you understand how much Harry Potter means to me. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review388324260">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link388324260" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=388324260&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_388324260'><a id="like_count_review_388324260" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/388324260?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">65 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_388324260" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_388324260" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=65&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=388324260&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_388324260" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 388324260, true, &#39;&#39;);  <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span   <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span href="/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow">Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=5-star-books">5-star-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=books-of-summer-16">books-of-summer-16</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer149067300" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9244231931873327941"><b>7/1/16:</b><br /><br />Finished my re-read! .... God this one really took me forever. It's so long. But it's still one of my favorites! Might write a better review at some point. Old review under the cut. <br /><br />-------<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<b>Original review (4/9/11):</b><br /><br />Ack! I am hopelessly behind on book reviews. I read this, like, two weeks ago and I've read four other books since then. I am a bad little book reviewer *bashes head against wall* Although, it's not like a ton of people read my reviews, I guess. I just like writin</span></span>  <span id="freeText9244231931873327941" style="display:none"><b>7/1/16:</b><br /><br />Finished my re-read! .... God this one really took me forever. It's so long. But it's still one of my favorites! Might write a better review at some point. Old review under the cut. <br /><br />-------<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<b>Original review (4/9/11):</b><br /><br />Ack! I am hopelessly behind on book reviews. I read this, like, two weeks ago and I've read four other books since then. I am a bad little book reviewer *bashes head against wall* Although, it's not like a ton of people read my reviews, I guess. I just like writing them because it makes me feel smarter-er. :)<br /><br />So yeah, HARRY FREAKING POTTER. If you haven't been reading my reviews of the past three booksU+2013 U+2013yes, I'm reading them for the first time. I know, shocking. Whenever people see me reading them at school they're like, "Haha, reading Harry Potter again?" and I'm like "Meep U+2026 This is the first time." And everyone's like, "WHAAAAAAAAT?!" *cowers* I know, I know. I'm terribly behind on the times.<br /><br />Well, anyway. As for actually reviewing this thing.<br /><br />This was definitely my favorite so far. Without a doubt. I liked the first three, but not as much. In the first three, I had some issues with pacing and the writing style, etc. The first was really rushed, the second was better, the third was good but only really addicting toward the end ... But this one, I was hooked pretty much the entire time. I tend to be skeptical of chunky books, but I think this one benefited from being longU+2013 U+2013and the first two definitely could have benefited from being longer, since they both involved a lot of events in rapid succession that could have used some down-time in between.<br /><br />So yeah, this one was epic. The plot was fast-paced but not confusing-fast as it was in the earlier books. There was more action, the characters were developed a lot more (I like them waaaay better now), and the over-all mood was darker and more intriguing. Kind of exhausting to read, being so long, but after taking a short break I'm eager to keep reading. :) <br /><br />I guess the only small issue I still have is that there's always some kind of "BWA HAHA!" speech at the end of every book. That is, there's a lot of mystery in each book and lots of little clues, and at the end someone has to bother explaining how it all worked out for, like, ten pages ... It's like one of those action movies where the villain ties down the hero and says, "I BET YOU'LL NEVER GUESS HOW I MANAGED TO ACCOMPLISH ALL THIS. MWA HA HA!" And it's like ... Yes, you're very clever. But I think in reality you'd just kill him ... Ah, well. It all has to get explained somehow.<br /><br />Anyway, I LURVE IT. Time to read the next three. :)  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="9244231931873327941" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review149067300">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link149067300" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=149067300&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_149067300'><a id="like_count_review_149067300" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/149067300?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">59 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_149067300" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_149067300" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=59&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=149067300&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_149067300" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 149067300, true, &#39;&#39;);  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_381016778" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/381016778" />    <a title="Evgeny" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9340136-evgeny"><img alt="Evgeny" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1349810697p2/9340136.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/381016778?book_show_action=false">Feb 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Evgeny" class="user" name="Evgeny" href="/user/show/9340136-evgeny">Evgeny</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810576" href="/book/show/7979788-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9340136-evgeny?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer381016778" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17817318073621739712">Harry Potter's fourth year at Hogwarts. His enemies still want to kill him (what else is new?) and this time they use a very elaborate scheme to do just that. Poor Boy Who Lived have to fight ever more difficult challenges on the top of his ever more difficult classes.<br><br>In case somebody still did not get a clue that the series left children book territory in the end of the previous book, this one begins with a chapter seemingly taken straight from an adult horror story instead of showing Harry's m</span>  <span id="freeText17817318073621739712" style="display:none">Harry Potter's fourth year at Hogwarts. His enemies still want to kill him (what else is new?) and this time they use a very elaborate scheme to do just that. Poor Boy Who Lived have to fight ever more difficult challenges on the top of his ever more difficult classes.<br><br>In case somebody still did not get a clue that the series left children book territory in the end of the previous book, this one begins with a chapter seemingly taken straight from an adult horror story instead of showing Harry's misery with his life with his adoptive parents as was always the case before. The said misery starts in the second chapter. This novel is also practically as big as the first three put together.<br><br>The structure of the book looks strange if you stop the (exciting) read and think about it. The beginning and the end of it are quite gloomy and contain some horror elements while the middle part is actually quite humorous and lighthearted at times. Surprisingly it actually works. <br><br>We finally got to see other schools of wizardry, their headmasters and some of their pupils. Some new fascinating (both in good and bad sense) and important people are introduced. Some interesting people/creatures are back (go Dobby!!!). Good people die. No resolution is in sight by the end and the situation became much worth than it was in the beginning. <br><br>Somebody mentioned that in this book the reader gets to live in Hogwarts; I missed this the first time around rushing through all the excitement of the events, but I noticed this during the reread. <i>The freaking School of Wizardry feels alive and real!</i> <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1454431135i/17961297.jpg" width="340" height="220" alt="Hogwarts Castle" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>This is not a small feat of the author. This is also the reason I gave the higher rating this time. <br><br>Harry Potter: read it; experience it; live it. </span>  <a data-text-id="17817318073621739712" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review381016778">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link381016778" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=381016778&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_381016778'><a id="like_count_review_381016778" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/381016778?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">58 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_381016778" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_381016778" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=58&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=381016778&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_381016778" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 381016778, true, &#39;&#39;); p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=childrens-books">childrens-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1696979465" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12825298996914954622"><b> <i>"Dark times lie ahead of us, and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right."</i> </b><br /><br /><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> is by far the best book in the series that IU+2019ve read so far.<br /><br />Considering how absolutely fucking horrible the middle part is, that should say something about how much I actually enjoyed the ending.<br /><br />Most of the book is pointless filler material with silly teenagers being silly teenagers. I was ready to hand out one star and really wanted to just put</span>  <span id="freeText12825298996914954622" style="display:none"><b>  <i>"Dark times lie ahead of us, and there will be a time when we must choose between what is easy and what is right."</i></b><br /><br /><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> is by far the best book in the series that IU+2019ve read so far.<br /><br />Considering how absolutely fucking horrible the middle part is, that should say something about how much I actually enjoyed the ending.<br /><br />Most of the book is pointless filler material with silly teenagers being silly teenagers. I was ready to hand out one star and really wanted to just put the book down. But then, after a lot of unnecessary suffering, something happened.<br /><br />Alone in DumbledoreU+2019s office, Harry found a curious device that led to one of the best scenes in the series so far.<br /><br />A few chapters later, Harry touched a trophy, that led to another of the best scenes in the series so far.<br /><br />From that point on, the book was gold.</span>  <a data-text-id="12825298996914954622" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1696979465">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1696979465" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1696979465&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1696979465'><a id="like_count_review_1696979465" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1696979465?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">58 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1696979465" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1696979465" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=58&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1696979465&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1696979465" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1696979465, true, &#39;&#39;); itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1756630465" />    <a title="Reynita Maharani U+2605 The Night Reader U+2605" class="left imgcol" class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1756630465?book_show_action=false">Oct 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Reynita Maharani U+2605 The Night Reader U+2605" class="user" name="Reynita Maharani U+2605 The Night Reader U+2605" href="/user/show/43850323-reynita-maharani-the-night-reader">Reynita Maharani U+2605 The Night Reader U+2605</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43850323-reynita-maharani-the-night-reader?shelf=cover-lust">cover-lust</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"      This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1756630465&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1756630465" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12675303381204299081"><s>REVIEW TO COME ON SATURDAY ^^</s><br><br><b>4.8 Stars</b><br><br><i> <b>" Lord Voldemort's gift for spreading discord and enmity is very great. We can fight it only by showing an equally strong bond of friendship and trust, Differences of habit and languages are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open. "</b> </i><br><br><u> <b>My Opinion</b> </u><br><br>OMG!! This book! lot of things happened and I'm still in shocked. <br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1383164879ra/6422755.gif" width="250" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>okay let's begin with Cedric Diggory. <br><br><u> <b>My Most Saddest Scene</b> </u><br><br>Cedric was a nice guy and he was really sweet and I liked him.</span>  <span id="freeText12675303381204299081" style="display:none"><s>REVIEW TO COME ON SATURDAY ^^</s><br><br><b>4.8 Stars</b><br><br><i>  <b>" Lord Voldemort's gift for spreading discord and enmity is very great. We can fight it only by showing an equally strong bond of friendship and trust, Differences of habit and languages are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open. "</b></i><br><br><u>  <b>My Opinion</b></u><br><br>OMG!! This book! lot of things happened and I'm still in shocked. <br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1383164879ra/6422755.gif" width="250" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>okay let's begin with Cedric Diggory. <br><br><u>  <b>My Most Saddest Scene</b></u><br><br>Cedric was a nice guy and he was really sweet and I liked him. I was so shocked when he died because I thought he would be alive until the last book and he died so fast that I just sat on my bed and I was like " What did just happen? " I still can't believe he died in such a young age and it was all because of Voldemort. <br>Oh! and I was so proud of Harry too! he's so kind that he suggested Cedric to hold the cup with him, So there would be two winners not only Harry or Cedric and I was so confused who I wanted to get the cup first, I liked Cedric but I also liked Harry. So I was very happy when Harry suggested that but that happiness vanished as fast as it came. The cup was a portkey and the cup transported them to Voldemort and Cedric died so fast that I didn't even cry. I was just so shocked.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475345061ra/20713009.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>because what would Harry say to his parents?! and I was so worried what about if they blamed Harry for this ?!? but thankfully that didn't happen. Cedric's parents were very sad but they didn't blame Harry. They even thanked him for returning Cedric's body to them. <br><br><u>  <b>My Favotite Scenes</b></u><br><br>I think there is something change between Hermione and Ron.<br>Ron was so mad when Hermione went to the ball with Viktor. He said it was because Viktor was from Drumstrang and he said Hermione was fraternizing with the enemy. But I still don't believe this at all. Before Hermione went to the ball with Viktor, Ron liked Viktor so much that he even wanted to get his autograph and I think he acted like that because he was jealous. hahaha. it was so funny and sweet to see Ron got jealous and there's also this scene : <br><br><i>'Known what?' said Ron quickly. 'You haven't been mixing up Love Potions, have you?'<br>'Don't be stupid,' Hermione snapped, starting to pound up her beetles again. ' No, it's just ... how did she know Viktor asked me to visit him over the summer?'<br>Hermione blushed scarlet as she said this and determinedly avoided Ron's eyes. <br>'What?' said Ron, dropping his pestle with a loud clunk.<br>'He asked me right after he'd pulled me out of the lake,' Hermione muttered. 'After he'd got rid of his shark's head. Madam Pomfrey gave us both blankets and then he sort of pulled me away from the judges so they wouldn't hear, and he said, if I wasn't doing anything over the summer, would I like to -'<br>'And what did you say?' said Ron, who had picked up his pestle and was grinding it on the desk, a good six inches from his bowl, because he was looking at Hermione. <br>'and he did say he'd never felt the same way about anyone else,'<br>Hermione went on, going so red now that Harry could almost feel the heat coming from her, 'but how could Rita Skeeter have heard him? She wasn't there ... or was she? Maybe she has got an invisibility Cloak, maybe she sneaked into the grounds to watch the second task ...' <br>'And what did you say?' Ron repeated, pounding his pestle down so hard it dented the desk. <br>'Well, I was too busy seeing whether you and Harry were OK to -'<br></i><br>but before she could finish that sentence Snape came. Ugh. why did he have to come when she hadn't finish it!?!? <br>but that scene was sweet and funny wasn't it?! AHH MY HEART!!<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475349710ra/20713411.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><u>  <b>The Plot Twist</b></u> <br><br>The plot twist in this book was better than the plot twist in first book, second book and third book. <br>I swear I didn't expect that at all! I thought the bad guy was Ludo Bagman because he acted so strange. He asked Harry whether he wanted his help or not and so I thought he was the bad guy. then there was a scene where Moody was the bad guy but he wasn't Moody. he was the imposter of Moody and the real Moody was imprisoned in his own trunk and this imposter was Barty Crouch's son. <br><br>Thank you for reading and liking this review, guys! hope you all have a great weekend! return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1756630465">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1756630465" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1756630465&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1756630465'><a id="like_count_review_1756630465" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1756630465?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">76 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1756630465" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1756630465" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=76&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1756630465&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1756630465" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1756630465, true, &#39;&#39;);            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29931457-franco-santos?shelf=libros-en-digital">libros-en-digital</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1245740844" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1906923454115147018"><b>Excelencia pura</b>. Me encantU+00F3. Creo que este es mi favorito de la saga por ahora. En <i>Harry Potter y el CU+00E1liz de Fuego</i> se desarrolla una prosa mU+00E1s madura y oscura. No puedo decir nada mU+00E1s; mi amor por este libro es indescriptible.<br /><br /><i>U+2014SaludU+00E9monos con una inclinaciU+00F3n, Harry U+2014dijo Voldemort, agachU+00E1ndose un poco, pero sin dejar de presentar a Harry su cara de serpienteU+2014. Vamos, hay que comportarse como caballeros... A Dumbledore le gustarU+00EDa que hicieras gala de tus buenos modales.<b> InclU+00EDnate ante la muerte</b></i></span>  <span id="freeText1906923454115147018" style="display:none"><b>Excelencia pura</b>. Me encantU+00F3. Creo que este es mi favorito de la saga por ahora. En <i>Harry Potter y el CU+00E1liz de Fuego</i> se desarrolla una prosa mU+00E1s madura y oscura. No puedo decir nada mU+00E1s; mi amor por este libro es indescriptible.<br /><br /><i>U+2014SaludU+00E9monos con una inclinaciU+00F3n, Harry U+2014dijo Voldemort, agachU+00E1ndose un poco, pero sin dejar de presentar a Harry su cara de serpienteU+2014. Vamos, hay que comportarse como caballeros... A Dumbledore le gustarU+00EDa que hicieras gala de tus buenos modales.<b> InclU+00EDnate ante la muerte, Harry.</b></i></span>  <a data-text-id="1906923454115147018" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1245740844">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1245740844" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1245740844&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1245740844'><a id="like_count_review_1245740844" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1245740844?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">55 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1245740844" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1245740844" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=55&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1245740844&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1245740844" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1245740844, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1541463284?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Adita U+2728The Slumbering InsomniacU+2728" class="user" name="Adita U+2728The Slumbering InsomniacU+2728" href="/user/show/37265034-adita-the-slumbering-insomniac">Adita U+2728The Slumbering InsomniacU+2728</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">The whole universe </span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Adita U+2728The Slumbering InsomniacU+2728 by: </span>      The whole world and beyond   </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37265034-adita-the-slumbering-insomniac?shelf=wizards-and-witches-and-hogwarts">wizards-and-witches-and-hogwarts</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1541463284" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6085882072411178740"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457703974i/18391345.jpg" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>(Using stars lavishly, because, hey, it's Harry Potter!)<br><br><b>SPOILER ALERT:</b><br>I always thought that I was the last person on Earth to read Harry Potter, turns out, to my great relief, that there are many good people who are still waiting in the line. I would normally never care to attach spoiler alert with Harry Potter(what's there to spoil), but statistics tell otherwise. So, I don't want people flinging their shoes at me, least of all an Imperius or Cruciatus curse. <br><br>This book will always be the most f</span>  <span id="freeText6085882072411178740" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457703974i/18391345.jpg" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50<br>(Using stars lavishly, because, hey, it's Harry Potter!)<br><br><b>SPOILER ALERT:</b><br>I always thought that I was the last person on Earth to read Harry Potter, turns out, to my great relief, that there are many good people who are still waiting in the line. I would normally never care to attach spoiler alert with Harry Potter(what's there to spoil), but statistics tell otherwise. So, I don't want people flinging their shoes at me, least of all an Imperius or Cruciatus curse. <br><br>This book will always be the most favorite one for me for many reasons, the most important reason being <b>Cedric Diggory.</b> Unlike other books, this one gave us someone else too to dote on, other than the indefatigable trio- <b>Harry, Hermione and Ron.</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1474040174ra/20546827.gif" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>THE TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT:</b><br><br>U+23E9Any year that exempts Harry from taking the <i>year-end exams</i> has got to be the best one, even though he was granted the concession only in the light of other scarier tasks. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1474040174ra/20546828.gif" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>U+23E9This is the year when the rivalry between houses has a slightly subdued presence as <b>the Beauxbatons and the Durmstrang</b> crowd arrives. In the face of stiff international competition, the rare display of <i>camaraderie between Hufflepuff and Gryffindor</i> is an indicator that Dumbledore's party is capable of standing united to tackle the external adversary, whether it is only the harmless fellow wizarding schools or a more nefarious death eater or the ultimate Dark Lord himself. <br><br>U+23E9No other untoward incident in any of the previous Harry Potter books hurt as much as the horrific death of the charming, beloved Cedric Diggory. <br><br>U+274EIf anything ever made me strongly convinced of the unfairness of the whole affair, it was <i>Cedric's death.</i><br><br>U+274EIf anything ever made Voldemort utterly inexcusable, then it was Cedric's terrible end. <br><br><span>[image error]</span><br><br>Rowling has always exercised caution in doling out punishments unnecessarily to the undeserving people, but, maybe she wanted the Triwizard Cup to be a <i>turning point.</i> The moment Cedric and Harry touched the cup was also the moment that brought contradictory, unhappy feelings to our hitherto always-feel-good Harry Potter moments. Maybe Rowling wanted to rouse the bland, simmering-beneath-the-surface sentiments of the readers into a raging inferno that is ready to devour the evil Voldemort, if the readers ever succeed in finding their platform <i>Nine And Three Quarters.</i> <br><br><b>UGLY GETS MORE UGLY. </b><br>U+23E9If for all these days, we have been associating words like slime, filth, crawling-skin with Voldemort, things have just gotten <i>slimier, filthier and more skin crawling!</i> Yeww, we finally get to see the devil with its lock, stock and barrel. Do we like what we see? <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1474040174ra/20546830.gif" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>U+23E9Finally, subtlety? You gotta learn it from the fraudulent <b>Moody.</b> Things are not going to be the same, but y'all accept that there was a fleeting moment when you wanted to hurl unforgivable curses at him? Poor chap! <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1474040174ra/20546831.gif" width="400" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Anyway, we need to watch out for the slimeball with slits for nose! </span>  <a data-text-id="6085882072411178740" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div      </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1461307444" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18094886761790430442"><b> 3.5 Stars. </b><br /><br /><i>"Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open." </i><br /><br />I would have loved this as a kid. <br /><br />JK Rowling has made a phenomenal world. <br /><br />Pre-read: 22 is not too late an age to read this series for the first time, right!? The first three were read aloud to me while I was pregnant with my first and on bed rest... That was three years ago. It's time to continue this reading journey! Yes, I'm aware I'm realllyyy late to this party. </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_8073908" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/8073908" />    <a title="Carmen Maloy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/563625-carmen-maloy"><img alt="Carmen Maloy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1195667618p2/563625.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/8073908?book_show_action=false">Oct 22, 2007</a>      <a title="Carmen Maloy" class="user" name="Carmen Maloy" href="/user/show/563625-carmen-maloy">Carmen Maloy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Everyone</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer8073908" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2219090074970818440">What stands out in book 4:<br /><br />* Hermione's disgust at the reception for the veela (Bulgarian National Team Mascots) at the Quidditch World Cup. Rowling's fourth book addresses issues about growing up--the dynamic between the boys and girls at Hogwarts starts to change. Nowhere is this more plain than the hilarious scene in which magical cheerleaders nearly convince Harry and Ron to jump from the stands to impress them. <br />* Viktor Krum's crush on Hermione--and Ron's objection to it. <br />* Malfoy's "Potter</span>  <span id="freeText2219090074970818440" style="display:none">What stands out in book 4:<br /><br />* Hermione's disgust at the reception for the veela (Bulgarian National Team Mascots) at the Quidditch World Cup. Rowling's fourth book addresses issues about growing up--the dynamic between the boys and girls at Hogwarts starts to change. Nowhere is this more plain than the hilarious scene in which magical cheerleaders nearly convince Harry and Ron to jump from the stands to impress them. <br />* Viktor Krum's crush on Hermione--and Ron's objection to it. <br />* Malfoy's "Potter Stinks" badge. <br />* Hermione's creation of S.P.E.W., the intolerant bigotry of the Death Eaters, and the danger of the Triwizard Tournament. Add in the changing dynamics between girls and boys at Hogwarts, and suddenly Rowling's fourth book has a weight and seriousness not as present in early books in the series. Candy and tickle spells are left behind as the students tackle darker, more serious issues and take on larger responsibilities, including the knowledge of illegal curses. <br />* We encounter death in this book the likes we haven't seen before (R.I.P. Cedric Diggory)<br />* We get a glimpse of the friendship and absolute loyalty that is shown to Harry by Ron and Hermione (after Ron throws his little hissy fit of course and comes to his senses)<br /><br /><br />Amazon Review<br />In Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, J.K. Rowling offers up equal parts danger and delight--and any number of dragons, house-elves, and death-defying challenges. Now 14, her orphan hero has only two more weeks with his Muggle relatives before returning to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Yet one night a vision harrowing enough to make his lightning-bolt-shaped scar burn has Harry on edge and contacting his godfather-in-hiding, Sirius Black. Happily, the prospect of attending the season's premier sporting event, the Quidditch World Cup, is enough to make Harry momentarily forget that Lord Voldemort and his sinister familiars--the Death Eaters--are out for murder.<br />Readers, we will cast a giant invisibility cloak over any more plot and reveal only that You-Know-Who is very much after Harry and that this year there will be no Quidditch matches between Gryffindor, Ravenclaw, Hufflepuff, and Slytherin. Instead, Hogwarts will vie with two other magicians' schools, the stylish Beauxbatons and the icy Durmstrang, in a Triwizard Tournament. Those chosen to compete will undergo three supreme tests. Could Harry be one of the lucky contenders? <br /><br /><br />Long before her fourth installment appeared, Rowling warned that it would be darker, and it's true that every exhilaration is equaled by a moment that has us fearing for Harry's life, the book's emotions running as deep as its dangers. Along the way, though, she conjures up such new characters as Alastor "Mad-Eye" Moody, a Dark Wizard catcher who may or may not be getting paranoid in his old age, and Rita Skeeter, who beetles around Hogwarts in search of stories. (This Daily Prophet scoop artist has a Quick-Quotes Quill that turns even the most innocent assertion into tabloid innuendo.) And at her bedazzling close, Rowling leaves several plot strands open, awaiting book 5. This fan is ready to wager that the author herself is part veela--her pen her wand, her commitment to her world complete.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="2219090074970818440" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1743127847" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1743127847" />    <a title="Shahad takleef" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef"><img alt="Shahad takleef" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453881901p2/35406752.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1743127847?book_show_action=false">Sep 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Shahad takleef" class="user" name="Shahad takleef" href="/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef">Shahad takleef</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1743127847" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16552999743235834520">Sometimes I come across a Great book and I rate it 5 stars , and it doesn't feel enough , then I remember Hazel grace's words <s>or Jhon green's</s><b> " But that wasn't quite right. I called it a nine because I was saving my ten. " </b> and i ask my self <i>" Why did i rate all these books five before ? why didn't I save my five ?"</i><br>But then i look back at all these books and they all deserve it wholeheartedly . <br>The thing is , this book deserves more , and i don't know what I'm going to do with the next books . w</span>  <span id="freeText16552999743235834520" style="display:none">Sometimes I come across a Great book and I rate it 5 stars , and it doesn't feel enough , then I remember Hazel grace's words <s>or Jhon green's</s><b> " But that wasn't quite right. I called it a nine because I was saving my ten. " </b> and i ask my self <i>" Why did i rate all these books five before ? why didn't I save my five ?"</i><br>But then i look back at all these books and they all deserve it wholeheartedly . <br>The thing is , this book deserves more , and i don't know what I'm going to do with the next books . whom , very surly , are going to be even better .<br><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456635411i/18259617.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>this book is spine-tingling , impressive , even startling inspite of the fact that I've already watched the movie !!<br>I can never find a boring or uninteresting moment in The Goblet of Fire , it's so easy to lose one's self in it with these astounding events and distinctive characters . the plot was complicated and twisted throughout the incredible length of this novel . <br>Rowling while adding length with every new HP novel , she also adds strength . This is the best in Harry Potter series , it seems to get stronger with every next book . <br>I love the writing , the pacing does magic , its fast paced almost breathtaking . I love Sirius, Dumbledore and Hagrid. And I have to admit that Snape is also one of my favorite characters . and there is also Krum and Cedric and the way Hermione is all represented in a new way here and we still have Ron and Harry .<br>all these incredible characters !! its heart warming .<br>this book is definitely darker and more emotionally evolving . there is also this steady character development , its plain fantastic !! the way the book grows as its characters do , like its neither children nor adult series , its simply a series to grow up with . <br>And last but not least , there is the way it starts , rather than the usual with the Dursleys having breakfast and all , it opens fifty years before the present day with the Riddles , the frank scene and then Somewhere , Harry Potter, a fourteen years old orphan , wakes to a nightmare with a throbbing pain in the scar on his forehead .<br><br><blockquote>  <b>U+201CIt matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.U+201D </b></blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="16552999743235834520" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1253878907" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1253878907" />    <a title="Steve" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2314568-steve"><img alt="Steve" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1253878907?book_show_action=false">Apr 21, 2015</a>      <a title="Steve" class="user" name="Steve" href="/user/show/2314568-steve">Steve</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=rmfao-2015-genre-challenge">rmfao-2015-genre-challenge</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya">ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1253878907" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3842728298233412778">I'm not going to try to review this book or add any new thoughts to the thousands of reviews that are already all over the web. I do have a few observations about this book though.<br /><br />5 stars<br /><br />The first, and probably the most obvious, observation I have is that this is the first of the series that didn't start out with Harry struggling over the abuse he's taking at the Dursley's home. This one started out <b>much</b> darker, focusing on He-Who-Shall-Not-Be-Named and his initial attempts to regain his physica</span>  <span id="freeText3842728298233412778" style="display:none">I'm not going to try to review this book or add any new thoughts to the thousands of reviews that are already all over the web. I do have a few observations about this book though.<br /><br />5 stars<br /><br />The first, and probably the most obvious, observation I have is that this is the first of the series that didn't start out with Harry struggling over the abuse he's taking at the Dursley's home. This one started out <b>much</b> darker, focusing on He-Who-Shall-Not-Be-Named and his initial attempts to regain his physical form.<br /><br />Second, while this is still a kids' book, the are some very strong, very dark undertones throughout the entire book. The storyline moved from the "Scooby-Doo" format to something along the lines of dark fantasy, which happened at about the 80% point of this book. I wouldn't go so far as to compare it to George R. R. Martin or Joe Abercrombie, but the underlying threat and potential violence is definitely there. The twists in this one are surprising, especially in finding out who falls on which side, both good and evil.<br /><br />Third, this is the first book of the series to end without concluding the main storyline. The first three were like a 70s sitcom, resolving some problem within the half-hour time frame of that week's episode. In this one, very little is resolved. Harry, Ron, and Hermione are headed home after their fourth year, exhausted from the climax of the Triwizard Tournament, but it's almost a cliffhanger, especially with Hagrid's comments about preparing, taking things as they come, and not worrying before hand.<br /><br />On to <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix__Harry_Potter___5_" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (Harry Potter, #5) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a>!</span>  <a data-text-id="3842728298233412778" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1253878907">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1253878907" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1253878907&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1253878907'><a id="like_count_review_1253878907" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1253878907?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">27 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1253878907" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1253878907" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=27&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1253878907&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1253878907" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1253878907, true, &#39;&#39;); id="reviewTextContainer1206411197" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17372953070753782791"><blockquote>Si quieres saber cU+00F3mo es alguien, mira de quU+00E9 manera trata a sus inferiores, no a sus iguales.</blockquote><br />Perfecto desde la primera pU+00E1gina hasta la U+00FAltima<br /><br />A estas alturas ya casi todos conocen a <i>Harry Potter</i> y lo maravillosa que es J.K. Rowling, asU+00ED que no hay mucho que decir mU+00E1s que simplemente que este libro es genial y lleno de todo lo que un buen libro tiene.<br /><br />Me encantU+00F3, mejor que el anterior, un libro ya mU+00E1s oscuro que los anteriores, con personajes nuevos, con nuevas aventuras <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[y con el re</span></span>  <span id="freeText17372953070753782791" style="display:none"><blockquote>Si quieres saber cU+00F3mo es alguien, mira de quU+00E9 manera trata a sus inferiores, no a sus iguales.</blockquote><br />Perfecto desde la primera pU+00E1gina hasta la U+00FAltima<br /><br />A estas alturas ya casi todos conocen a <i>Harry Potter</i> y lo maravillosa que es J.K. Rowling, asU+00ED que no hay mucho que decir mU+00E1s que simplemente que este libro es genial y lleno de todo lo que un buen libro tiene.<br /><br />Me encantU+00F3, mejor que el anterior, un libro ya mU+00E1s oscuro que los anteriores, con personajes nuevos, con nuevas aventuras <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[y con el regreso de lord Voldemort. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> A parte de que en este libro ame mucho mU+00E1s a Hermione que antes, me encanta la forma en que es <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[y en como defendU+00EDa los derechos de los elfos aunque nadie le hiciera caso y ellos fueran felices, la ame. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />A pesar de que vi las pelU+00EDculas antes fue como si no, el libro es diferente dentro de lo que cabe y aun asU+00ED mU+00E1s maravilloso con todo lo que no me habU+00EDa enterado. Ame, mucho, demasiado, me encantU+00F3 tanto el capitulo 36, Caminos separados, este es uno de mis libros favoritos de la saga y lo amo.<br /><br />U+00A1Se viene lo bueno en los siguientes! <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1497896878" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1497896878" />    <a title="Kaitlin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19126246-kaitlin"><img alt="Kaitlin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466422085p2/19126246.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1497896878?book_show_action=false">Jan 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Kaitlin" class="user" name="Kaitlin" href="/user/show/19126246-kaitlin">Kaitlin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747573630" href="/book/show/862712.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Everyone</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19126246-kaitlin?shelf=my-sff-faves">my-sff-faves</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1497896878" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1191712735595810822">Once again this re-read continues to surprise and cheer me up. I think for me this is the book which I always remember loving the most and so going into it again and seeing the events which the films miss out again definitely made my day. I really feel like there's an awful lot of character development and growth within this storyline and that the main three all start to grow up and see the wider wizarding world around them.<br />I honesty think Sirius has become one of my favourite characters over th</span>  <span id="freeText1191712735595810822" style="display:none">Once again this re-read continues to surprise and cheer me up. I think for me this is the book which I always remember loving the most and so going into it again and seeing the events which the films miss out again definitely made my day. I really feel like there's an awful lot of character development and growth within this storyline and that the main three all start to grow up and see the wider wizarding world around them.<br />I honesty think Sirius has become one of my favourite characters over the course of this last two books too which is a change as although I've always liked him he wasn't a favourite of mine until this re-read.<br />On the whole I think that there's an excellent balance of fun, adventure, tense mystery and bravery from all of the characters and the plot for this book. I am really looking forward to continuing the re-read, and I have no doubt that the next few will be just as marvellous. <br />5*s of course and my favourite of the re-read yet!</span>  <a data-text-id="1191712735595810822" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1658618577?book_show_action=false">Aug 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Alexa (eyesonthepages)" class="user" name="Alexa (eyesonthepages)" href="/user/show/7045292-alexa-eyesonthepages">Alexa (eyesonthepages)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7045292-alexa-eyesonthepages?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1658618577" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15564672486626247449">J.K. Rowling wasn't kidding when she said this book was the turning point in the series. <br /><br />I AM LOVING EVERY SECOND OF THIS RE-READ. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1658618577">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1658618577" title="Flag this review as inappropriate."
