elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_18611950" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/18611950" />    <a title="Brad" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1022982-brad"><img alt="Brad" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442484575p2/1022982.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/18611950?book_show_action=false">Nov 08, 2011</a>      <a title="Brad" class="user" name="Brad" href="/user/show/1022982-brad">Brad</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=to-my-kids">to-my-kids</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=out-loud">out-loud</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer18611950" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12715576739106348720"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Goblet of Fire</a>'s sprawling messiness is fascinating to me. It seems to mark the moment when <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a> gained full power over her creation. She wasn't a struggling, driven, single mom anymore -- she was J.K. ROWLING! She was a literary superstar, and suddenly she could do anything she wanted without hindrance.<br /><br />The result is a giant mess. She's got a Quidditch World Cup happening; she's got the crazy Triwizard Tournament, and all its machinations; she's got Harry's hormones starting to rage; she</span>  <span id="freeText12715576739106348720" style="display:none"><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Goblet of Fire</a>'s sprawling messiness is fascinating to me. It seems to mark the moment when <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a> gained full power over her creation. She wasn't a struggling, driven, single mom anymore -- she was J.K. ROWLING! She was a literary superstar, and suddenly she could do anything she wanted without hindrance.<br /><br />The result is a giant mess. She's got a Quidditch World Cup happening; she's got the crazy Triwizard Tournament, and all its machinations; she's got Harry's hormones starting to rage; she's got a jumble of adult politics and the old and new wars against Voldemort competing with Harry for time; she's got the endless Rita Skeeter vs. Hermione subplot; then she's got the Hermione - Dobby - Winky - SPEW debate; she's got the first appearance of the Pensieve, and its onslaught of explication; she's got not-Mad Eye Moody to introduce, the first serious appearance of Voldemort, another ghostly visitation, Padfoot hanging around in caves, Fred & George scheming their brains out, and Dumbledore being his usual forthcoming self; she's got Tournament challenges and school to deliver; she's got humiliating dances for us to attend; she's got the death of Cedric Diggory; and she's got all her usual suspects -- Snape, McGonagall, Neville, Hagrid, the Malfoys, etc., etc.. It's a lot of ground to cover. I think it is too much, and I am sure that if she hadn't been an institution, she'd have been forced to cut and trim.<br /><br />But I am damn glad she wasn't forced to cut and trim. Sure <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Goblet of Fire</a> could have been tighter. Sure it could have been a slicker story, more compelling, faster in the telling. But fuck all that. Life is messy. Shit is always going on around you. Just look around tomorrow and you'll see it happening. And all of those diversions, all of that messiness, is a reflection of the way life is. <br /><br />More importantly, though, I just love the fact that an author -- ANY AUTHOR -- reached that stage with her writing, reached the point where it was so beloved she could tell the story her way without any interference. Most authors only get to do that if they stay in the ghettoes of self-publishing, but Rowling moved into the gated suburbs and painted her house all the colours of the rainbow, and she was so fucking rich and powerful that the community council just let her do her thing. That is authorial victory, and that makes <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Goblet of Fire</a> a personal fave.<br /><br />Besides, it's kinda fun despite its flaws. And it is the first time I really fell for Hermione. She's one of the great supporting characters in all of literature. Seriously. She's up there with Dr. Watson (but better).</span>  <a data-text-id="12715576739106348720" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div href="/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner"><img alt="Liam Gardner" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451864455p2/38154660.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1443371576?book_show_action=false">Jan 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Liam Gardner" class="user" name="Liam Gardner" href="/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner">Liam Gardner</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1443371576" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer706636779121288410">I know I have said this with all previous Harry Potter books but J.K Rowling has once again exceeded my expectations and wrote my favourite book of the series so far.<br /><br />Goblet of fire, (although maybe being a little slow to begin with) was packed full of excitement, mystery and perfect side stories (I perticullaly loved the story about Hermione and the house elves.) With the characters being another year older the themes and stories in this book have also became more adult and complex.<br /><br />I loved the w</span>  <span id="freeText706636779121288410" style="display:none">I know I have said this with all previous Harry Potter books but J.K Rowling has once again exceeded my expectations and wrote my favourite book of the series so far.<br /><br />Goblet of fire, (although maybe being a little slow to begin with) was packed full of excitement, mystery and perfect side stories (I perticullaly loved the story about Hermione and the house elves.) With the characters being another year older the themes and stories in this book have also became more adult and complex.<br /><br />I loved the way Moody was also portrayed, he was a very fun character to read about. Even Hermione, (who never really interested me in the first three books) is now becoming my favourite character of the three, she grew up a lot in this book and found her voice with her act out about the equality of house elves. She's adorable!<br /><br />Overall, there were loads of good parts and then a chapter or 2 which I struggled to get through! BUT, the good definitely out weighed the bad. :) 5/5</span>  <a data-text-id="706636779121288410" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1500018540" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1500018540" />    <a title="Christian Guzman" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27310486-christian-guzman"><img alt="Christian Guzman" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477868232p2/27310486.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1500018540?book_show_action=false">Mar 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Christian Guzman" class="user" name="Christian Guzman" href="/user/show/27310486-christian-guzman">Christian Guzman</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1500018540" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13858549312895974961">If i could give this book more than 5 stars.. believe me, i would. Obviously this is because i am a die hard Harry Potter fan, so it would be quite impossible for me to dislike any of the novels. I did however enjoy Goblet of Fire more than the previous 3 novels. This is mainly because of the size of the book and how much more detail there is. There's a good mixture of suspense, drama, adventure, and emotion in Goblet of Fire. I kind of wish i hadn't seen all the movies prior to reading the</span>  <span id="freeText13858549312895974961" style="display:none">If i could give this book more than 5 stars.. believe me, i would. Obviously this is because i am a die hard Harry Potter fan, so it would be quite impossible for me to dislike any of the novels. I did however enjoy Goblet of Fire more than the previous 3 novels. This is mainly because of the size of the book and how much more detail there is. There's a good mixture of suspense, drama, adventure, and emotion in Goblet of Fire. I kind of wish i hadn't seen all the movies prior to reading the books since it spoils many parts of the story. There's still so much more detail in the books that obviously can't be put into the films due to timing, so i still get to enjoy the books tremendously. It's still great getting a more detailed view of the magical world and its many characters. I think the Triwizard Tournament chapters were my favorite, they were fun to read and interesting to see how the contestants would react to certain circumstances. To be exact, my favorite one was the second task which took place in the Black Lake. The Yule Ball was also interesting and a bit chaotic.. Hagrid, Maxime, Hermione, and Ron entertained me so much during the Yule Ball chapter. I also enjoyed getting to know the backstory of Hagrid's past! You feel sympathy towards him as you are reading about him. I learned so much about his origin and how he is perceived by other people. The house elves contributed a decent amount to the novel, i enjoyed reading about them and Winky was funny to me but also frustrated me a bit. House elves are strange little creatures... I also found the reporter Rita Skeeter to be quite annoying and irritating, i am pretty sure that was one of Rowling's objectives when she was developing the character, so she excelled at that. There's just so much i enjoyed in this novel. I won't go into more detail since i don't want this review to end up being eternal and to have spoilers. I heard many great reviews about the sequels and i cannot wait to dive into them! J.K Rowling is by far one of my favorite authors. She created such an iconic world. </span>  <a data-text-id="13858549312895974961" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_591417061" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/591417061" />    <a title="Jo U+2605The Book SlothU+2605" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth"><img alt="Jo U+2605The Book SlothU+2605" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1455373805p2/13870608.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/591417061?book_show_action=false">Apr 05, 2014</a>      <a title="Jo U+2605The Book SlothU+2605" class="user" name="Jo U+2605The Book SlothU+2605" href="/user/show/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth">Jo U+2605The Book SlothU+2605</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=paranormal">paranormal</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=non-romance">non-romance</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer591417061&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer591417061" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7448896678822449739">This one is my second favorite book in the series. I was determines to savor it so I promised myself to read only a chapter a day. It didn't happen exactly like this but I just couldn't resist some times.<br><br><br><b>Three schools<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023923.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023924.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023925.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One man in disguise<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023926.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One trick<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023927.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Four champions<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1389352634i/8023928.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Three challenges<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023929.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023930.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1389352634i/8023931._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Two friendships tested<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023932.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023933.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One Evil Lord reborn<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023934.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One battle<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1389352634ra/8023935.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One death<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1381837029ra/5340915.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One unforgetable book...</b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1389352634i/8023936.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer468115944" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8317548773009134676">Gosh, this book... While it might not my favorite Harry Potter novel, it is still a fantastic one. <b>All of these books are, really.</b> We're introduced to some very real darkness in this one and brought on an emotional roller coaster of humour, frustration, anger, horror as well as true sorrow... <b>I love that this series, even after so many re-reads, can still make me feel like this;</b> still give me goosebumps and still bring tears to my eyes.<br /><br />It has started, and it's only going to get darker...<br /><br /><blockquote> <i>"Differ</i></blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText8317548773009134676" style="display:none">Gosh, this book... While it might not my favorite Harry Potter novel, it is still a fantastic one. <b>All of these books are, really.</b> We're introduced to some very real darkness in this one and brought on an emotional roller coaster of humour, frustration, anger, horror as well as true sorrow... <b>I love that this series, even after so many re-reads, can still make me feel like this;</b> still give me goosebumps and still bring tears to my eyes.<br /><br />It has started, and it's only going to get darker...<br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>"Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open."</i></blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="8317548773009134676" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1541468019" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1541468019" />    <a title="jamieson" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7706640-jamieson"><img alt="jamieson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478436535p2/7706640.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1541468019?book_show_action=false">Jul 04, 2016</a>      <a title="jamieson" class="user" name="jamieson" href="/user/show/7706640-jamieson">jamieson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747546245" href="/book/show/43509.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=childrens-literature">childrens-literature</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=childhood-faves">childhood-faves</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1541468019" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14972803960147174222">MAN. For some reason I never reread Goblet of Fire because I really hate the movie and for some reason (????) thats put me off the book too. It's ridiculous and needs to stop because GOF is honestly one of THE BEST in the series (I say this about them all tho lmao) <br /><br />But seriously, it's so good. <br /><br />The characters, for a start. Fleur (my queen), Krum, Cedric, Moody (a great! villian ok), Dumbledore is probably my favourite in this one and ootp, I really like Hagrid in this one, I really like the outsi</span>  <span id="freeText14972803960147174222" style="display:none">MAN. For some reason I never reread Goblet of Fire because I really hate the movie and for some reason (????) thats put me off the book too. It's ridiculous and needs to stop because GOF is honestly one of THE BEST in the series (I say this about them all tho lmao) <br /><br />But seriously, it's so good. <br /><br />The characters, for a start. Fleur (my queen), Krum, Cedric, Moody (a great! villian ok), Dumbledore is probably my favourite in this one and ootp, I really like Hagrid in this one, I really like the outside characters like Crouch, Ludo, Dobby & Winky. ALSO !! SIRIUS !! MY BOY SIRIUS !! BEING LOWKEY DAD I LOVE HIM SO MUCH<br /><br />The plot is SO well written and everything is worked into it so perfectly it's really, really well crafted and I appreicate that alot. The big reveal at the end makes so much sense, but being able to read it knowing what was happening really made me see the smaller details of it all and I think it's one of the cleverer ones plot wise. <br /><br />I feel like it perfectly hits that mix of dark plots and events with humour and fun that characterises Harry Potter. The scenes at the end with Cedric dying, Harry having to explain what happened are so, so incredibly sad. Much sadder than I appreciated the first time I read them. But Harry has come to mean so much to me and seeing him sad makes me really, really sad. He's such a good lad who's seen too much. Pretty much the whole maze/graveyard scene, the scenes with Crouch and the scenes of terror at the Quidditch World Cup are genuinely frightening and really well written. Also think the whole pensieve scene is well done, and any scene with Dumbledore and Harry interacting. <br /><br />But on the other side, the side plot of Fred and George trying to get their gold from Ludo, the plots about Rita Skeeter and the news articles, The Yule Ball and the teen relationship angst are so funny and lighthearted and I feel that contrast is what really makes Harry Potter. This book takes on that tone that the later ones follow and I really, really like that. <br /><br />There's just so much to like here from the epc opening Quidditch game, to the expansive plot, to the loveable and awful characters and the humour and the sadness and the heartbreak. <br /><br />Just love Harry Potter so much !!</span>  <a data-text-id="14972803960147174222" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1012981339" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18038744082998165447">I have no words for the tension in this book. <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Also, is it strange that I really enjoyed Mad-Eye Moody, although he was an impostor? <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_582890701" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/582890701" />    <a title="Angela" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4255477-angela"><img alt="Angela" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398251387p2/4255477.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/582890701?book_show_action=false">Mar 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Angela" class="user" name="Angela" href="/user/show/4255477-angela">Angela</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/13563644-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read">2013-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read-sequels">2013-read-sequels</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=kindle">kindle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2016-read">2016-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer582890701" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7047998169275246305">Whereas the previous three books in the series were getting progressively darker, leading to this (and the future books), there's a huge jump in scope and size of this novel. And this book is most definitely darker. You wouldn't realize it when you start off with the Quidditch World Cup to look forward to. It's that, as much as anything, I think, that sets the tone for the book. <br /><br />Excitement, nerves, joy, and terror all rolled into one. <br /><br />I love how the clues, if you're able to add them all up to th</span>  <span id="freeText7047998169275246305" style="display:none">Whereas the previous three books in the series were getting progressively darker, leading to this (and the future books), there's a huge jump in scope and size of this novel. And this book is most definitely darker. You wouldn't realize it when you start off with the Quidditch World Cup to look forward to. It's that, as much as anything, I think, that sets the tone for the book. <br /><br />Excitement, nerves, joy, and terror all rolled into one. <br /><br />I love how the clues, if you're able to add them all up to the right answer, are all cleverly imparted within the text. Never does it feel like extraneous information, but it also doesn't feel important - Of course, we come to find out later just how important those pieces of information were.<br /><br />If you're one that's only been watching the movies (and don't get me wrong, I love the movies), you're missing out - a lot - here in this story. The book is so incredibly big that they had to cut some of the storylines, had to shorten and paraphrase others, and I think, overall, it really does suffer for it. Yes, yes, I know - SPEW isn't necessary and doesn't really matter, but *shrugs* I love it. I love that storyline, I love what it implies, and I love what it shows of a certain character. That's by no means the only cut that this book suffered when it was translated to the big-screen, though.<br /><br />There are other things that are softened, or made less horrible in the movies - I remember the first time I read the books after having seen the movies. I love Snape. I always have and always will, but it's easier to love Rickman's portrayal of him in the movies. He's an ass in the books - abusive, at best, to his students. (And let me clarify here, I don't love what he does, always, but he's an excellent character.) In the movies, though, he's still a jerk, but the 'best intentions' are written all over him. And that's kind of unfortunate, too. Another loss is Ron's shitty behaviour. Honestly, I'd nearly forgotten about his behaviour in this one, but his character really stands out to me as ... not good. He constantly believes the stereotypes and rumors and things other people have told him about other magical beings and people. He is very hard pressed to form his own opinions. He believes the absolute worse of his BEST FRIEND and treats him like shit. He mocks and berates his other BEST FRIEND. Ugh. I don't like you, Ron. And every time I read the books that dislike gets a little more intense.<br /><br />Anywho - let me get off that rant. I love this book. I love the suspense, the tension, the mystery. I love the tasks - even if there are only three of them. I loved learning more about other wizards and their cultures. This book really builds towards the climax - and I remember exactly how shocked I was when I reached it the first time. I felt sure that it couldn't happen, it shouldn't so it wouldn't.<br /><br />This book definitely brings out the emotions in me. I still tear up near the end, and cheer when Harry faces his first task. It's hard for me to be objective while reading, or reviewing, because I love this world so damn much.<br /><br />Weasleys' picking Harry up<br />Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes<br />Omnioculars<br />Tri-Wizard Tournament<br />Rita Skeeter<br />Yule Ball<br />Hermione<br />Cedric<br />Priori Incantatem<br />And I can't wait to start Order of the Phoenix next.<br /><br />This review can also be found at <a href="http://thebookeaters.net/2016/03/15/review-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire/" rel="nofollow">The Book Eaters</a><br /><br /><br /><br />Previous thoughts:<br />As evidenced by my last three 'reviews' of the Harry Potter novels, I suck at this. There're so many <i>feels</i> that accompany my readings of these books. I'm so immersed in the world, the characters lives and struggles and triumphs that I can't begin to put together coherent words explaining why or how I feel as I do.<br /><br />This review is going to be more of the same. This book had me, again, on the edge of my seat while the tasks were taking place, right there with Harry, Hermione and Ron as they tried to figure out what was happening. </span>  <a data-text-id="7047998169275246305" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_582890701" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_582890701" ref="like" class="jsLike <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_227045995" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/227045995" />    <a title="Saniya" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4048678-saniya"><img alt="Saniya" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1446849958p2/4048678.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/227045995?book_show_action=false">Nov 04, 2011</a>      <a title="Saniya" class="user" name="Saniya" href="/user/show/4048678-saniya">Saniya</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747546245" href="/book/show/43509.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4048678-saniya?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4048678-saniya?shelf=saniya-malfoy">saniya-malfoy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer227045995&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer227045995" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14229480523158049738">God, I loved this book. But there were some cons which couldn't be ignored.<br><br>First of all, the movie sucked badly. No wonder I never understood the movie even though I watched it many times. <br>As I tried to watch the movie while reading this book, my face expressions were seriously like, "What the eff?" <br>The movie didn't show The Quidditch world cup for instance! It was like, one of the most awaited and amazing part of the book. And so many things were really confusing and could be only understood by</span>  <span id="freeText14229480523158049738" style="display:none">God, I loved this book. But there were some cons which couldn't be ignored.<br><br>First of all, the movie sucked badly. No wonder I never understood the movie even though I watched it many times. <br>As I tried to watch the movie while reading this book, my face expressions were seriously like, "What the eff?" <br>The movie didn't show The Quidditch world cup for instance! It was like, one of the most awaited and amazing part of the book. And so many things were really confusing and could be only understood by reading the book.<br><br>The things I <u>didn't</u> about this book:<br><br>1) J.K Rowing, full respect and admiration from me to you, you are an awesome writer, but I just felt weird throughout the whole book. I really, really wanted this book to have other people's point of view, not that I don't like Harry, but I really wanted to know what was happening with Hermione, especially with Krum, since I am girl with great expectation from Hermione when Yule Ball happened. And I was so disappointed and annoyed because I really wanted to know what Krum said to Hermoine in the end of the book.<br><br>2) A great point made by a reviewer. (Christopher Ferry)<br><br>Why did fake-Moody/Crouch Jr. set up this immensely complicated and low probability plan to get Harry to win the Triwizard Cup and be teleported to Voldemort when he was his trusted teacher the whole school year. He could have just made a pen be a portkey and then dropped it and said "Harry, could you pick that up for me?" Much easier than dealing with dragons, suborning house-elves, and casting outlawed curses. <br><br>3) The book was unnecessarily long. Seriously, I can just cut 100-150 pages from this book by removing all the scenes of Rita Skeeter's shit and house-elf's crying and Hermione's debating. J.K Rowling should have just focused on The Triwizard Tournament (which was by the way, awesome!) and on the last chapters. And Cedric's death, GOD! Either I am an obsessed fan of Cedric and was expecting more or that J.K Rowling is not that good in writing someone's death. I was even surprised at Crouch's death.<br><br><i>"I killed my father and then buried him" said Crouch's son."</i><br><br>... o.o ... o.O ... -_-<br><br>I mean come-on! He was in this book for a pretty long time and just telling this and then going on to the next chapter was just weird. <br><br><br>Besides all the things I mentioned above, I found this book really good, exciting and now I want to find out what happens in the end even more eagerly! The last 100 pages were indeed awesome and I will rate this book 3.5/5 stars. <br><br>And yeah, how can I ever forget. :) *evil grin*<br><br><b>THE HOTTIES!</b><br>KRUM! CEDRIC! I love you both. <br>Krum, you better be in the next book.<br>And Cedric, why did you die?! =( I really loved you.<br><br>RIP CEDRIC DIGGORY.<br><br><span>[image error]</span><br></span>  <a data-text-id="14229480523158049738" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1731795976" />    <a title="Hassan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30924856-hassan"><img alt="Hassan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1422035280p2/30924856.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1731795976?book_show_action=false">Aug 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Hassan" class="user" name="Hassan" href="/user/show/30924856-hassan">Hassan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1731795976" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14920006961266724801"><b> <i>U+201CIt matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.U+201D</i> </b><br /><br />again, i am at loss of words to particularize my fascination of another installment of The <i>Harry Potter</i> Series,<i>Goblet of Fire</i> won me over again.<br />after <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i>, i Was really excited to see how Rowling is going to proceed her story, also, how she's going to top that. <br />i'll admit that when i read <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> i was completely sure that it's going to be my favorite, i was sure that there's no way any other book in the</span>  <span id="freeText14920006961266724801" style="display:none"><b>  <i>U+201CIt matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.U+201D</i></b><br /><br />again, i am at loss of words to particularize my fascination of another installment of The <i>Harry Potter</i> Series,<i>Goblet of Fire</i> won me over again.<br />after <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i>, i Was really excited to see how Rowling is going to proceed her story, also, how she's going to top that. <br />i'll admit that when i read <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> i was completely sure that it's going to be my favorite, i was sure that there's no way any other book in the series can set that dark tone, or have this beautiful natural way of character development, or build up the mystery element in that eerie way, shortly, i was convinced that there's no way the series could get better than this, no matter how good the rest of the series is. <br /><br />But, god i was wrong. <br /><br /><i>Goblet of Fire</i> swept <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> from my favorite spot and settled there gracefully, it didn't have the dark tone of <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i>, <br />but it had a cheerful, festive feeling, which really fits the book, the world continued being built in an exquisite way, tons of new characters gets introduced and none<br />of them is boring or typical, and my favorite part about this book is it's mystery element, imagine all the questions that you had in <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> and double it, that's how perplexed the situation were, and of course Rowling just dazzled all of us by foreshadowing the answers to each question several times during the book, and branch out with some genuinely exceptional sub-plots, and connect them all together at the end in a frustratingly skillful way to unravel the mystery of the book. <br /><br />and of course the writing style is so whimsical, it's simple but still so rich, it adds a lot to the story, the world and the character, the character development, and the growing up difficulties are depicted in this book in a very natural and distinctive manner, it's so brilliant to see how our three main character growing up and get jealous of each other and fight with each other and avoid each other. <br /><br />all these elements comes together to add so much depth and layers to <i>Goblet of Fire</i>, which made it for me a complete masterpiece in every single way, and to claim once again that <i>Goblet of Fire</i> is my favorite of the series (So Far).</span>  <a data-text-id="14920006961266724801" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=favorites-young-adult">favorites-young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=fantasy-scifi-paranormal">fantasy-scifi-paranormal</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=these-are-not-tears">these-are-not-tears</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=own-physical-copy">own-physical-copy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=i-love-fairy-tales">i-love-fairy-tales</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=cover-love">cover-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=challenge-a-series-a-month-2015">challenge-a-series-a-month-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1454534719" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17682526702890646739"><b>4-4.5 stars</b><br /><br />Oh wow. <i>Goblet of Fire</i> has certainly set the tone for the rest of the series, yeah? There are still those moments of humor and triumph for Harry, Ron, and Hermione - and plenty of time for teenage angst (all aboard the Romione train) - and Dumbeldore (forever my favorite) unleashing his special brand of wisdom, but true heartbreak has come knocking. The series has definitely taken a darker turn. And even knowing what's ahead - or maybe because of that - I am terrified for these kids!</span>  <span id="freeText17682526702890646739" style="display:none"><b>4-4.5 stars</b><br /><br />Oh wow. <i>Goblet of Fire</i> has certainly set the tone for the rest of the series, yeah? There are still those moments of humor and triumph for Harry, Ron, and Hermione - and plenty of time for teenage angst (all aboard the Romione train) - and Dumbeldore (forever my favorite) unleashing his special brand of wisdom, but true heartbreak has come knocking. The series has definitely taken a darker turn. And even knowing what's ahead - or maybe because of that - I am terrified for these kids! Reading it is such a different experience than watching the movies. I don't think I am emotionally prepared for what's to come! </span>  <a data-text-id="17682526702890646739" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/671184789?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Maryjane" class="user" name="Maryjane" href="/user/show/20114593-maryjane">Maryjane</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20114593-maryjane?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20114593-maryjane?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer671184789" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6019245454777606140">Something about my reread this time around is really hitting me in the feels. Reading this again was so nostalgic. <br /><br />This one starts off so HAPPY and EXCITING and then you watch Harry really struggle and you're reminded of just how young he is, and that all of these things in life just keep getting thrown at him and he's being forced to grow up so quickly. Idk man I just had a lot of different feelings/emotions during this one, and found myself crying through the end more than I remember crying an</span>  <span id="freeText6019245454777606140" style="display:none">Something about my reread this time around is really hitting me in the feels. Reading this again was so nostalgic. <br /><br />This one starts off so HAPPY and EXCITING and then you watch Harry really struggle and you're reminded of just how young he is, and that all of these things in life just keep getting thrown at him and he's being forced to grow up so quickly. Idk man I just had a lot of different feelings/emotions during this one, and found myself crying through the end more than I remember crying any of the other times I've read it. </span>  <a data-text-id="6019245454777606140" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/478650409" />    <a title="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder"><img alt="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476896265p2/3048260.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/478650409?book_show_action=false">Jan 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" class="user" name="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" href="/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder">Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Anyone</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=a-own-book-form">a-own-book-form</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=sad">sad</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=ghosts">ghosts</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=magic-powers">magic-powers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=vampires">vampires</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=part-of-series">part-of-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=witches">witches</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=monsters">monsters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=shapeshifters">shapeshifters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=mad-scientists">mad-scientists</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=mermaids">mermaids</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=s-king-recommends">s-king-recommends</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=4-star">4-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=movie-seen">movie-seen</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=cover-love">cover-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=ttiv">ttiv</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer478650409" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10138201507548960793"><br /><b>U+201CIt matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.U+201D</b><br /><br />The book lengths keep growing with each new sequel, and it seems those extra pages are bringing a deeper shroud of darkness with them. This book excites, it tugs hard on the heartstrings, and it made me spiral even further into the wonderful series. <br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire starts as the others did, where Harry has to leave the dastardly Dursley's and come to Hogwarts. Once there the book picks up again, but the small, da</span>  <span id="freeText10138201507548960793" style="display:none"><br /><b>U+201CIt matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.U+201D</b><br /><br />The book lengths keep growing with each new sequel, and it seems those extra pages are bringing a deeper shroud of darkness with them. This book excites, it tugs hard on the heartstrings, and it made me spiral even further into the wonderful series. <br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire starts as the others did, where Harry has to leave the dastardly Dursley's and come to Hogwarts. Once there the book picks up again, but the small, darker themes seen before have become magnified. While Quidditch was the game in the previous books, this time they have a special and bizarre wizarding tournament that has some seriously scary stuff. You have to wonder what goes on in the mind of school administrators in the wizarding world.<br /><br />The tests and trials are divided up into months and scenes since they can relax in between (thank God.) The trials themselves are interesting, especially the last as it shows the twist of betrayal and the resurrection of a certain big-bad of the series. Besides in between the trials, Harry has to contend with his friend Ron's growing jealousy and frictions that added an in interesting and realistic touch. It's small and evens out quickly, but it highlights Ron again as one of the best series characters. Mrs. Weasley is even more likeable- she was always rockin' before, but she's even more so now as she's taken over the mothering role for our favorite orphaned wizard. <br /><br />There's a lot of good characters introduced in this one, especially One-Eyed Mad Moody; the professor is a riot and has a twist of a surprise at the end. Sirius is present a lot too, loving the godfather role and protectiveness he feels toward Harry. I feel so bad for him, however, for first he's committed to Azkaban for crimes not committed and now he has to struggle with wanting that connection with Harry so badly because of the loss of his friends. Such sad stuff. Dumbledore has always been a great character, and he's even larger than life than before with plenty of heroic scenes.<br /><br />Hermione has always been likable because she stands out as different - but she is even more so likable now with the S.P.E.W. angle and her passion for fighting for the rights of those who she feels is treated unfairly. We also get to see a further side into the Ministry of Magic, their powerful fingers in all sorts of pies, flawed moral ineptitude, and the potential of all that leading to holes and working against the wizards instead of for them.<br /><br />The story has taken it into darker waters, showing it's definitely not a series just for children anymore. There's a tragic death that affects Harry and others (readers included). You can almost see the graveyard and all scenes through Rowling's talented writing style. She can bring forth a surprising range of depth from her characters from the simplest scenes and events. <br /><br />We even get bizarre mermaids in one particularly riveting scene, a flying dance of dragons, and finally a maze that ends up to a horrific finish.<br /><br />Some people have said this was their favorite - it's not my top favorite of the first four (I preferred Prisoner of Azkaban a little more), but we get more in-depth glimpses into favorite characters, new characters introduced that are amazing, and an excellent adventure into the wild and complex wizarding world that is Harry Potter.<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="10138201507548960793" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review478650409">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_478650409" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 478650409, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/478650409?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=3">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_478650409' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/478650409/comments?reverse=true">View 2 comments</a><span class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 478650409, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1215158326" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1215158326" />    <a title="Edward Lorn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8850418-edward-lorn"><img alt="Edward Lorn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478625849p2/8850418.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1215158326?book_show_action=false">Nov 10, 2015</a>      <a title="Edward Lorn" class="user" name="Edward Lorn" href="/user/show/8850418-edward-lorn">Edward Lorn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Fellatio afficendos and gushing geriatric gangbang groupees.</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Edward by: </span>      Shelby  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8850418-edward-lorn?shelf=52-in-52-2015">52-in-52-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1215158326" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9843186172796359640">Alternative American Titles:<br><br><i>Harry Potter and the Flaming Cup<br><br>Harry Potter and the Chalice of Embers<br><br>Harry Potter and the Burning Cuppa Hot Heat That is Also Quiet the Inferno</i><br><br>Okay, I'll admit it. This book is pretty rad. Some of the chapters were overly lengthy and the monologues at the end were long winded even for my liking (I've written my fair share of villains monologuing, as Gregor Xane has pointed out on numerous occasions, but this was <i>riddikulus!</i>). Overall, though, I enjoyed myself. <br><br>It too</span>  <span id="freeText9843186172796359640" style="display:none">Alternative American Titles:<br><br><i>Harry Potter and the Flaming Cup<br><br>Harry Potter and the Chalice of Embers<br><br>Harry Potter and the Burning Cuppa Hot Heat That is Also Quiet the Inferno</i><br><br>Okay, I'll admit it. This book is pretty rad. Some of the chapters were overly lengthy and the monologues at the end were long winded even for my liking (I've written my fair share of villains monologuing, as Gregor Xane has pointed out on numerous occasions, but this was <i>riddikulus!</i>). Overall, though, I enjoyed myself. <br><br>It took me nearly six months to read this book. After 200 pages, I put it down because I felt like it was more of the same. I'd grown tired of whiny-ass Potter and his insufferable adopted family. I thoroughly despise the beginning of every Potter novel because the Dursley's seem so over-the-top stupid. They are completely unbelievable in how terrible they are to a kid who could grant them every wish under the sun if they were only nicer to him. I mean, they <i>are</i> greedy narcissists. Wouldn't it be more likely that they'd treat Potter's magical ability like a fifty-cent hooker on Half-Off Whoreday? Them wanting to hide his magical magery simply to save face doesn't gel with me, and probably never will. Oh well, moving on... <br><br>When I picked this fourth book back up (I'm determined to finish this series before the end of 2015) the next 300 pages were... so-so. I didn't hate them. There was a cool part here and there, but I was sorta just hoping it would end. It wasn't until the final third of the book that <i>The Gobbler for Hire</i> gets impossible to put down. And let's be honest. That bit in the graveyard was fucking awesome. I loved how brutal that section was. <br><br>But what I liked most about this book is the development of the characters. Ron and Hermione especially. If these were older characters I would have been screaming "Get a fuckin' room already!" about halfway through the novel. Oh, and the fact that Potter isn't a whiny-ass by the end was a major plus. I dug that none of his friends were able to help this time. Made his character finally shine for me.<br><br>In summation: This is the best book in the series... so far. I'm really not looking forward to the 850+ doorstop that is book five, but I will nevertheless jump into it next month. At this point, I've forgotten what the last three movies were about. I'm going in with fresh eyes and an open heart. Let's just hope it doesn't eat the booty like a fatman at a porkbutt barbecue.<br><br><b>Final Judgment:</b><br><br><a href="http://imgur.com/GJEzTQk" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436846628ra/15510453.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="9843186172796359640" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1215158326"> 2015 11:19AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_794900326" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/794900326" />    <a title="Laz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22313662-laz"><img alt="Laz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459126457p2/22313662.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/794900326?book_show_action=false">Jan 26, 2015</a>      <a title="Laz" class="user" name="Laz" href="/user/show/22313662-laz">Laz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810576" href="/book/show/7979788-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">magic world lovers</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=classics">classics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=sci-fi">sci-fi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer794900326" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14881978064243451808"><b> <blockquote>U+201CIf you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D</blockquote> </b><br /><br />This book and all its glory.. I loved this. It was simply extraordinary and unlike any other Harry Potter novel. This was considerably more mature than any of its predecessors. I loved the size of it. It was a book I couldn't get enough of even though it's actual the biggest so far and the most detailed one. Mrs. Rowling never ceases to amaze me.<br /><br />I loved how in each and every book we see how</span>  <span id="freeText14881978064243451808" style="display:none"><b>  <blockquote>U+201CIf you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D</blockquote></b><br /><br />This book and all its glory.. I loved this. It was simply extraordinary and unlike any other Harry Potter novel. This was considerably more mature than any of its predecessors. I loved the size of it. It was a book I couldn't get enough of even though it's actual the biggest so far and the most detailed one. Mrs. Rowling never ceases to amaze me.<br /><br />I loved how in each and every book we see how Harry's changing to become the amazing grown-up man he is meant to be. Ron & Hermione & Harry. Our unbeatable trio. They are growing up so fast and it is amazing to read about them and how they overcome everything together. This one was mostly Harry working by himself because it wasn't allowed for him to have any help while participating in the Triwizard Tournament. <br /><br /><b>  <blockquote>U+201CWe are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.U+201D</blockquote></b><br /><br />This marks the beginning of darker times ahead.. This was suprisingly darker and more morbid than any other book. Like Mrs. Rowling had said when this book came out: "Book Four's a very very VERY important book. Something very important happens in Book Four. But also, it's literally a central book. It's almost the heart of the series, and it's pivotal."<br /><br />In this book we see Voldemort for the first time. The first time in his physical form. It's all amazing to read. How he is involved with the Triwizard Tournament and how it all becomes a big mess. <br /><br />There is death and there is suspense, tons of it. There is a kinds-of prom. There is falling in love, and jealousy, for the first time in the Harry Potter series. And it's so breath-taking reading about our favorite characters falling in love, getting their feelings hurts, and tasting rejection for the first time ever.<br /><br />If you've loved the previous books then you're bound to love this one just as much and maybe a little more. </span>  <a data-text-id="14881978064243451808" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer444325713" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6213017541628929333">In lieu of an actual review, here are some memes that amuse me. You're welcome.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1459352520i/18601350._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Okay, this scene is from the 3rd book or maybe the 5th? Not Goblet of Fire anyway. And Hermione clearly isn't stupid, she's super smart, etc, blah blah -- but she's also one of the bravest characters in this series. The way she just ignores people who make fun of her. Or calling Draco a -- what? Weasel-faced ferret when he was calling her ugly and a mudblood. She doesn't back down and she's continues to be herself. Sh</span>  <span id="freeText6213017541628929333" style="display:none">In lieu of an actual review, here are some memes that amuse me. You're welcome.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1459352520i/18601350._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Okay, this scene is from the 3rd book or maybe the 5th? Not Goblet of Fire anyway. And Hermione clearly isn't stupid, she's super smart, etc, blah blah -- but she's also one of the bravest characters in this series. She doesn't back down and she's continues to be herself. Even if that guy does greatly resemble Edward.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1459352942i/18601414._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Oh and then there was Ron. id="freeTextContainer7043019848353417952">Rowling totally outdone herself with this book. YOU NEED TO READ THIS .. because the movie is not enough whatsoever .. More details and bigger plot.<br><br>Rowling didnU+2019t leave anything for chance at all .. As if she has been planning for every single word in order to put it in the write place.<br><br>This Riddle made by the sphinx was my favorite .. I loved it so much<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1471031460i/19994182._SX540_.jpg" width="650" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>What I really loved is what Hagrid said to Harry at the end<br>U+201CwhatU+2019s cominU+2019 will come, and weU+2019ll meet it when it does.U+201D<br><br>These were really deep words .. Got the meaning that we should live by in this life .. We shouldnU+2019t think about the Unseen and make our lifes like hell .. We should wait for it and when it happens only then we have to start thinking about it and find a way out of it.<br><br>It wonU+2019t be my last year at Hogwarts of course and I canU+2019t wait to start my next year with my favorite friends and teachers.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1471001354i/19989724._SX540_.jpg" width="310" height="180" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b> See you next year. </b><br><br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1469572378?book_show_action=false">U+0631 U+064A </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1621286432" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6232765168791963688"><br /><br />Goblet of Fire is almost everyoneU+2019s favorite Harry Potter bookU+2026or Prisoner of Azkaban. My personal feelings differ, but there is literally not a single Harry Potter book that is bad. Having re-read these books so many times I have lost count, I have to say Goblet is on the lower end of my rankings. As it stands now, my favorites are in the following order: Order, Hallows, Prince, Stone, Prisoner, Goblet and Chamber. Now, be mindful of the fact that they ALL get 5 stars. We are talking about such</span>  <span id="freeText6232765168791963688" style="display:none"><br /><br />Goblet of Fire is almost everyoneU+2019s favorite Harry Potter bookU+2026or Prisoner of Azkaban. My personal feelings differ, but there is literally not a single Harry Potter book that is bad. Having re-read these books so many times I have lost count, I have to say Goblet is on the lower end of my rankings. As it stands now, my favorites are in the following order: Order, Hallows, Prince, Stone, Prisoner, Goblet and Chamber. Now, be mindful of the fact that they ALL get 5 stars. We are talking about such a small difference in love it is hardly worth commenting on. But, I digress. <br /><br />In Goblet of Fire we encounter all sorts of new and exciting things. We get to see the Quidditch World Cup! We get to see Death Eaters tormenting muggles and muggle-borns! We get to see just how much work goes into hiding the wizarding world from muggles on an everyday basis. We are introduced to Mad-Eye Moody and his intriguing career. We have our minds blown at the what-should-have-been-obvious fact that there are OTHER schools throughout the worldU+2026NOT just Hogwarts. <br /><br />Upon his arrival at Hogwarts after the events of the Quidditch World Cup, Harry is shocked to hear that there will be no Quidditch this year at Hogwarts. However, he can barely register his shock when Dumbledore announces that in its stead Hogwarts will be host to an event that has not happened in over a centuryU+2026.the TriWizard Tournament. Representatives from two other schools will be joining the students and worthy champions will be selected by the Goblet of Fire to compete. Rules are aplenty though, as we find out just why the tournament has not been held in so longU+2026 students have died. So no student under the age of 17 is permitted to enter their name into the goblet. <br /><br />So how does it happen that HarryU+2019s name comes floating out of that Goblet? Being 3 years younger than his fellow champions surely puts him at a disadvantage. There must be dark magic involved. Someone is out to kill HarryU+2026 <br /><br />Goblet of Fire is a fast-paced and exciting read; a wonderful addition to the series and a crucial one. The series starts to take a dark turn here and is just the tip of the iceberg for what happens in the next three. <br /><br /><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1624370108">Delee</a> is a first-timer to the series and was supposed to read this one with me, but life happens sometimes and it got set aside temporarily. SheU+2019s lucky I love her as much as I doU+2026or sheU+2019d be locked in my basement with Mr. King and that MahFah Jeff. But, I decided to give her a passU+2026 <i>this time.</i><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="6232765168791963688" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>
