</div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_130164066" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/130164066" />    <a title="Emily" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2431873-emily"><img alt="Emily" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477433724p2/2431873.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/130164066?book_show_action=false">Jun 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Emily" class="user" name="Emily" href="/user/show/2431873-emily">Emily</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=ya-fiction">ya-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=childrens-books">childrens-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=hugo-award">hugo-award</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=ya-ideal-library">ya-ideal-library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=sci-fi-fantasy">sci-fi-fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer130164066" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16403579856893312337">I've read this book so many times that my copy is quite literally falling apart - the spine is split on one side and there's a section of pages that you have to stuff back in to the center every time you close the book. This was always one of the standouts of the series for me, because it's just so much <i>fun</i> even as the tone becomes darker. It's crazy to think that the first time the term "Death Eater" appeared was in this book, as well as the introduction of the now-familiar Unforgivable Curses.</span>  <span id="freeText16403579856893312337" style="display:none">I've read this book so many times that my copy is quite literally falling apart - the spine is split on one side and there's a section of pages that you have to stuff back in to the center every time you close the book. This was always one of the standouts of the series for me, because it's just so much <i>fun</i> even as the tone becomes darker. It's crazy to think that the first time the term "Death Eater" appeared was in this book, as well as the introduction of the now-familiar Unforgivable Curses. Again, JKR pulls off her usual plot complexities in a believable way. I mean, Rita Skeeter as <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[a beetle <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>!!!!!! - gah so good - and, of course, the introduction of Portkeys at the Quidditch World Cup. And the ending, with Priori Incantatem, gets me every time. It's emotional and believable and so inventive. <br /><br />But though I've read this one countless times and I love the ever-expanding Potterverse, this was weirdly enough my least compelling reread. Maybe it's because it was annoying to keep holding together a 700-page book on the muni, or because I was too familiar with the plot and wanted to speed through to the less familiar OOTP. The flaws of this plot - brilliantly engineered though this book is - were too noticeable this time. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[There's this strange tension between everyone believing that whoever entered Harry into the tournament is trying to kill him and the false Moody's mission to get Harry, in one piece, to the graveyard at the end of the book. If false Moody is so determined to get Harry to Voldemort unscathed, why bother to enter him in the tournament at all? Just bewitch some other Portkey and get him out of the school at the end of the year, if Voldemort does indeed need that time to prepare for the ritual. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="16403579856893312337" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1548476142" />    <a title="Becky" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1376766-becky"><img alt="Becky" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457393924p2/1376766.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1548476142?book_show_action=false">Mar 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Becky" class="user" name="Becky" href="/user/show/1376766-becky">Becky</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=ebook_kindle">ebook_kindle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1548476142" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11574195737272180269">Soooo... I don't really understand why it was left to Dumbledore to decide Harry's placement after his parents' death. Was Sirius not named his Godfather? Sirius's... arrest... was not immediate, at least not from what I gathered from Prisoner of Azkaban - it seemed like it took a bit of time for that to take place. Days, a week, more? Who knows, but it's kind of glossed over why Dumbledore stepped in immediately to make the decisions and override the Godfather status. <br /><br />Inquiring minds would like</span>  <span id="freeText11574195737272180269" style="display:none">Soooo... I don't really understand why it was left to Dumbledore to decide Harry's placement after his parents' death. Was Sirius not named his Godfather? Sirius's... arrest... was not immediate, at least not from what I gathered from Prisoner of Azkaban - it seemed like it took a bit of time for that to take place. Days, a week, more? Who knows, but it's kind of glossed over why Dumbledore stepped in immediately to make the decisions and override the Godfather status. <br /><br />Inquiring minds would like to know! <br /><br />Anyway, this book is where things start getting dark, and where things always start picking up for me. I mean, I GUESS one could say that they start getting dark with book 3, but for me, the delineation is always book 4 - the first time that we see a character that we actually knew in the story die. Up until this point, death was an offscreen event, or averted in some way. So book 4 is the dividing line for me. After this point, the books get much more "real" to me. <br /><br />I love watching Harry grow throughout the series, and I can't wait to get to the next books because these last three are the ones that I wait for the entire series long. </span>  <a data-text-id="11574195737272180269" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div title="Amanda(manduhpaigereads)" class="user" name="Amanda(manduhpaigereads)" href="/user/show/5397606-amanda-manduhpaigereads">Amanda(manduhpaigereads)</a>        rated it        <span class="    <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5397606-amanda-manduhpaigereads?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer177628690" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7060083394961435028">I have a new found appreciation for Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire. It was never my favorite in the series growing up, because it scared me to no end when I was 10 years old, but there is so much amazing that happens in this book. I forgot just how much they left out of the movie, like how much Sirius and Dobby are actually in this book, and S.P.E.W! I completely forgot about Hermione's quest to free all of the house elves. This book made me laugh and cry and made my heart swell with love</span>  <span id="freeText7060083394961435028" style="display:none">I have a new found appreciation for Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire. It was never my favorite in the series growing up, because it scared me to no end when I was 10 years old, but there is so much amazing that happens in this book. I forgot just how much they left out of the movie, like how much Sirius and Dobby are actually in this book, and S.P.E.W! I completely forgot about Hermione's quest to free all of the house elves. This book made me laugh and cry and made my heart swell with love for all of these characters. J.K. Rowling is a genius, she has not only created a fantastic world but she wrote these characters to feel as though they are so very real for her readers. How do you properly put in to words your gratitude for something like that? These books are my childhood and I will continue reading them until I am very old, and every time I pick them up it will feel like the first time.</span>  <a data-text-id="7060083394961435028" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another    </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer344788617" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7983720715643278868">I JUST LOVE THIS SERIES SO MUCH.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1519364425" />    <a title="Sonja - Badass Wanderer" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer"><img alt="Sonja - Badass Wanderer" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467482539p2/35853271.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1519364425?book_show_action=false">Apr 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Sonja - Badass Wanderer" class="user" name="Sonja - Badass Wanderer" href="/user/show/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer">Sonja - Badass Wanderer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=favourite">favourite</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=feel-good">feel-good</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=too-many-feels">too-many-feels</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=love-this-so-much">love-this-so-much</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=dark">dark</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=humour">humour</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=relationships">relationships</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=politics">politics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=magical-writing">magical-writing</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1519364425" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1490731236113252072"><blockquote> <b>"it matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be!"</b> </blockquote><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> is the first HP novel that becomes truly dark. There's death, betrayal and suffering but there's also happiness, friendship and love. It was a rollercoaster of emotions for me. One moment I was happy, the other I was sad, or dreading an event I knew was coming. I was hoping, against all odds, that somehow the plot of <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> had changed since the last time I entered t</span>  <span id="freeText1490731236113252072" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>"it matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be!"</b></blockquote><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> is the first HP novel that becomes truly dark. There's death, betrayal and suffering but there's also happiness, friendship and love. It was a rollercoaster of emotions for me. One moment I was happy, the other I was sad, or dreading an event I knew was coming. I was hoping, against all odds, that somehow the plot of <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> had changed since the last time I entered this world. But it hasn't.<br><br>I found it very interesting to see all the little clues that I didn't notice the first time around, and some things still came as a surprise to me (even though I <i>knew</i> it was going to happen). I guess we all hope that when we reread a book that miraculously its contents change or that it will hurt less. The end still hit me as hard as it did the first time. Some things never change. <br><br>Of course, I'll continue rereading the books. Now that I'm hooked, I can't let go. Even if I wanted to (which I don't).<b>  <blockquote>"Remember Cedric. Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory."</blockquote></b><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1453637095ra/17852355.gif" width="290" height="160" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1382108219ra/5671058.gif" width="290" height="160" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>.<br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1513797809?book_show_action=false">My Review of Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a><br>.<br>.<br>.<br><i>  <u>1st read in August 2014</u></i><br>U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50<b>/5 (9.5/10)</b><br><i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> is an exhilarating novel full of clear signs of bigotry. Bigotry is intolerance towards those who hold different opinions from oneself. In the Harry Potter Universe this can be clearly read. Pure-bloods, half-bloods, wizards from Muggle decent, wizards who are half-giants all of them are prejudiced. J.K. Rowling displays the reader not to judge someone by their blood but by their actions. <br><br>The novel is exciting until the ending. Rowling ends all her novels exceptionally well. The closure ends as how a closure of an adventure in oneU+2019s life would end. ItU+2019s smooth. It doesnU+2019t make the reader feel unsatisfactory. <br>Many surprises are present in the novel. Characters are yet again not who they seem to be. I felt particularly betrayed when <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[the Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, Alastor U+2018Mad-EyeU+2019 Moody, turned out to be a Death-Eater who impersonated Alastor to give Harry to He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named. <br><br>The rise of Lord Voldemort was done splendidly and impressively. For instance, I felt scared when he came to power, as if he was rising to power in my world not in the fictional Harry Potter Universe. When all his Death-Eaters came I had the urge to cast one of the Unforgivable Curses on them. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>The characters, especially Harry, face many challenges which question their braveness, honesty, goodwill, power, wisdom, courage and many other heroic qualities. Harry never fails such a test. I can clearly read HarryU+2019s character and the way he thinks, and what his morals are. Because of this I firmly stood behind him when he faced challenges.<br><br>The novel is very touching. Because I connected and understood the characters well I sympathised with them as well. I must admit that I cried when <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Mrs Weasley told Harry that it wasnU+2019t his fault that Cedric died. Harry could have never known that their good intentions and goodwill towards each other caused CedricU+2019s tragic ending. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I cried a bit as well when <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Dumbledore said to remember Cedric during the Leaving Feast. The characters feel like friends that I have known for four years, since they enrolled Hogwarts. And to see one of them die a horrific death is very dreadful and sickening. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>The comical aspect of the Harry Potter novels hasnU+2019t faded. From names (RonU+2019s tiny and thin eagle named Pig) to hilarious lettres (from Ron as well) and comments (from the Weasleys in general and once from Amos Diggory (please-men = Muggle police men)), this novel didnU+2019t disappoint. I love how J.K. Rowling makes the novel more light-hearted and easier for the heart by writing some foolishness and hilarity in the novel. <br><br>All in all, <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i> was <b>AWESOMETACULAR</b>.<blockquote> U+2018 U+2018Knows people can turn out OK even if their families werenU+2019 U+2026 well U+2026 all thaU+2019 respectable. But some donU+2019t understand that. ThereU+2019s some whoU+2019d always hold it against yeh U+2026 thereU+2019s some whoU+2019d even pretend they just had big bones rather than stand up anU+2019 say - I am what I am, anU+2019 IU+2019m not ashamed. U+2018 U+2018Never be ashamed,U+2019 U+2019 my olU+2019 dad used ter say, U+2018thereU+2019s some whoU+2019ll hold it against you, but theyU+2019re not worth botherinU+2019 with.U+2019 U+2019 U+2019 - Hagrid, p.395-396</blockquote><blockquote> U+2018 U+2018If you want to know what a manU+2019s like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+2019 U+2019 - Sirius, p.456</blockquote><blockquote>U+2018 U+2018You place too much importance, and you always have done, on the so-called purity of blood! You fail to recognise that it matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be!U+2019 U+2019 - Dumbledore, p.614-615</blockquote><blockquote> U+2018 U+2018we are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.U+2019 U+2019 - Dumbledore, p.627</blockquote></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="1490731236113252072" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/918499257" />    <a title="Seeker of dreams" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30798098-seeker-of-dreams"><img alt="Seeker of dreams" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451691002p2/30798098.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/918499257?book_show_action=false">Jan 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Seeker of dreams" class="user" name="Seeker of dreams" href="/user/show/30798098-seeker-of-dreams">Seeker of dreams</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30798098-seeker-of-dreams?shelf=read-in-2014">read-in-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30798098-seeker-of-dreams?shelf=all-books-on-my-shelf">all-books-on-my-shelf</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30798098-seeker-of-dreams?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer918499257" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12083561102062602278"><i>U+2014 Re-read January 2016 U+2014</i><br /><br />Wow. Just wow. J. K. Rowling leaves me speechless every time I read one of her books. The ending is one of the most intense endings Ive ever read. I could read this book a million times and never get tired. I absolutely love it.<br /><blockquote> <b>U+201CIf you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D</b> </blockquote><br /><i>U+2014 Read for the first time in February 2013 U+2014</i><br /></span>  <span id="freeText12083561102062602278" style="display:none"><i>U+2014 Re-read January 2016 U+2014</i><br /><br />Wow. Just wow. J. K. Rowling leaves me speechless every time I read one of her books. The ending is one of the most intense endings IU+00B4ve ever read. I could read this book a million times and never get tired. I absolutely love it.<br /><blockquote>  <b>U+201CIf you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D</b></blockquote><br /><i>U+2014 Read for the first time in February 2013 U+2014</i><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="12083561102062602278" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior?shelf=i-love-this-book">i-love-this-book</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer57105728" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7886244902603691076">So I reread this book once again and decided that I still love it.<br />I adore this book. It's probably one of my favourite in the series.<br />It's funny in parts, full of action and when it gets to the climax.<br />The climax of the book is enough to blow folks' head off.<br />Yes, it's a long heavy book, but I don't care. I like that about it.<br /><br />More later.<br /><br />Read this again last month 8/2011<br /><br />This is the book that makes you realize it's ON. Don't let the happy cover fool you, for these covers are way too ridiculously happ</span>  <span id="freeText7886244902603691076" style="display:none">So I reread this book once again and decided that I still love it.<br />I adore this book. It's probably one of my favourite in the series.<br />It's funny in parts, full of action and when it gets to the climax.<br />The climax of the book is enough to blow folks' head off.<br />Yes, it's a long heavy book, but I don't care. I like that about it.<br /><br />More later.<br /><br />Read this again last month 8/2011<br /><br />This is the book that makes you realize it's ON. Don't let the happy cover fool you, for these covers are way too ridiculously happy considering what Harry goes through in this book.<br />It's bad enough he's forced into the Triwizard tournament against his will. And what kind of people allow CHILDREN to participate in something so dangerous? The wizarding world is sick, and this is the book that makes you understand this.<br />He survives one event after the other, not knowing what's really in store for him. Not knowing that this is the book that starts the battle Harry has been preparing for his whole life.<br /><br />Also, the movie of this book is the WORSE. It's terrible! I know it's hard to condense a book this thick, rich and creamy into a movie, but it's like they took an orange, scooped out the pulp, put water in the skin and high fructose corn syrup and ruddy fake orange flavor and stuck a straw in it! They cut all of the strongest, best scenes and added stupid tacked on scenes that did nothing for the story! Avoid the movie. Read the dang book! It does not take that much effort to read a book with hundreds of pages and it's so enjoyable, funny, poignant and just plan good!<br /><br />2013<br /><br />I read it again, now the only problem I have with this book was A. When Harry is in the pond, can anyone see anything? Are they just sitting there watching boring water? B. Can they see what is going on in the maze? Didn't they see Harry and Cedric disappear? </span>  <a data-text-id="7886244902603691076" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div esos son mis dedos</s><br><br><blockquote> <i> <b>InclU+00EDnate ante la muerte, Harry.</b> </i> </blockquote><br><br>Aaaah, hermosa relectura. Rowling se supera a sU+00ED misma en esta cuarta entrega. Mientras que los tres libros anteriores parecieron mU+00E1s bien un ensayo, esta fue la obra propiamente dicha. No solo mejora en materia de narraciU+00F3n sino tambiU+00E9n en ingeniosidad e inteligencia en el argumento. Todo encaja, todo cierra perfectamente. <br><br><blockquote> <b>[...] Pero no vendrU+00EDa mal reU+00EDrme un poco. Tal vez todos necesitemos reU+00EDrnos. Me temo que dentro de poco nos van a h</b></blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText6384974854605308932" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1431700620i/14860798._SY540_.jpg" width="400" height="533" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><s>SU+00ED, esos son mis dedos</s><br><br><blockquote>  <i>    <b>InclU+00EDnate ante la muerte, Harry.</b>  </i></blockquote><br><br>Aaaah, hermosa relectura. Rowling se supera a sU+00ED misma en esta cuarta entrega. Mientras que los tres libros anteriores parecieron mU+00E1s bien un ensayo, esta fue la obra propiamente dicha. No solo mejora en materia de narraciU+00F3n sino tambiU+00E9n en ingeniosidad e inteligencia en el argumento. Todo encaja, todo cierra perfectamente. <br><br><blockquote>  <b>[...] Pero no vendrU+00EDa mal reU+00EDrme un poco. Tal vez todos necesitemos reU+00EDrnos. Me temo que dentro de poco nos van a hacer falta muchas risas.</b></blockquote><br><br>No recordaba que este libro me fuera tan triste. Pero como estoy en esos dU+00EDas del mes creo que me pegU+00F3 por el lado de la sensibilidad. <b>No me toquen. Don't fucking touch me.</b><br><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1431700620ra/14860799.gif" width="400" height="164" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><blockquote>  <i>Recuerden a Cedric. RecuU+00E9rdenlo si en algU+00FAn momento de su vida tienen que optar entre lo que estU+00E1 bien y lo que es cU+00F3modo, recuerden lo que le ocurriU+00F3 a un muchacho que era bueno, amable y valiente, solo porque se cruzU+00F3 en el camino de lord Voldemort. <b>Recuerden a Cedric Diggory.</b></i></blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="6384974854605308932" href="#" class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40986336-nariman?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40986336-nariman?shelf=five-stars">five-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40986336-nariman?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40986336-nariman?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1431426386" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9900492774787644575">I thought while reading , J.K Rowling won't be able to surprise me this time , I would guess at least something or two before it was revealed , I wouldn't have been more mistaken !! I completely got surprised and shocked , I said to my self after finishing it , it is a children book for haven's sake , how can you be this shocked and heartbroken and even leak some tears towards its end.<br />Oh this series DOES develop in a way I never thought possible , I only hope it continues like this , I didn't se</span>  <span id="freeText9900492774787644575" style="display:none">I thought while reading , J.K Rowling won't be able to surprise me this time , I would guess at least something or two before it was revealed , I wouldn't have been more mistaken !! I completely got surprised and shocked , I said to my self after finishing it , it is a children book for haven's sake , how can you be this shocked and heartbroken and even leak some tears towards its end.<br />Oh this series DOES develop in a way I never thought possible , I only hope it continues like this , I didn't see the movies , forbid any talk about the series in front of me , avoided any thing about it in the Internet , and very good I've done that , because now I lived this pure joy while reading it and knowing every thing for the very first time and living all those wonderful feelings , if I could , I would forget every thing and read them again and again and again for the first times , and I think now this book and the previous one will reside very dearly in my favorites shelf , very well deserved.</span>  <a data-text-id="9900492774787644575" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div href="/user/show/26439378-lauren">Lauren</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26439378-lauren?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9033535561949609770"><b>This was a re-read for me</b><br /><br />Re-reading this series makes me feel all these different emotions and I love this series so much! This has always been my favourite Harry Potter book but after re-reading the third I was starting to think that it wasnU+2019t. Now after finishing it IU+2019ve realized that this is the best book in the series. Since this is a re-read I can see all the hints about whatU+2019s going to happen later in the book. This is an amazing series and IU+2019m so obsessed.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1424434355" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1424434355" />    <a title="Dee U+2661" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7100759-dee"><img alt="Dee U+2661" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477031502p2/7100759.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1424434355?book_show_action=false">Oct 29, 2015</a>      <a title="Dee U+2661" class="user" name="Dee U+2661" href="/user/show/7100759-dee">Dee U+2661</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1424434355" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4132645424739750631"><b>U+201CIf you want to know what a manU+2019s like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D</b><br /><br />Completely blown away by this book, I find myself in awe once again at RowlingU+2019s magical gift of storytelling. She really went beyond herself with this series. ItU+2019s evident how much thought and heart went into these books because you can pick out hints at stuff that doesnU+2019t even come into play until the later books. Because I have already watched the movies a dozen times at least, I was able</span>  <span id="freeText4132645424739750631" style="display:none"><b>U+201CIf you want to know what a manU+2019s like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.U+201D</b><br /><br />Completely blown away by this book, I find myself in awe once again at RowlingU+2019s magical gift of storytelling. She really went beyond herself with this series. ItU+2019s evident how much thought and heart went into these books because you can pick out hints at stuff that doesnU+2019t even come into play until the later books. Because I have already watched the movies a dozen times at least, I was able to pick up on such hints but I am still pleasantly surprised by how she delivered. There was so much, so much, in this book that I absolutely loved. We are given a load of information more about You-Know-Who that we didnU+2019t already and really understand what happened to him while he was withering without his powers. The whole book was really long and felt a little slow at times, especially in the beginning, however I still loved every second of it. I really never have a single complaint when it comes to this series because everything fits into play so nicely and is so stunning.<br /><br />Harry, Ron, and Hermione are really starting to grow up and you see that blossoming in this book. Things are changing between them. You see that happen with Ron and HarryU+2019s fight, Ron and HermioneU+2019s fight, and they come out even stronger than before. I canU+2019t get enough of these three. They are truly the best friendship I have ever read and nothing else will compare. I really enjoy who Harry is becoming. He is growing stronger and trusting himself more. Hermione is growing into a firecracker and I love it! Her standing up for house-elves and going against Rita Skeeter were so entertaining. I loved seeing RonU+2019s jealousy take hold of him in this book because it just shows him vulnerable and real. Oh! And the way The WeasleyU+2019s are just officially HarryU+2019s family now completely warmed my heart. I loved seeing Mr. Weasley lecture Uncle Vernon into saying goodbye to Harry when he was leaving and how Mrs. Weasley and Bill were there waiting for him before the Third Task U+2665 U+2665<br /><br /><b>U+201CIU+2019m never wearing them,U+201D Ron was saying stubbornly. U+201CNever.U+201D<br />U+201CFine,U+201D snapped Mrs. Weasley. U+201CGo naked. And, Harry, make sure you get a picture of him. Goodness knows I could do with a laugh.U+201D</b><br /><br />Also, I have to admit it was so cute to see strong, brooding Vickor Krum so smitten over our beloved Hermione. Or should I say Herm-own-ninny :)<br /><br />The plot was fantastic. I donU+2019t think I was ever bored for one second. I loved the introduction of new Wizardry schools outside Hogwarts and bringing them together for the Triwizard Tournament. The Tournament itself was pretty awesome with the awesome plot twist at the end. Everything connected so beautifully! I get so excited reading it while all the pieces fall into place *sigh* Though I still did cry my eyes out whenU+2026you knowU+2026happened :'(<br /><br /><b>U+201CUnderstanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.U+201D</b><br /><br />IU+2019ve heard countless times how each book gets darker and darker, and though I saw the evidence of this beginning with Prisoner of Azkaban, it really built its foundation with this book. Boy was it darker! Now I can see why people say that only the first two books were really U+201CchildrenU+2019s booksU+201D but the series afterwards matures. I couldnU+2019t agree more. Goblet of Fire is definitely my favorite book so far. It has always been my favorite movie so I was excited to read this one. Though I can undoubtedly say that this is my favorite book it is no longer my favorite movie of the series. There was just too much that they left out that I thought would have been important. Now I know, guys. Now I know :'(<br /><br />Favorite part?<b> Snuffles. Definitely Snuffles.</b><br /><br />Originally posted on <a href="https://thebookishkhaleesi.wordpress.com/2015/10/29/harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire-harry-potter-4-by-j-k-rowling/" rel="nofollow"> The Bookish Khaleesi</a></span>  <a data-text-id="4132645424739750631" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1424434355">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1424434355" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1674226045" />    <a title="Allison" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9371994-allison"><img alt="Allison" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461856985p2/9371994.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1674226045?book_show_action=false">Jul 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Allison" class="user" name="Allison" href="/user/show/9371994-allison">Allison</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="ebook 9781781105672" href="/book/show/30656829-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=dark-or-violent">dark-or-violent</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=sad-or-tragic">sad-or-tragic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=boarding-school">boarding-school</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=best-of-2016">best-of-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9371994-allison?shelf=chunkster-500-800">chunkster-500-800</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1674226045" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4305009763636396645">This is my second time reading <i>The Goblet of Fire</i>, and I still (mostly) loved it. The Weasleys' house, the Quidditch World Cup, being at Hogwarts, the tournament, and seeing Harry actually struggle to learn charms and curses - these were all so fun. I love this world, and loved seeing new parts of it. <br /><br />BUT, it's getting dark. I found myself dreading certain parts, knowing what was coming. And with prior knowledge, events seemed even more sinister than before. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I enjoyed Mad-Eye Mood</span></span>  <span id="freeText4305009763636396645" style="display:none">This is my second time reading <i>The Goblet of Fire</i>, and I still (mostly) loved it. The Weasleys' house, the Quidditch World Cup, being at Hogwarts, the tournament, and seeing Harry actually struggle to learn charms and curses - these were all so fun. I love this world, and loved seeing new parts of it. <br /><br />BUT, it's getting dark. I found myself dreading certain parts, knowing what was coming. And with prior knowledge, events seemed even more sinister than before. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I enjoyed Mad-Eye Moody the first time around, but this time I saw his actions in a completely different light. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> People are betraying and cursing each other left and right, and even good wizards and witches are just generally being ugly people. Not to mention the killings. This is not a children's adventure story anymore. <br /><br />Honestly, this is where I begin to miss the wonder and charm of the wizarding world that balanced the dark in the first three books. Now everything starts to become tainted by realistic meanness, adolescent angst, real violence and death. So sad. I love the story, but hate some of the things that happen in it. I'm so conflicted! Still a favorite, though.</span>  <a data-text-id="4305009763636396645" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_829021572" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/829021572" />    <a title="Cait (Paper Fury)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury"><img alt="Cait (Paper Fury)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1356324709p2/11375137.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/829021572?book_show_action=false">Jan 26, 2015</a>      <a title="Cait (Paper Fury)" class="user" name="Cait (Paper Fury)" href="/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury">Cait (Paper Fury)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=paranormal">paranormal</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=magical-fantasy">magical-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=4-star">4-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=read-2014">read-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=ya-male-narrators">ya-male-narrators</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer829021572" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10294149534605756870">Do I get a cookie for ploughing through 600+ pages, when I normally read 300pg books? DO I GET A BIG COOKIE??? Not that this was awful to read! No, not at all...it's just: exhaustion. Completely. Hey I just battled Voldemort. <br><br>Make that some a tall glass of milk with my cookie, thank you very much. <br><br><b> I'm still only giving it 4-stars, but that's mainly for the sheer quantity of Quidditch. </b> Kick me out of the fandom, but I don't really CARE about sports. Never have. So the first 100 or so pages, whi</span>  <span id="freeText10294149534605756870" style="display:none">Do I get a cookie for ploughing through 600+ pages, when I normally read 300pg books? DO I GET A BIG COOKIE??? Not that this was awful to read! No, not at all...it's just: exhaustion. Completely. Hey I just battled Voldemort. <br><br>Make that some a tall glass of milk with my cookie, thank you very much. <br><br><b> I'm still only giving it 4-stars, but that's mainly for the sheer quantity of Quidditch. </b> Kick me out of the fandom, but I don't really CARE about sports. Never have. So the first 100 or so pages, while they set up some mysteries, kind of bored me. And the finale let me down a little because there was a LOT of info-dumping. <br><br>But that's it. That's ALL I disliked. CAN I NOW LIST ALL THE AWESOMENESS?<br>(Everyone reviews and reads Harry Potter, so 'scuse me, but I'm not writing a proper review. Go read it, if you haven't. It's awesome.)<br><br><b> - The Weasley family. </b> AS ALWAYS. I will never stop loving Mr and Mrs Weasley. And the whole big family dynamics is spot-on-perfect, and I would know, because I feel like a Weasley in my family sometimes. Fred and George will always make me laugh. LOVE THEM. And Ron. Ron is awesome as well. <br><b> - Ron, Hermione and Harry. </b> They are my all time favourite friendship trio, these days. Except it's getting awkward and strained because BAM PUBERTY. But still. I love them! I <i> hate </i> it when they fight though. Gaaah! I feel like Hermione when Harry and Ron had that hissy fit at the beginning. Knock their little heads together. <br><b> - Magic school. </b> It's worth mentioning continually, okay? I want to go to magic school...I waaaaant it. <br><b> - Woah, new characters everywhere. </b> <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ And our first death. WOAH.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I was a wee bit confused with the sheer quantity of people, but hey. That's this series, apparently. <br><b> - Riddles and mazes and things! </b> They always impress me. I like to see if I can figure them out along with the characters. Clue: I cannot. <br><b> - Sirus. </b> Thank you, JK Rowling, for finally getting a grownup who really cares for Harry. Even if said grownup is mostly a dog.<br><br><b> BUT I DO HAVE A FROWNIE FACE. </b> Why the HECK is Snape still hired?? He's a pure teacher-bully and, like, sue him or something, but it's <i> wrong </i> the way he treats the Gryffindor students. Not even just Harry! He's downright cruel to Neville and Hermione, too. It's infuriating.<br><br>So to appease my SNAPE HATE, I rewatch this GIF fifty-two billion times. Then I feel better. <br><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1402136911r/9898116.gif?147972794361568" width="300" height="2600" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg hostedImg" data-src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1402136911r/9898116.gif" style=";display:none;" data-error="[image error]" onerror="$j(this).loadHostedImage();" onload="$j(this).loadHostedImage();"><img src="/assets/loading-trans.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg loadingImg"><br><br><br>BRING ON BOOK #5!! WOOHOOO!<br></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="10294149534605756870" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review829021572">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link829021572" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=829021572&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_829021572'><a id="like_count_review_829021572" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/829021572?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">18 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_829021572" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_829021572" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=18&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=829021572&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_829021572" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 829021572, true, &#39;&#39;); class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/39719286-christine-weereader?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1486383076" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7443497140496123551">I love that in this book we really see Ron, Harry and Hermione mature and grow. They are really starting to get to grips with magic and it's so great to see their friendship growing and becoming more complex. It is also so great to see the development of every other character, no character is ever left behind.<br />The Quidditch World Cup is always a joy to read about, the level of detail is amazing. I absolutely love seeing different Wizarding cultures and so this book has always been one of my favou</span>  <span id="freeText7443497140496123551" style="display:none">I love that in this book we really see Ron, Harry and Hermione mature and grow. They are really starting to get to grips with magic and it's so great to see their friendship growing and becoming more complex. It is also so great to see the development of every other character, no character is ever left behind.<br />The Quidditch World Cup is always a joy to read about, the level of detail is amazing. I absolutely love seeing different Wizarding cultures and so this book has always been one of my favourites. <br />Reading book always feels like a turning point in Harry's life, thing's become much darker and the challenges he face become much more intertwined with his life. It becomes difficult to see who can and can't be trusted. JK Rowling is so amazing at creating interesting and layered plots.<br />I really love the smaller characters in this book, such as Winky, Dobby and Pigwidgeon. Every detail is there for a reason and every character is well developed, no matter how small their plot is.<br />Of course the Triwizard Tournament is phenomenal and I never feel like this book is boring, no matter how many times I reread it, as we are always heading towards the next task.<br />I always feel conflicted, especially in Goblet of Fire. I can't decide if I like Dumbledore and respect the decisions he makes, or if I think he is manipulative and nasty for using Harry the way he does.</span>  <a data-text-id="7443497140496123551" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=all-timefavorites">all-timefavorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=kidlit">kidlit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=read-aloud">read-aloud</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer3235897" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2150670206084399453">This is the turning point of the series. The first real death, the first of the "long books." It really feels like Rowling was let loose by her editor to just tell the story she wanted to tell, and the length and age-appropriateness be damned! <br /><br />On the one hand, YAY! But on the other hand I will admit that this is probably the most clunky of the books. There's SO MUCH going on!<br /><br />Re-read (aloud), 2016: The kids loved it, of course. And I am grateful that both the older kids can now be handed the book</span>  <span id="freeText2150670206084399453" style="display:none">This is the turning point of the series. The first real death, the first of the "long books." It really feels like Rowling was let loose by her editor to just tell the story she wanted to tell, and the length and age-appropriateness be damned! <br /><br />On the one hand, YAY! But on the other hand I will admit that this is probably the most clunky of the books. There's SO MUCH going on!<br /><br />Re-read (aloud), 2016: The kids loved it, of course. And I am grateful that both the older kids can now be handed the book to read for a bit while I blubber over the toast to Cedric Diggory. </span>  <a data-text-id="2150670206084399453" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review300681527">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1477089239" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1477089239" />    <a title="Moraes the Bookworm" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm"><img alt="Moraes the Bookworm" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465866511p2/50389307.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1477089239?book_show_action=false">Jun 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Moraes the Bookworm" class="user" name="Moraes the Bookworm" href="/user/show/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm">Moraes the Bookworm</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=amazing-scenery-description">amazing-scenery-description</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=mild-angst">mild-angst</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=in-your-face-magic">in-your-face-magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=original-magic-system">original-magic-system</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=contemporary">contemporary</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=memorable-secondary-characters">memorable-secondary-characters</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1477089239" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14973465646078102140">We arrive to the fourth year of HarryU+2019s adventures after having discovered he is a wizard. I really like this book for it is, as I see it, the one where Rowling finally puts loose ends from the previous ones together. <b>This is where the author finally proves that she is not just writing a childrenU+2019s story; she is writing a far more complex symphony of events than anyone could have guessed.</b> As usual, the book begins with Harry feeling miserable, having to endure the Dursleys during one more summer</span>  <span id="freeText14973465646078102140" style="display:none">We arrive to the fourth year of HarryU+2019s adventures after having discovered he is a wizard. I really like this book for it is, as I see it, the one where Rowling finally puts loose ends from the previous ones together. <b>This is where the author finally proves that she is not just writing a childrenU+2019s story; she is writing a far more complex symphony of events than anyone could have guessed.</b> As usual, the book begins with Harry feeling miserable, having to endure the Dursleys during one more summer break. This time, however, he has one more reason to look forwards to the end of the summer besides returning to Hogwarts. He has received an invitation from the Weasleys to go to the World Quidditch Cup final! Soon enough, after a hilarious interaction between Dursleys and Weasleys, we get to learn more about the small but wonderful details of WeasleysU+2019 home and way of living.<br><br>tRowling quickly leads the events to the place where the Quidditch game will happen, and it is fantastic. It is cool seeing wizards from all different parts of the world interacting with each other in other place than Hogwarts. Everybody is anticipating the game and Rowling does a good job of explaining each team through the characters; we end up with enough background to start cheering for one or other team ourselves. The way the game itself was written is really good; I felt almost like I was there watching the whole thing myself. However, the part that I liked the most was when the teams got to display some of their countriesU+2019 magical creatures during the halftime. Leprechauns are interesting, but what really stood out to me were the Veelas, as I had never heard of such a creature.<br><br>tMoving on from the game, we are back to the camp where the tents are set. Everybody is chilling out inside the WeasleysU+2019 tent, discussing about the game, just having a good time. And that is when everything falls apart. It seems that the dark forces prophesized to arise at the end of the third book have finally awoken. <b>Dark magic from a not too distant past seem to be gathering under a unifying evil power.</b> Differently from previous books, we see Harry and his friends having to face danger and imminent death already at a very early stage of the book, and that is amazing.<br><br>tFrom this point we are moved almost directly to Hogwarts, where things are also about to change a lot. It seems that the Ministry of Magic has decided it is a good time to bring back an old competition between the best sorcery schools of Europe: the Triwizard Tournament. Therefore, all of a sudden, we have a bunch of new characters thrown into the story, what really hadnU+2019t happened so much in the previous books. That is refreshing but also somewhat disturbing, because we do not know (at least at the beginning) who should be trusted, so that old sense of danger awaiting in the corners is back. <br><br>tThe whole book follows the events set for the competition and, during this process, we get to see significant character development. The message is clear: it is not a childrenU+2019s book anymore. There is conflict, all drama that comes with becoming a teenager, even a little bit of teenage love starts being explored by the author. It is also a different experience seeing Hermione being interested in social/revolutionary causes, instead of just being a bookworm.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1440126008i/15934139._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>tAs the story moves on it gets darker and darker. It is not a book for attached people; people die here and you might not be ok with that. At the end, we are thrown in a hurricane of nightmares; Harry, despite his young age, has to face once again forces too powerful and too evil for his abilities. The end is very emotional, dark and it sets the crescendo for the symphony that this story is.: there is no more room for happiness and innocence, war is coming.<br><br><u>  <b>Interesting quotes that I didn't include in the review:</b></u><br><i>  <blockquote>If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.</blockquote></i><br><i>  <blockquote>It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.</blockquote></i><br><i>  <blockquote>Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.</blockquote></i><br></span>  <a data-text-id="14973465646078102140" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1477089239">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1580251095" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1580251095" />    <a title="Rivka Ray" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38496373-rivka-ray"><img alt="Rivka Ray" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465823245p2/38496373.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1580251095?book_show_action=false">Apr 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Rivka Ray" class="user" name="Rivka Ray" href="/user/show/38496373-rivka-ray">Rivka Ray</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38496373-rivka-ray?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38496373-rivka-ray?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38496373-rivka-ray?shelf=here-be-dragons">here-be-dragons</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1580251095" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6537068659634147467">Initial thoughts:<br />I care too much about a fictional sport.<br />I care too much about fictional characters.<br />I'm going to need a week in the hospital wing under Madam Pomfrey's care to recover from this.<br /><br />More thoughts:<br />I thought The Prisoner of Azkaban was my favorite book. That was before I read The Goblet of Fire. Now I really don't know which is my favorite. They are both amazing!!<br /><br />Firstly, I find large books intimidating. I made comments when I was starting this about how long it was. But once I started</span>  <span id="freeText6537068659634147467" style="display:none">Initial thoughts:<br />I care too much about a fictional sport.<br />I care too much about fictional characters.<br />I'm going to need a week in the hospital wing under Madam Pomfrey's care to recover from this.<br /><br />More thoughts:<br />I thought The Prisoner of Azkaban was my favorite book. That was before I read The Goblet of Fire. Now I really don't know which is my favorite. They are both amazing!!<br /><br />Firstly, I find large books intimidating. I made comments when I was starting this about how long it was. But once I started reading, I hardly noticed the size. The pages went by so fast!!<br /><br />The world feels so much bigger in this book. We really get the feel of what it is like to live there, and we meet people from other countries and other schools. I really like how the world is developing.<br /><br />Quidditch is the best sport ever. I really wish I could play Quidditch! Alas, I'll have to settle for Ultimate. The first glorious 200 pages of this book are spent mostly on Quidditch and the Weasleys. I could not ask for better!!<br /><br />The Weasleys are awesome as always. The fireplace. Fred and George vs. Dudley. <3<3 I really liked meeting the older Weasleys too. I was disappointed in Mrs. Weasleys reaction to the Skeeter article about Hermione....<br />Speaking of which, Hermione is an awesome friend! I loved her character in this book so much better than the previous books. And I loathed Rita Skeeter. I'm right with Hermione on wanting to find a way to stop her. <br /><br />Ron and Harry's jealousy throughout the book got a little wearying at times. But let's not talk about what I was like at their age, okay? Middle School is rough.<br /><br />Mad-eye Moody. I didn't know what to think of him at first. But he really grew on me. He helped Harry out and seemed pretty awesome. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Until he tricked me. TWICE!! When he told Harry that he has set everything up, I was shocked, but actually believed it was Mad-eye. Then he proved to be Mr. Crouch Jr. Yeah, just totally shocked at the whole thing.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Everything with Voldemort was sufficiently creepy and mind blowing. I could say so much about this, but I think I'll save that for after I've read the rest of the books. <br />Sadly, I won't be reading any more Harry Potter until mid-May. I don't have any more breaks until then, and I know I'll let myself read these instead of doing school. So after term it will be. *sigh*<br /><br />I've always heard Harry Potter described as fantasy. I didn't know they were mysteries! I kinda look forward to rereading this someday and picking up on all the clues I missed.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="6537068659634147467" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1580251095">  <td itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1540394911" />    <a title="Saoirse Sterling" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling"><img alt="Saoirse Sterling" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478339708p2/4639825.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1540394911?book_show_action=false">Jun 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Saoirse Sterling" class="user" name="Saoirse Sterling" href="/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling">Saoirse Sterling</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bairns">bairns</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=sterling">sterling</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=seen-t-film">seen-t-film</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=childhood">childhood</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ahreet">ahreet</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=feminine">feminine</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ce21">ce21</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bookshelf">bookshelf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1540394911" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12709020773583664737">[First read: December, 2001. 4 stars.<br />Second read: 12th February, 2016. 3 stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target="_blank" href="https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html" rel="nofollow">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br /><i>The Goblet of Fire</i> is quite a great improvement on the writing side of the series so far: when I first read these books I didn't much care on how well written they were, but in terms of the usual (punctuation, grammar, spelling etc) it was steady as before, but the pacing and characters were much better and further developed t</span>  <span id="freeText12709020773583664737" style="display:none">[First read: December, 2001. 4 stars.<br />Second read: 12th February, 2016. 3 stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target="_blank" href="https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html" rel="nofollow">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br /><i>The Goblet of Fire</i> is quite a great improvement on the writing side of the series so far: when I first read these books I didn't much care on how well written they were, but in terms of the usual (punctuation, grammar, spelling etc) it was steady as before, but the pacing and characters were much better and further developed than before.<br /><br />The main things I enjoyed about this book were quite few and far between, but first and foremost, the development of Hermione is something I'm looking at much closely and I thought she had grown quite a lot since <i>The Prisoner of Azkaban</i> here. I've found that Ron and Harry are pretty much the same as they were since the beginning, and I've never really much enjoyed Harry as a character anyway (how much better would it be if Neville were the protagonist? Funnier, in any case), but the way Hermione handled herself, spoke to others (both those her own age and those older or younger) and just her general demeanour was nice to read about. I also thought Molly really came in to her own, too, though I'm surprised there isn't more Ginny around in these first four books considering how bleedin' important she becomes later on.<br /><br />The plot never really grabbed me and I don't think it ever had. I can barely remember anything of the film at all either (about to be re-watched later...). I've found that a lot of the things that happen are just co-incidental, or seem that way. I also think it's quite infuriating the way magic is used in such a blasU+00E9 manner: oh, one night to grow back bones? How handy. A specific spell for that one specific problem? How handy. There being hardly any consequences for doing any kind of magic? <i>How handy.</i> The magic system isn't the best and I feel like it's become quite background, until it's needed to disarm or kill or something, and I find that I kind of skip over the magical elements that are wand-provided.<br /><br />I'm still not really feeling the vibe and at this point I can't see myself re-reading them ever again, though the next book has Luna and everyone bloody loves Luna, which oddly hasn't put me off her like it usually would other things. If anyone can make me feel the magic, it's Luna.</span>  <a data-text-id="12709020773583664737" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>
