id='comments_for_review_1540394911' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1191371934" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1191371934" />    <a title="Jonathan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6313408-jonathan"><img alt="Jonathan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478230200p2/6313408.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1191371934?book_show_action=false">Feb 24, 2015</a>      <a title="Jonathan" class="user" name="Jonathan" href="/user/show/6313408-jonathan">Jonathan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=children-s-literature">children-s-literature</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourite-series">favourite-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=books-with-films-2">books-with-films-2</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=worldbuilding">worldbuilding</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1191371934" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7217183195233924386">I wasn't a huge fan of the preceding books in the <i>Harry Potter</i> franchise. I appreciated the worldbuilding certainly, but felt underwhelmed by the characterization, the writing and the plotting. The writing seemed to lack subtlety and nuance in certain places, becoming rather cheesy rather than charming as Rowling wished to allude to. Further the fact that you have heroes in these novels who are witches and wizards without a sense of proper limitation on their power (aside from that some witches</span>  <span id="freeText7217183195233924386" style="display:none">I wasn't a huge fan of the preceding books in the <i>Harry Potter</i> franchise. I appreciated the worldbuilding certainly, but felt underwhelmed by the characterization, the writing and the plotting. The writing seemed to lack subtlety and nuance in certain places, becoming rather cheesy rather than charming as Rowling wished to allude to. Further the fact that you have heroes in these novels who are witches and wizards without a sense of proper limitation on their power (aside from that some witches and wizards are just stronger and naturally better than others) irked me. But that all said I finally found plenty more to enjoy in this fourth novel in the series and am already moving onto the fifth novel.<br /><br />The strength of this novel is in the overall worldbuilding. Rowling has created a world of magic that you would almost want to visit, yet in the previous novels I also felt that this magical world was too 'safe'. Sure you had trolls, dragons and werewolves, but there wasn't this real sense of danger. Not so with <i>The Goblet of Fire</i>. Indeed everything from characterization, plotting and overall writing seems to have improved in this novel - although Rowling also becomes much more incredibly lengthy in how she writes. <br /><br />I'm rather glad, this all said, that I didn't read these novels when they were hyped up exercises in marketing. I feel that I would have been disappointed in returning to read them again as a young adult in my early twenties as it were. Not to mention that I previously had little desire to dive into the world of these novels. So that all said I would actually recommend getting young teens (rather than children) to read these novels by themselves, or would use them and read them with young children. I would, however, prefer to direct teens to other books that I find to be better on the whole but you can't deny there is a certain charm to these novels that rubs off on the reader... They feel somewhat like timeless children's novels and I have no doubt that they will continue to be read in the future.</span>  <a data-text-id="7217183195233924386" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1191371934">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1191371934" title="Flag this review as itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/970838254" />    <a title="Brianna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21528283-brianna"><img alt="Brianna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444706084p2/21528283.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/970838254?book_show_action=false">Dec 12, 2015</a>      <a title="Brianna" class="user" name="Brianna" href="/user/show/21528283-brianna">Brianna</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855928" href="/book/show/22037439-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21528283-brianna?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer970838254" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9733898564488552446">My sister keeps joking about as the books go on, the darker they get. I can't agree with her more. By the end of this, I could tell by how much that is so very true. I do however need to knock of 1/2 a star... it wasn't until the second half (maybe) that it started picking up. The first 100 or so pages in my opinion were boring. But that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy or like anything that happened. Not true. Just, compared to the events and the timing throughout the first 3, this seemed to drag</span>  <span id="freeText9733898564488552446" style="display:none">My sister keeps joking about as the books go on, the darker they get. I can't agree with her more. By the end of this, I could tell by how much that is so very true. I do however need to knock of 1/2 a star... it wasn't until the second half (maybe) that it started picking up. The first 100 or so pages in my opinion were boring. But that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy or like anything that happened. Not true. Just, compared to the events and the timing throughout the first 3, this seemed to drag on. I could definitely tell as the year went on for Harry's 4th year at Hogwarts. The first 3 I had no idea an entire year had already passed. Of course I have absolutely no bad comments ever, I'm in LOVE with this series (as to be expected). I just don't want anyone getting a bad vibe from this review. I'm excited/nervous to see what happens next! BRING ON THE BIGGEST BOOK IN THE SERIES!!</span>  <a data-text-id="9733898564488552446" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div          <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=friendship-of-the-unshakable-kind">friendship-of-the-unshakable-kind</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" id="reviewTextContainer1472528706" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10739749580624026246">The Quidditch World Cup was so much fun to read about!<br /><br />I loved Moody even if he wasn't all that err himself. His lesson on Unforgivable Curses is still my favorite after the Boggart one by Lupin.<br /><br />Fucking Rita Skeeter, though.<br /><br />I especially loved the focus on non-mistreatment of house elves and the dynamics of the wizarding world. It was interesting to see how untrustworthy they are among their foreign counterparts and it's not so different from our own world...<br /><br />Also, really. Is there any mythical and</span>  <span id="freeText10739749580624026246" style="display:none">The Quidditch World Cup was so much fun to read about!<br /><br />I loved Moody even if he wasn't all that err himself. His lesson on Unforgivable Curses is still my favorite after the Boggart one by Lupin.<br /><br />Fucking Rita Skeeter, though.<br /><br />I especially loved the focus on non-mistreatment of house elves and the dynamics of the wizarding world. It was interesting to see how untrustworthy they are among their foreign counterparts and it's not so different from our own world...<br /><br />Also, really. Is there any mythical and paranormal creature that's not in these books?! A+ for the sheer amount of them in these books.</span>  <a data-text-id="10739749580624026246" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>,               <a  <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1370741654" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8969599859786882235">Note to self: <b>Do not finish Harry Potter books at 1:30 in the morning - the unfortunate time prevents you from screaming your feels.</b><br><br><img  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_237982253" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/237982253" />    <a title="Mari" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7013001-mari"><img alt="Mari" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444914505p2/7013001.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/237982253?book_show_action=false">Dec 15, 2015</a>      <a title="Mari" class="user" name="Mari" href="/user/show/7013001-mari">Mari</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/15729519-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer237982253" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14299608537549134384">[December 14, 2015] - Marking for reread. I was amazed that on this, my third time reading this book, I was still biting my nails just as soon as Harry entered the maze at the end. I knew what was coming and it really gave me deep sads to think about where it all would lead. <br /><br />I said in my last update that it was wonderful to watch the kids growing up and I'll only add to that that it comes together with the series growing up as well. We see it take a turn for the dark here. I know people give Har</span>  <span id="freeText14299608537549134384" style="display:none">[December 14, 2015] - Marking for reread. I was amazed that on this, my third time reading this book, I was still biting my nails just as soon as Harry entered the maze at the end. I knew what was coming and it really gave me deep sads to think about where it all would lead. <br /><br />I said in my last update that it was wonderful to watch the kids growing up and I'll only add to that that it comes together with the series growing up as well. We see it take a turn for the dark here. I know people give Harry a lot of flack for being angsty, but can you just imagine? I get so frustrated for him and how no one ever believes him, starting with not putting his name into the Goblet of Fire and ending with Voldemort's return. Plus, he now feels directly responsible for the return of Voldemort and the death of Cedric Diggory. <br /><br />I have bad associations with Cedric and Robert Pattison, and that's unfortunate, because Cedric is a great character. When Dumbledore gives his "Remember Cedric" speech, there were definitely sniffles happening. <br /><br />I LOVED Hermione in this book. In a lot of ways, she's super self-confident. She tends to be so above the teasing and prickling of the other students. When she gets it in for Rita Skeeter, she is just CONFIDENT that she's going to stop her and show her. And she does because Hermione is the best forever. Yes, she can be a bit rigid, but Harry and Ron are so lucky to have her as a friend. So much gets done because Hermione gets it done. <br /><br />It's interesting, though, that it's in this same book that we get the scene with Hermione's teeth growing. This is a good a time as any to mention how much I HATE Snape. He made fun of a 14-year-old girl's appearance so much, it pushes her to permanently change her appearance. WHO DEFENDS THIS CREATURE? PLEASE STOP HE'S AWFUL. He also reads one of Rita's columns out loud in class so all the other students can laugh at Harry and Hermione. Also, when Harry goes running to fetch Dumbledore because Barty Crouch appeared from the forest, Snape just stops him because it pleases him to be mean to Harry. I hate him so much. <br /><br />Whenever I think of Sirius, I think of how hard I fell in love with him in what seems a short amount of time. I saw a little more clearly why in this book, where his presence is pretty constant throughout. Sirius really cares for Harry and it's so nice that Harry has that. There is this whole scene at the beginning where Harry needs to tell someone about his scar and he can't think of who, but then it dawns on him that he has Sirius now. He's never had that kind of person to turn to and it's just... gah. Feelings. Feelings right up until Sirius has to leave at the end and Harry's like "WAIT! NO!" No, please Sirius. Don't leave. <br /><br />Dear goodness, THE WEASLEYS. They are warmth and love and humor and caring and I LOVE THEM SO MUCH. From Mr. Weasley at the beginning, running off with his older sons to see about the dark mark, to Mrs. Weasley and Bill coming as Harry's family before the last task. I forgot they showed up and when Harry walks into that room and Mrs. Weasley is there and he just lights up... So good. And then at the end when Molly gives Harry a hug and it's the first time he can feel his feelings about everything that's happened. He says that no one has ever hugged him this way, like a mother. I might cry right now just typing this. <br /><br />Finally, J.K. Rowling is so very specific about every element she introduces into the world. Every once in a while, it comes off a little convenient, but for the most part, I appreciate how intentional and connected and foreshadowed everything is. At the beginning of the story, she tells us about port keys for the first time as they are whisked away to the Quidditch World Cup. At the end of the story, it's a port key that takes Harry to face Voldemort. A couple of books ago, Dumbledore straight up told Harry that it's possible that some part of Voldemort is in Harry and this book, Voldemort talks about the measures he took to evade death. There are so many other things like this and I love it. <br /><br />I'm hesitant to go on. Bad things happen, guys. Very bad things.<br /><br />[December 25, 2013] - Marking for reread. I remember that the first time through, I marveled at how Rowling was growing these characters up before our eyes. Their first dance and the changing dynamics of their relationships. Bigger challenges and very real danger. Death. This time, I suffered for Harry more, knowing what is still ahead of him, and resenting Ron even while understanding him. Sirius, though. God I love that man.</span>  <a data-text-id="14299608537549134384" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review237982253">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link237982253" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=237982253&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_237982253'><a id="like_count_review_237982253" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/237982253?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">15 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_237982253" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_237982253" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=15&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=237982253&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_237982253" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 237982253, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/237982253?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_237982253' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_237982253' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 237982253, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_518220826" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/518220826" />    <a title="Becky" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1376766-becky"><img alt="Becky" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457393924p2/1376766.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/518220826?book_show_action=false">Feb 10, 2013</a>      <a title="Becky" class="user" name="Becky" href="/user/show/1376766-becky">Becky</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781551927060" href="/book/show/818068.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=tear-jerkers">tear-jerkers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2013">2013</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer518220826" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17097570286337039362">Once again, this book is awesome. It's the turning point in the series. The place where SHIT GETS REAL. <br /><br />We see Harry go through some real challenges in this book, and not just the ones that Voldy cooked up through his devious evility, but challenges that any normal teen may go through... jealousy, a strained-to-the-breaking-point friendship, a crush, and bullying... and that's a day in Harry's life BEFORE anyone tries to kill him. <br /><br />There's something about these books that just pulls my heartstrin</span>  <span id="freeText17097570286337039362" style="display:none">Once again, this book is awesome. It's the turning point in the series. The place where SHIT GETS REAL. <br /><br />We see Harry go through some real challenges in this book, and not just the ones that Voldy cooked up through his devious evility, but challenges that any normal teen may go through... jealousy, a strained-to-the-breaking-point friendship, a crush, and bullying... and that's a day in Harry's life BEFORE anyone tries to kill him. <br /><br />There's something about these books that just pulls my heartstrings, too... and his name is Ron. I love love love love Ron. He is my favorite character, by far, of the series. It breaks my heart a little to see him wearing too-short PJs, and it's embarrassing to me, both on Ron's behalf and for Harry, to know that Harry sees it, acknowledges and pities Ron for it, but disregards it in his anger. And Ron's reaction to Harry's anger, or lack of one, speaks volumes, and breaks my heart still more. <br /><br />And this is the kind of thing that I love about JKR's writing. That scene seems so simple on the surface - Ron interrupts Harry when he's trying to talk to Snuffles, and since Ron has been acting like a jerk, Harry uses the interruption to vent his frustration. But what's implied, and what's NOT said are what makes the scene so emotionally powerful to me. And every single time I tear up. <br /><br />There are some things that I noticed on this 374th reading of the book that stood out as improbable, like how does Voldemort keep his wand for 13 years of being incorporeal? Someone else would have had to have held onto it for him, but if that's the case, why wouldn't they have helped him arise again? And likewise, I find it hard to believe that Voldy did ZERO magic between killing Lily Potter and then killing Bertha Jorkins 13 years later. Priori Incantatem shows the spells that a wand has performed... It showed the hand that Voldemort had conjured for Wormtail, and screaming to indicate the Cruciatus curse he used on Harry, so why did it not reflect any of the magic he'd have had to do to get to Bertha's memories? Likely this is just due to the amount of time that it would have needed to show them all, but some sort of explanation would be better than none. <br /><br />But still... I love this book, and there's a reason why it was my favorite for so long. I love the emotional impact of this book, and how draining it is to read. I love that I finish this book with tears in my eyes and an ache in my heart for the things that I know are coming... but I can't help but want more. </span>  <a data-text-id="17097570286337039362" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1367291671" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11444994173186058518">***4.5 STARS***<br />The beginning of this book I hard trouble connecting and getting into the story, but after passing the 50% mark something clicked and I was <i>GONE</i>. The fourth movie is my favorite movie out of the series, so I thought this was going to be my favorite book as well, but unfortunately it did not. I will say that this book had different things happened than in the movie, so I enjoyed that very much. I thought I had everything figured out, but I was most certainly surprised every time th</span>  <span id="freeText11444994173186058518" style="display:none">***4.5 STARS***<br />The beginning of this book I hard trouble connecting and getting into the story, but after passing the 50% mark something clicked and I was <i>GONE</i>. The fourth movie is my favorite movie out of the series, so I thought this was going to be my favorite book as well, but unfortunately it did not. I will say that this book had different things happened than in the movie, so I enjoyed that very much. I thought I had everything figured out, but I was most certainly surprised every time there was a plot twist. The ending left me wanting to read next book in the series, <b>  <i>the Order of the Phoenix</i></b>. But is <b>hella long</b> so I think I will pick it up once the new year comes around, but we shall see! Also the character development of the side characters blew my mind in this book specially for Hagrid who went through so much in his childhood. </span>  <a data-text-id="11444994173186058518" href="#" rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/13563644-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14323468-joanita?shelf=books-i-love">books-i-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14323468-joanita?shelf=5-stars">5-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14323468-joanita?shelf=gr2016">gr2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1500494448" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15915881270370692035"><p>Goblet of Fire is just a fantastic addition to this series, and the pace was just amped up by a thousand! I just love how with every book more is revealed about Harry's past and his parents, and the terror and havoc caused by Voldemort and his Death Eaters.</p> <p>I also really enjoy seeing Harry, Ron and Hermione grow older, and the fact that Ron finally notice that Hermione is girl was just hilarious and cute.</p> <p>So many things happened in this book, some tragic, some wonderful and some very worrisome.</p></span>  <span id="freeText15915881270370692035" style="display:none"><p>Goblet of Fire is just a fantastic addition to this series, and the pace was just amped up by a thousand! I just love how with every book more is revealed about Harry's past and his parents, and the terror and havoc caused by Voldemort and his Death Eaters.</p> <p>I also really enjoy seeing Harry, Ron and Hermione grow older, and the fact that Ron finally notice that Hermione is girl was just hilarious and cute.</p> <p>So many things happened in this book, some tragic, some wonderful and some very worrisome.</p> <p>This series is just wonderful and magical, and it just gets better and better with every read.</p> <p>I HIGHLY recommend this series to EVERYONE.</p><br /><br /></span>  <a   <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1277633822?book_show_action=false">May 14, 2015</a>      <a </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_596044563" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/596044563" />    <a title="Namratha" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/114559-namratha"><img alt="Namratha" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1406702134p2/114559.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/596044563?book_show_action=false">Apr 21, 2013</a>      <a title="Namratha" class="user" name="Namratha" href="/user/show/114559-namratha">Namratha</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=urban-fantasy">urban-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=mystery">mystery</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=classics">classics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=childrens-fantasy">childrens-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=ya-lit">ya-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=books-i-love">books-i-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=pottermania">pottermania</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer596044563" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2427432169410773375">Ralph Waldo Emerson stated, <em> <strong>"Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of the trumpet."</strong> </em><br><br>And despite having read a whole lot of books in my lifetime, it is the wisdom of Harry Potter and his magical world that I return to at regular intervals. The words, the emotions and the relationships will ALWAYS, without a doubt, be a sonorous '<em>blast of the trumpet'</em>for me.<br><br>This week, it was the turn of <strong> <u>Harry Potter and The G</u></strong></span>  <span id="freeText2427432169410773375" style="display:none">Ralph Waldo Emerson stated, <em>  <strong>"Make your own Bible.  Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of the trumpet."</strong></em><br><br>And despite having read a whole lot of books in my lifetime, it is the wisdom of Harry Potter and his magical world that I return to at regular intervals. The words, the emotions and the relationships will ALWAYS, without a doubt, be a sonorous '<em>blast of the trumpet' </em>for me. <br><br>This week, it was the turn of <strong>  <u>Harry Potter and The Goblet of Fire</u></strong>. I have already written a review on it, a concise (with minimal gushing) review. Today, it's a revisiting of all those key moments that continue to keep me glued to my seat.<br>So here it is, a little something for my fellow Potterheads:<br><strong>---------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #1:</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418460i/828574._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"> <br><strong>---------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #2:</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380418460ra/828575.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg">   <br><strong>---------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #3: </strong><em>'For those who don't want to Apparate, or can't, we use Portkeys. They're objects that are used to transport wizards from one spot to another at a prearranged time.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418460i/828576.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>---------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #4: *</strong><strong>The Quidditch World-Cup*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418460i/828577.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #5: </strong><em>'Ron, You-Know-Who and his followers sent the Dark Mark into the air whenever they killed,' said Mr.Weasley. 'The terror it inspired...you have no idea, you're too young. Just picture coming home, and finding the Dark Mark hovering over your house, and knowing what you're about to find inside...' Mr Weasley winced. 'Everyone's worst fear...the very worst...'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418460i/828578._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br>  <strong>MOMENT #6: </strong>*<strong>The Triwizard Tournament</strong>*<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418460i/828579._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #7: </strong><strong>The arrival of Mad-Eye Moody</strong><br>A man stood in the doorway, leaning upon a long staff, shrouded in a black travelling cloak. The lightening had thrown the man's face into sharp relief and it was a face unlike any Harry had ever seen.<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418460i/828580._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #8:</strong><br><em>'Don't talk to me,' Ron said quietly.</em><br><em>'Why not?' said Hermione in surprise.</em><br><em>'Because I want to fix that in my memory for ever,' said Ron, his eyes closed and an uplifted expression on his face. 'Draco Malfoy, the amazing bouncing ferret...'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828581.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>----------------------------------------------------- </strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #9:</strong><br><em>'Now...those three curses - Avada Kedavra, Imperius and Cruciatus - are known as the Unforgivable Curses. The use of any one of them on a fellow human being is enough to earn a life sentence in Azkaban. That's what you're up against.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828582.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #10: </strong><br>"Spew"?' said Harry, picking up a badge and looking at it. 'What's this about?'<br>'Not spew,' said Hermione impatiently. 'It's S - P - E - W. Stands for the Society for the Promotion of Elfish Welfare'<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828583._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #11:</strong><br><em>'I don't believe it!' Ron said, in a stunned voice. 'Krum, Harry! Viktor Krum!'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828584.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #12:</strong><br>Dumbledore reached inside, and pulled out a large, roughly hewn wooden cup. It would have been entirely unremarkable, had it not been full to the brim with dancing, blue-white flames.<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828585.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #13:</strong><br>- but next moment, there was a loud sizzling sound, and both twins were hurled out of the golden circle as though they had been thrown by an invisible shot-putter. They landed painfully, ten feet away on the cold stone floor, and to add insult to injury, there was a loud popping noise, and both of them sprouted identical, long white beards.<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828586.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #15:</strong><br><em>And then Dumbledore cleared his throat, and read out - </em><br><em>'Harry Potter'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828587._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #16: *</strong><strong>The Four Champions*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828588.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #17: </strong><br><em>'Dumbledore!' cried Rita Skeeter, with every appearance of delight. 'I hope you saw my piece over the summer about the International Confederation of Wizards' Conference?'</em><br><em>'Enchantingly nasty,' said Dumbledore, his eyes twinkling. 'I particularly enjoyed your description of me as an obsolete dingbat.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828589.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #18:</strong><br><em>'...but I tell you this, I don't envy the one who gets the Horntail. Vicious thing. It's back end's as dangerous as its front, look.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828590.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #19: *The First Task*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828591.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #20: *The Unexpected Task*</strong><br><em>'The Yule Ball is of course a chance for all of us to - er - let our hair down,' she said, in a disapproving voice.</em><br><em>Harry could see what was funny this time: Professor McGonagall, with her hair in a tight bun, looked as though she had never let hair down in any sense.</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828592.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #21: *THE YULE BALL*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828593.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #22: </strong><br><em>'I don't know who Maxime thinks she's kidding,' Harry said. 'If Hagrid's half-giant, she definitely is. Big bones...the only thing that's got bigger bones than her is a dinosaur.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828594.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #23:</strong><br><em>'Well, if you don't like it, you know what the solution is, don't you?' yelled Hermione.</em><br><em>'Oh yeah?' Ron yelled back. 'What's that?</em><br><em>'Next time there's a ball, ask me before someone else does, and not as a last resort!'</em><br><em><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828595.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg">     </em><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #24: *</strong><strong>  Rita Skeeter's Scoop*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828596.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #25: </strong><strong>*The Second Task*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828597.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828598._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #26: </strong><br><em>'Yes,' said Hermione in a heated voice, 'he sacked her, just because she hadn't stayed in her tent and let herself get trampled -'</em><strong>  <br></strong><br><em>'Hermione, will you give it a rest with the elf!' said Ron.</em><br><em>But Sirius shook his head and said, 'She's got the measure of Crouch better than you have, Ron.'</em><br><em>  <img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828599._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></em><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #27:</strong><br><em>'This is called a Pensieve. One simply siphons the excess thoughts from one's mind, pours them into the basin, and examines them at one's leisure.'</em><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828600._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #28: </strong><strong>  *The Third Task*</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828601.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #29:</strong><br>Cedric was lying spread-eagled on the ground beside him. He was dead.<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828602.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #30:</strong><br>...and Harry stared back into the face that had haunted his nightmares for three years. Whiter than a skull. with wide, livid scarlet eyes, and a nose that was as flat as a snake's, with slits for nostrils...<br>   Lord Voldemort had risen again.<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828603.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #31:</strong><br><em>'His mother left upon him the traces of her sacrifice...this is old magic, I should have remembered it, I was foolish to overlook it...but no matter. I can touch him now.</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380418461ra/828604.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #32: </strong><br>And as he heard Voldemort draw nearer still, he knew one thing only, and it was beyond fear or reason - he was not going to die crouching here like a child playing hide-and-seek; he was going to die upright like his father, and he was going to die trying to defend himself, even if no defense was possible... <br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828605.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #33: </strong><strong>*Priori Incantatem*</strong><br><em>'When the connection is broken, we will linger for only moments ... but we will give you time...you must get to the Portkey, it will return you to Hogwarts...do you understand, Harry?'</em><strong>  <br></strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828606.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #34:</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828607.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"> <br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #35:</strong><br>Harry saw a man lying before him, pale-skinned, slightly freckled, with a mop of fair hair. He knew who he was.<br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828608._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #36: *The Parting of the Ways*</strong><br><em>'I tell you now - take the steps I have suggested, and you will be remembered, in office or out, as one of the bravest and greatest Ministers for Magic we have ever known. Fail to act - and history will remember you as the man who stepped aside, and allowed Voldemort a second chance to destroy the world we have tried to rebuild!'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828609._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #37: </strong><br><em>'It is my belief, however, that the truth is generally preferable to lies, and that any attempt to pretend that Cedric died as a result of an accident, or some sort of blunder, is an insult to his memory.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828610._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #38:</strong><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828611.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #39:</strong><br><em>  'Lord Voldemort's gift for spreading discord and enmity is very great. We can fight it only by showing an equally strong bond of friendship and trust.'</em><br><img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828612.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong><br><br><strong>MOMENT #40:</strong><br><em>'Listen.' said Harry firmly. 'If you don't take it, I'm throwing it down the drain. I don't want it and I don't need it. But I could do with a few laughs. We could all do with a few laughs. I've got a feeling we're going to need them more than usual before long.'</em><br><em>  <img alt="image" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380418461i/828613._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></em><br><strong>-----------------------------------------------------</strong></span>  <a data-text-id="2427432169410773375" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review596044563">  <td These books have to be my favorite things ever. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1211508749" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1211508749" />    <a title="Cath" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/40660863-cath"><img alt="Cath" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452193765p2/40660863.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1211508749?book_show_action=false">May 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Cath" class="user" name="Cath" href="/user/show/40660863-cath">Cath</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1211508749" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15700453146073892617">Isn't this the best book you could possibly read?</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1211508749">  <td colspan="2">    <div </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_362604238" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/362604238" />    <a title="Mel" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10697179-mel"><img alt="Mel" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1437143744p2/10697179.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/362604238?book_show_action=false">Jul 15, 2015</a>      <a title="Mel" class="user" name="Mel" href="/user/show/10697179-mel">Mel</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10697179-mel?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10697179-mel?shelf=favorite-books">favorite-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10697179-mel?shelf=read-before-2013">read-before-2013</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10697179-mel?shelf=5-stars">5-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10697179-mel?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer362604238" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer936467505962154926">Gosh I love book 4!! It's still got such a happy tone but it's the start of the dark stuff! Not to mention I love the tasks and meeting other wizards from other countries! Once again, here are little tidbits about the book and some things I noticed differing from the movie.<br /><br />-I think it would have been important for the movie to tell us that the house at the beginning is the Riddle house. <br />-I am noticing this as a trend in every book.. in the book it's Harry's idea to write to Sirius about his scar</span>  <span id="freeText936467505962154926" style="display:none">Gosh I love book 4!! It's still got such a happy tone but it's the start of the dark stuff! Not to mention I love the tasks and meeting other wizards from other countries! Once again, here are little tidbits about the book and some things I noticed differing from the movie.<br /><br />-I think it would have been important for the movie to tell us that the house at the beginning is the Riddle house. <br />-I am noticing this as a trend in every book.. in the book it's Harry's idea to write to Sirius about his scar hurting and yet in the movie it's Hermione's idea. It makes it look like Harry is too dumb to figure it out and that Hermione is the one that has to think for them all. It undermines Harry and Ron and I don't really see why they continuously do this every movie.<br />-I love that JK developed the Dursley's as characters so well when they are not really central to the story at all.<br />-Watching the Weasley's with the muggle world is always hilarious. The entire scene when they pick up Harry is hilarious. I'm upset it's not in the movie because it's the best scene.<br />-I love that Harry taunts the Dursley's with Sirius to get them to be nicer to him.<br />-I wish they included Bill and Charlie in the movies. We never get to meet Charlie and Bill is only a small figure in the last 2 movies. It was fun meeting them at the triwizard tournament. And of course more Percy which the movie has too little of anyways.<br />-I love Pidwidgeon so much and I am sad he wasn't in the movie. <br />-The movies don't ever explain what apparating is or how/when they learn it. Not to mention that they never explain splinching, even when it happens to Ron.<br />-Since a random old boot is their portkey, I'll always wonder if trash on the street is a portkey. <br />-They always ask Harry for muggle help even though Hermione is also a muggle? Why not also ask Hermione?<br />-Super curious if Dean and Seamus were ever really gay.<br />-I LOVE that Barty Crouch calls Percy Weatherby.<br />-I don't get it in the movie where Draco has to comment how poor the seats are and how they have seats in the ministers box when the teams come out of their seat. And lets not forget in the book that they are all in the SAME box.<br />-Winky though <3 precious<br />-Veela are hilarious. I would have liked to see them, and even a LITTLE bit of the world cup stuff in the movie.<br />-The entire dark mark death eaters scene was horribly done.<br />-S.P.E.W - I will forgive Hermione for this. It was one of the most irritating things to read. She had sincere intentions but was really annoying with it after a while. Everyone (including the house elves) TOLD her that they don't want to be paid.<br />-Hedwig's sass is my favourite.<br />-The Goblet of Fire/Tournament stuff is all out of order in the movie.<br />-I hate that classes become so unimportant in the movies starting now. Classes are the best part sometimes!<br />-Why are the Pavil twins in the same house in the movie? And also they aren't identical in the movie but they are in the book?<br />-Why is Beauxbatons an all girl school? Is it so hard to imagine that the cup picked a girl? Or is it only possible that a girl would be picked if there was no other choice. Clearly ridiculous. And why is Durmstrang an all boy school though.<br />-Everyone's most hated thing: HARRY DID YOU PUT YOU NAME IN THE GOBLET OF FIRE?!?!?! "said Dumbledore calmly" yeah real calm movie.<br />-Why was Harry so stressed in the book about the summoning spell for his broom? Worrying that it might not make it all the way? Like get Hermione to hide your broom somewhere near by so you know it'll be quicker.<br />-The entire first task scene was horrible in the movie? The rooftop showdown? wtf?<br />-There was also no point system..<br />-I wonder why the Yule ball was only open to fourth years and above? Would it have only been 6/7 years if Harry wasn't in it?<br />-So umm everyone wants to go to the ball with Harry in the book and no one does in the movie?<br />-Hermione's PERIWINKLE BLUE dress. I wish we saw that.<br />-The best thing though is Herm-Own-Ninny<br />-Maxine + Hagrid fighting over being a giant would have been fun in the movie.<br />-which makes me wonder how Hagrid's mom had sex with his dad like I am really curious about this.<br />-The movie entirely cut out Ludo Bagman like he was not important at all. <br />-I prefer book Dumbledore to movie Dumbledore. Movie Dumbledore is kind of an ass.<br />-Does Harry ever get his Mauraders Map back from Moody?<br />-Also why is Hermione Krum's closest person? That's weird.<br />-Dobby is so precious I'm sad they cut him out of the movies.<br />-Krum talking to Harry about his flying would have been fun.<br />-Krum says "your ministry..." does that mean that each country has their own? <br />-What do Ron and Hermione end up doing as jobs when they graduate (im sure this will be answered to me eventually...)<br />-I love that in the end Mrs. Weasley got Hermione and Harry as children too. You can tell that she wanted Ron and Hermione together all along though because she gets mad at Hermione for "dating" Harry.<br />-If they know Lucius Malfoy is a death eater why do they continue to let Draco come back to Hogwarts?<br />-The Graveyard scene was actually well done in the movie surprisingly.<br />-Clearly the Potter gene is really strong since his mom and his wife have red hair and his children still have dark hair.<br />-I don't see why they cut out the Winky/Crouch story at the end, it's really quite important the the events of the movie.<br />-They basically cut out Sirius from the movie and that pisses me off he's so prominent in the movie, the end especially.<br />-Also why does Harry never cry. That seems a little unrealistic to me tbh.<br />-The movies just never say what happens to Crouch JR? <br />-I like that they set up the Order a bit at the end, even though the reader doesn't really know about it yet.<br />-I liked reading that Dumbledore makes Harry go back to the Dursley's ever summer and I liked knowing that Mrs. Weasley at least invites him for Christmas and Summer. <br />-I am sad the movie cut out so much Krum he seems like a stupid dumbbell in the movies but he's really actually great in the movies. Plus I liked his and Hermione's romance.<br />-I just wish more than anything we see Harry giving Fred and George the money from his winning because that explains their storyline so much but nope movie just makes it look like Fred and George have always been rich.<br /><br />Time for book 5. Not my favourite at all but still looking forward to it!</span>  <a data-text-id="936467505962154926" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1107825728" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1107825728" />    <a title="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda"><img alt="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454500294p2/4023744.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1107825728?book_show_action=false">Oct 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" class="user" name="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" href="/user/show/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda">Yvonne (bookishpanda)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=4-stars-books">4-stars-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=long-series">long-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=audio">audio</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1107825728" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6316777671118995509"><a href="http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.co.at/2016/03/review-harry-potter-and-goblet-of-fire.html" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452000576i/17631522.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>THE FIRST AUDIOBOOK I ACTUALLY FINISHED. A long one, at least. I was never a huge fan of audiobooks to begin with but <b>as soon as I heard Stephen Fry's amazing voice and how brilliantly he narrates the book(s), I just fell in love.</b> I <i>knew </i>I had to get them and listen non-stop. I LOVE IT. Yes, I have the book but mostly stuck to the narration because it was so good - that's a recommendation for everyone btw, go check it out if you haven't already!<br><br>I don't even remember much about the movie and the</span>  <span id="freeText6316777671118995509" style="display:none"><a href="http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.co.at/2016/03/review-harry-potter-and-goblet-of-fire.html" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452000576i/17631522.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>THE FIRST AUDIOBOOK I ACTUALLY FINISHED. A long one, at least. I was never a huge fan of audiobooks to begin with but <b>as soon as I heard Stephen Fry's amazing voice and how brilliantly he narrates the book(s), I just fell in love.</b> I <i>knew </i>I had to get them and listen non-stop. I LOVE IT. Yes, I have the book but mostly stuck to the narration because it was so good - that's a recommendation for everyone btw, go check it out if you haven't already!<br><br>I don't even remember much about the movie and therefore I was constantly surprised/confused and awestruck while listening because I forgot almost everything. There were certain things that I remembered, of course, but others I just completely forgot. IT WAS AWESOME. It's like I was experiencing this whole adventure from the scratch! However, I don't seem to be able to form proper words to express my love, therefore <b>I'll just make a list with things I loved and things that bothered me a little.</b><br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>"It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be."</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><b>  <u>Things I loved:</u></b><br>- <b>The Weasley's:</b> they're like one of my FAVORITE familes ever. I adore each and everyone so, so much and care so deeply for them! Mr and Mrs Weasley are amazing and always make me smile, as well as Fred and George. They're so funny! I already expressed my love for Ron in the previous reviews but again here: I ADORE HIM.<br><br>- <b>Sirius Black:</b> HE'S ONE OF MY FAVORITE CHARACTERS, OKAY? Honestly, I loved him in book 3 and am so happy that he also was a part of this book (even if just a small one). How much he cares for Harry and how he's trying to protect him and be there for him even though it's dangerous ... goooosh!<br><br>- <b>DRAGONS:</b> I didn't remember dragons from the movie??? Like, WHERE WERE THEY?! It was so epic to read about them ... I don't even need to say more, right? Dragons are epic. Enough said.<br><br>-<b> CU+00C9DRIC DIGGORY:</b> Yes, my heart broke for him. That's one detail I remembered and it was as sad as I expected it to be. Maybe even more so. I was heartbroken. *cries* I think a Harry/CU+00E9dric friendship would've been great.<br><br>- <b>THE ENDING:</b> I was listening to it on the train and when a certain thing was revealed I was like: "WHAAAT?!? No, that can't be true!!!" Honestly, I was SHOCKED. You can ask <a href="http://inabookishworld.wordpress.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Melissa</a>, she has proof. <br><br><b>  <u>Things I didn't like:</u></b><br>- <b>Ron & Harry fighting: </b>excuse me but I was starting to get a little bit annoyed with their fight ... it went on for sooooo long over something so stupid and I just wanted to force them to talk with each other again. They were both acting incredibly childish, ugh.<br><br>- <b>My own stupidity:</b> Apparently I haven't even SEEN the movie?! Ignore all comments I made about having seen it ... I most certainly haven't! I can't believe it but the more and more I listened/read and the further I got, the less I "remembered". I think someone just spoiled me or I saw pictures/gifs somewhere on the internet but I haven't actually <i>seen </i>the movie. I don't know how I was able to do that but don't worry, I'll get to it right now! By the time this review is up, I already watched it, wohoo!<br><br>- <b>Some parts were too long:</b> I don't really know how else to describe it but some things just dragged ... they went on and on and on and I was wondering when something else would be happening again.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>"We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided."</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br>Obviously, these negative things didn't stop me from loving this book. I enjoyed it a lot and already can't wait to get my hands on book 5 ... although I still haven't decided if I'll read it or listen to the audiobook again. Maybe I'll do both, haha. So please, <b>everyone who hasn't started the Harry Potter series yet: GO DO IT NOW.</b> It's worth it!<br><br><a href="http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">www.aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.com</a><br>_____________________<br><br><u>  <i>February 20th:</i></u><br>The audiobooks are so great ... I love them! Another amazing book - I realized while reading that apparently I've never even seen the movie. I did now though, haha. LOVED IT.</span>  <a data-text-id="6316777671118995509" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1107825728">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1107825728" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1107825728&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1107825728'><a id="like_count_review_1107825728" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1107825728?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">13 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1107825728" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1107825728" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=13&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1107825728&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1107825728" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1107825728, true, &#39;&#39;); I love this book and this is my favorite of the movies <3 I love the whole Harry Potter world and I don't want it to end, like at all!! <br /><br />I loved all of it and hated that there was alot of stuff not in the movies and that original it is Dobby who gives him the Gillywood and not Neville. Dobby isn't even in the movie of the book and it is sad. I love Fred & George even more and Dobby, owh! <3 I love everything from Hagrids creatures to Fred, George, Harry, Hermione and Ron Hex</span>  <span id="freeText383123937731933145" style="display:none">Owh gooood! I love this book and this is my favorite of the movies <3 I love the whole Harry Potter world and I don't want it to end, like at all!! <br /><br />I loved all of it and hated that there was alot of stuff not in the movies and that original it is Dobby who gives him the Gillywood and not Neville. Dobby isn't even in the movie of the book and it is sad. I love Fred & George even more and Dobby, owh! <3 I love everything from Hagrids creatures to Fred, George, Harry, Hermione and Ron Hexing the evil three. <br /><br />I love Fred and George soo much and I already knows I will be totally heartbroken after this serie! I love Dobby and his odd socks and all, (I myself always wear odd socks just cuz I don't feel like myself if I don't) Hermione is one of my absoulte favorite Girl charaters of all time! She is everything that is great! And I love that there is no love triangle but that Harry and Hermione is just friends an has the greatest friendship of all time. I love Hagrid and still thinks of him as Harry's father figure even tho Sirius is as good, but Sirius is still a God-father to me. I love everything and Mrs. Weasley is wonderful and amazing! <br /><br />Cedric.. noo.. I actually didn't feel much against Cedric but I still cried sooo hard. And this is just the begining! I will end this serie soon, now I will just have to try not to cry alot in the rest of them.. (Which will never work xD) I would say that this book is my favorite so far! I love it and everything is just perfect with it except from Cedric tho.. I cried a tiny bit when we hear about the longbottom also tho. It is just sad.. I loved this soo much and I'm going to start the next HP right away. <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ What I loved!:<br />*The moment when the Weasley family was going to pick up Harry from the Dursley's<br />*Bill and Charlie Weasley!<br />*Sirius! <br />*Dobby and all with him!<br />*Fred and George!<br />*Malfoy being a ferret! <br />*Mad-Eye Moody!<br />*Fred, George, Harry, Hermione and Ron Hexing Malfoy, Crabbe and Goyle xD  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I just love everything and I'm jumping right into the next book! </span>  <a data-text-id="383123937731933145" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1214536760&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1214536760" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1800288448273460517">Incredibly amazing. Yes, this book took my two months to read, but it was extremely worth it! It was definitely an emotional moment when we lost Cedric Diggory. The ending when they raised their goblets, amazing. I was crying, it was hard not to! So happy to finally getting to these books. This is a rather long book, but I forget how long it is. Yes, this book took my two months to read, but it was extremely worth it! It was definitely an emotional moment when we lost Cedric Diggory. The ending when they raised their goblets, amazing. I was crying, it was hard not to! So happy to finally getting to these books. This is a rather long book, but I forget how long it is. These books, are those books that leaving you talking to yourself. As what I was doing! Haha, I really loved this book! :) this is definitely my favorite of the series! Younger, I was obsessed with watching the Sorcerers Stone. I watching it over and over. So happy to be reading these awesome books! J.K. Rowling's writing is great. I just always put the book down and think.<br /><br /><br />My opinion on the book: <br /><br />The fourth year of Harry Potter was amazing! At first, I was so intrigued in how the Riddles became who they are. J.K. Rowling's writing is absolutely amazing and very unpredictable.<br />I always make predictions, and they turn up, wrong. The ending of these books will want you buying/borrowing the next book right away! The battle between You-Know-Who and Harry was brilliant! That part from the Third Task started to the end was easily captivating! <br /><br /><br /><br />My rating: <br />Writing: 10/10<br />Characters: 10/10<br />Plot: 10/10<br />Pace: 9.5/10<br /><br />I love this series! I'm already starting the Order of the Pheonix! :)</span>  <a data-text-id="1800288448273460517" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> id="reviewTextContainer630829373" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18056251455042968546">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is the fourth book of the Harry Potter series and written by J. K. Rowling in 2000. This novel is Hugo Award winner for Best Novel in 2001.<br /><br />IU+2019ve listened this novel by Jim DaleU+2019s narration, he did really very good job on narrating this book. It would be something like repeating myself but the fourth book is the</span>  <span id="freeText18056251455042968546" style="display:none">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is the fourth book of the Harry Potter series and written by J. K. Rowling in 2000. This novel is Hugo Award winner for Best Novel in 2001.<br /><br />IU+2019ve listened this novel by Jim DaleU+2019s narration, he did really very good job on narrating this book. You can live the book while Jim Dale is reading it, also you can feel each character.<br /><br />IU+2019ve said for the previous book, this book is the best book so far. It would be something like repeating myself but the fourth book is the best book so far. ItU+2019s getting darker and darker in each book, and in each book lots of secrets revealed both with Harry PotterU+2019s past and for supporting characters.<br /><br />In this novel main plot is Tri-Wizard tournament, three magic schools are competing with their selected champions.<br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br />There are many secrets revealed;<br />-tMad Eye Moodie is not what you think, he is an imposter,<br />-tEven Harry Potter is not eligible due to his age for Tri-Wizard tournament, he is selected and Mad Eye Moodie helped for him,<br />-tVoldemort is back,<br />-tSeverus Snape was a death eater,<br /> <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /></span>  <a
