elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1646757794" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1646757794" />    <a title="MU+00F8stafyU+030D " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/45532677-m-stafy"><img alt="MU+00F8stafyU+030D " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1438285908p2/45532677.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1646757794?book_show_action=false">Sep 07, 2016</a>      <a title="MU+00F8stafyU+030D " class="user" name="MU+00F8stafyU+030D " href="/user/show/45532677-m-stafy">MU+00F8stafyU+030D </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/45532677-m-stafy?shelf=read-in-english">read-in-english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/45532677-m-stafy?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1646757794" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5762194226117835440"><i>[actual rate: 2.5 stars]</i><br /><br /><b>Likes:</b><br />U+2022 <b>Details</b> (This was the second Harry Potter book that I really enjoyed reading the details, trying to picture every word in my mind. I didn't care that the book was long)<br />U+2022 <b>Familiarisation</b> (it was nice to read about people I know. Sometimes I couldn't find any better escape from reality than going back to Harry's world)<br />U+2022 <b>Complexity</b> (like other books of series. Why can't other books be a bit complex like this book?)<br />U+2022 <b>Some Ideas</b> (like I said before, some ideas are so c</span>  <span id="freeText5762194226117835440" style="display:none"><i>[actual rate: 2.5 stars]</i><br /><br /><b>Likes:</b><br />U+2022 <b>Details</b> (This was the second Harry Potter book that I really enjoyed reading the details, trying to picture every word in my mind. I didn't care that the book was long)<br />U+2022 <b>Familiarisation</b> (it was nice to read about people I know. Sometimes I couldn't find any better escape from reality than going back to Harry's world)<br />U+2022 <b>Complexity</b> (like other books of series. Why can't other books be a bit complex like this book?)<br />U+2022 <b>Some Ideas</b> (like I said before, some ideas are so clever and fascinating!)<br /><br /><b>Dislikes:</b><br />U+2022 <b>Harry</b> (Why is he like this?? Each book he gets more annoying)<br />U+2022 <b>Plot Hole</b> (every book has some, but this book's hole was so big that I had to give it 2.5 stars<br />U+2022 <b>Wizards World</b> (Add the Yule Ball to everything else I said in the review of the first book)<br />U+2022 <b>Long Chapters</b> (true that I didn't care about the book being long, but I did care about the chapters being so long)</span> class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16415025918457211957">2016<br />This was always my favourite book in the series, will it change? <br />Re-reading it this year some of the things that always amazed me was not so shiny anymore. This is still one heck of a read, but will it remain the favourite? <br /><br /><br />2015<br />This is still my favorite! <br />I love the combination of the Triwizard tournament and rise of Voldemort.<br /><br />The way Rowling introduce the other schools of magic makes you so sure this wizardry realm is real, you almost feel sad for not getting a letter to your school of magic</span>  <span id="freeText16415025918457211957" style="display:none">2016<br />This was always my favourite book in the series, will it change? <br />Re-reading it this year some of the things that always amazed me was not so shiny anymore. This is still one heck of a read, but will it remain the favourite? <br /><br /><br />2015<br />This is still my favorite! <br />I love the combination of the Triwizard tournament and rise of Voldemort.<br /><br />The way Rowling introduce the other schools of magic makes you so sure this wizardry realm is real, you almost feel sad for not getting a letter to your school of magic. <br />Adding the opposing schools to the 3 Tasks and the underlying sense of 'what the hell is Voldemort up to now' makes this book a masterpiece. <br /><br />I will forever cherish these books! <br /><br />Thanks for making my childhood rock J.K. Rowling!</span>  <a data-text-id="16415025918457211957" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext id="reviewTextContainer1786167994" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15663431924853338049">My Harry Potter order of preference:<br /><br />1. Prisoner of Azkaban<br />2. Sorceror's Stone<br />3. Deathly Hallows<br />4. Goblet of Fire<br />5. Half-Blood Prince<br />6. Order of the Phoenix<br />7. Chamber of Secrets<br /><br />So, this one is right in the middle for me, and is the only one that sits in the order in which it actually comes in the series.<br /><br />Someday, maybe, I'll write a post explaining why.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1786167994"> href="/review/list/3112505-elisa?shelf=seven-greatest-books-ever">seven-greatest-books-ever</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer83629656" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer314065548769555068">I'm not sure if I should review this right now or not. I'm nearly done with Order of the Phoenix, so my thoughts might possibly come out a bit blurred between both books, but I'm just going to to give it my best shot anyway, and I may or may not decide to post in the end. (Hint: If you're reading this, I decided to post.)<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire. Who else remembers seeing this monster for the first time? I believe I was in the 8th grade when it made its debut. Now, I was not quite old</span>  <span id="freeText314065548769555068" style="display:none">I'm not sure if I should review this right now or not. I'm nearly done with Order of the Phoenix, so my thoughts might possibly come out a bit blurred between both books, but I'm just going to to give it my best shot anyway, and I may or may not decide to post in the end. (Hint: If you're reading this, I decided to post.)<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire. Who else remembers seeing this monster for the first time? I believe I was in the 8th grade when it made its debut. Now, I was not quite old enough to hang out at midnight book releases (though this was the last Potter book that I didn't go to one) or even to really keep up with release dates of things (I know, shameful), but fortunately I had that cool Uncle I mentioned back in my review for <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_" title="Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a>. Uncle Mike kept up with all big-time book, movie, and tv premieres and made it his solemn duty to be sure that the kids related to him would be on top of things.<br /><br />So, even though I was not really even fully aware it was out, Uncle Mike snagged me a copy on the release day and gave it to me as a (two month early) birthday present. At the time, my cousin and I had somewhat of an unhealthily competitive relationship, so we entered into an unspoken race to see who would finish first. I'm sure we each have our own version of how things went down, but dear goodreads readers-- believe me when I tell you I totally got this one in the bag. And if you've seen the size of this thing, you know that is a serious victory.<br /><br />Yes. It is a big book-- for a kid, it almost feels as daunting as cracking open the bible. Luckily, it reads a little faster (and that's coming from a Christian). For the first time, we are given a look into some of the wizardry outside Hogwarts-- and it's awesome. Beauxbatons and Durmstang-- two wizarding schools which differ largely from Hogwarts. Harry is entered against his will into what is known as "The Triwizard Tournament" to compete against members of other schools in various tests of skill, strength, and courage. The winner is awarded a buttload of galleons, a pretty little cup, and you know-- glory and stuff. Though Harry is initially a little freaked over his name mysteriously being entered, he's still successful in the competition...to no one's surprise.<br /><br />One of the most notable happenings in the book is that painful Ron/Harry feud which, when Ron is your favorite character, seems to last an eternity, but is in reality a fairly short portion of the book. Even though he acted a fool, I stand by my man-- it has to be hard living in Harry's shadow. And speaking of my man, or, uh, <i>Hermione's</i> man to be more precise-- how can you not love the first sure-fire sign of their feelings for one another at the Yule Ball? It doesn't get played nearly as well in the movie, (through no fault of Rupert Grint or Emma Watson) but that is some fun stuff in the book. I also like that Harry gets turned down by Cho. I know-- it sounds terrible, but no one should have <i>everything</i> come easy to them. <br /><br />From the fun and frivolous ball to the quirky, entertaining competition tasks, much of the book maintains its usual light tone. But there's a reason this book is as big as it is; it's hiding one hell of a punch to the gut.<br /><br />SPOILER!!!!<br /><br /><br /><br /><br />He-who-must-not-be-named returns. <br />And he sucks. <br />Hard.<br /><br />Cedric Diggory, Harry's fellow Hogwarts competitor, is dealt a quick but cruel death, the first significant one of the series. I, for one, was not expecting it. I mean I always figured ol' Voldy would come back, it just didn't enter my wee little brain that that would mean characters I cared about might actually, you know, <i>die</i>.<br /><br />Then right after the sobfest that is Cedric's death, Harry is reuinted with his parents for a brief moment. It is beautiful and tragic and at that point in my life, I had never read anything like it. The value Rowling intends to instill with the conclusion of the story-- that we need not separate ourselves so fiercely, even though our differences might be great, is one that's important to all people groups. Yes, even us stuffy Christians;) Thought this is the fourth book, it feels oddly like the beginning. I can't wait to write my next reviews. Thanks for reading (I don't know why I've gone strangely formal). <br /><br />So how did I do in a review in which I actually talk about the plot?</span>  <a data-text-id="314065548769555068" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review83629656">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link83629656" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=83629656&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_83629656'><a id="like_count_review_83629656" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/83629656?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=badass-heroines">badass-heroines</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=be-my-husband">be-my-husband</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=absent-parent-syndrome">absent-parent-syndrome</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=orphan-mc">orphan-mc</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=reread">reread</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=harry-freaking-potter">harry-freaking-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer413973128" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14762166760629998017">My feels were all over the place with this book. Harry and the gang are growing up, and the hormones are starting to work their magic. ;-) I loved seeing Hermione's crush on Viktor and her and Ron's feelings for each other starting to manifest. They really are made for each other. Then you've got Harry's first crush and I looked like this every time he got all shy about talking to Cho or whenever he thought about her or when he got jealous of Cedric.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753278.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>He's just so precious! There were so many funn</span>  <span id="freeText14762166760629998017" style="display:none">My feels were all over the place with this book. Harry and the gang are growing up, and the hormones are starting to work their magic. ;-) I loved seeing Hermione's crush on Viktor and her and Ron's feelings for each other starting to manifest. They really are made for each other. Then you've got Harry's first crush and I looked like this every time he got all shy about talking to Cho or whenever he thought about her or when he got jealous of Cedric.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753278.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>He's just so precious! There were so many funny moments in this book. I found myself chuckling a lot, especially when the Weasley twins were mentioned.<br><br>Then came the part where all the laughing stopped.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753279.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Oh, how the tears did flow. It was the first actual death to occur in the books, and it set the dark tone for the rest of the series. Cedric's death is what I consider to be the official point where everything starts falling apart for Harry. Poor Harry had to witness Cedric's pointless death. He was tied to a gravestone and tortured. He was forced to give his own blood to revive his mortal enemy and to see him return to his former strength before his eyes. Voldemort played with Harry like a cat plays with a mouse before eating it. He saw his dead parents' ghosts. All this...and he's only fourteen. He. Is. A. Child. I just can't get over that. This amazingly brave, heroic boy was staring death in the face, and all he could think about was dying like a man, not cowering at Voldemort's feet. I have such immense respect and love for this boy, and at the same time my heart bleeds for him. He goes through hell and back that night, and when he's forced to relive everything, all those unthinkable horrors, that bastard Fudge calls him crazy and a liar. Ooh, that Fudge. I just wanna...I just wanna...<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380222758ra/366974.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>One other guy that had me feeling super stabby was Lucius freaking Malfoy. How can he stand there and watch all this stuff happen to Harry when he has a son exactly his age? Does he ever think to himself that it could be Draco tied to that gravestone? Ugh. And don't even get me started on flipping Wormtail. I could kill that rat with my bare hands. The Potters trusted him and he willingly causes Harry so much pain just to preserve the pointless, torturous life that he has, a life that many would consider worse than death. Imagine being Voldemort's babysitter night and day, doing his dirty work, feeding him, milking his snake. *shudders* Wouldn't you rather die with honor and some sort of self-respect? I just can't with this guy. Look at him. Just look at that CREEP.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380391154i/753280.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And that Barty Crouch Jr.? Even creepier than Voldemort,<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1381177307ra/4453985.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And Rita Skeeter? Yeah, I'd throttle her too.<br><br>In the end, there are no books that can compare to this series. The more I read it, the more I love it. Even though this one was probably my least favorite in the series (tied with CoS), I still love it more than any other non-HP book I've ever read. JK Rowling, is nothing less than an artist.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753281.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753282.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753283.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380391154ra/753284.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="14762166760629998017" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review413973128">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link413973128" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=413973128&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_413973128'><a id="like_count_review_413973128" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/413973128?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_413973128" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_413973128" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=11&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=413973128&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_413973128" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 413973128, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">6 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/413973128?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_413973128' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/413973128/comments?reverse=true">View all 6 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_413973128' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 413973128, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_202737218" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/202737218" />    <a title="Nikki" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2958674-nikki"><img alt="Nikki" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1258672515p2/2958674.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/202737218?book_show_action=false">Feb 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Nikki" class="user" name="Nikki" href="/user/show/2958674-nikki">Nikki</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=2012">2012</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2958674-nikki?shelf=series-abandoned">series-abandoned</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer202737218" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17724880966456528120">*sigh* The charm has worn off and the all too common hype monster has been wrong again! I found the first few books of the series charming but they were not reinventing the wheel by any means. By book four Rowling isn't even reinventing her OWN wheel. Book 4 was tedious and far too lengthy (where the hell was the editor?). I just cannot come to care for any of the characters, especially Mr. Special (aka HP), and shouldn't I care by book 4?<br /><br />Some aspects of these books are just entirely too repetit</span>  <span id="freeText17724880966456528120" style="display:none">*sigh* The charm has worn off and the all too common hype monster has been wrong again! I found the first few books of the series charming but they were not reinventing the wheel by any means. By book four Rowling isn't even reinventing her OWN wheel. Book 4 was tedious and far too lengthy (where the hell was the editor?). I just cannot come to care for any of the characters, especially Mr. Special (aka HP), and shouldn't I care by book 4?<br /><br />Some aspects of these books are just entirely too repetitive. You have the beginning with HP's evil family, his fat cousin yadda yadda. Then you get to go to Hogwarts and there is a first year ceremony yadda yadda. Hagrid has some crazy creature, the school needs a new dark arts teacher, Malfoy is mean to poor little HP. In the end HP is the victor and he ends up going home to, you guessed it, the mean family. Blech. Wouldn't it be nice if maybe, I don't know, a book took place in the summer or something?? Such confining plot points Rowling!<br /><br />The Quidditch tournament was the feature of the first 130+ pages (seriously?) and it was mind-numbingly boring. Okay Rowling you invented a tedious, screwed up sport and now you want to bore us to tears with it. I don't want to READ a freakin play-by-play of any sport, especially not a made up one! Hockey is my absolute favorite sport but you will not catch me reading play-by-play of it! No! And the Quidditch is so freakin corrupt too, WTF is that saying to the kids reading the books?? And then after the tournament is over we get to go to Hogwarts, *oh joy*.<br /><br />The "plot", if you wish to call it that, in this one was rather weak. And the length of the novel did nothing to help. This one could have easily been as long as the previous three without anything of import being taken out. Such as the "romantic" drama and the dance in the book, really? Totally unnecessary. The "evil" guy in this one could have done such a simple thing to accomplish his goal and instead we had to sit through 700+ pages to get to the end. Oye. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[The bad guy could have just bypassed the tournament by using a portkey at any time to get HP to Voldemort, especially since he spoke to HP all the time. The entire tournament was unnecessary. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />And the worst part of this book and a fault of the others? Harry Potter. My god he is dull. Why does he have to be the center of attention? Hermione is by far a more interesting character since she actually,*gasp*, has some depth. What the hell does HP have? A scar? Weird friends? A crazy family history? Sure these facts may be interesting but HE is NOT. Another issue with HP is the fact that you know in the end that no matter what happens HP will be fine. You never truly fear for him and therefore are never convinced of what is happening. It leaves you feeling annoyed rather than anything positive because you cannot help but think "Who or What is going to save poor little Harry now?" Sure in other series you KNOW the character will survive because there are x number of books published/planned, but in the good ones you don't quite know how the character is going to actually come out in the end....*gasp* they might actually be altered in some way! NOOOO Oh and who the hell didn't know that Harry would be in the wizard tournament? Age restriction? Pfft! Not for precious HP, the personality-less wonder! Someone please tell me HP dies in the end? Oh forget it, I know that would never happen.<br /><br />I am so tired of HP and Hogwarts and the predictability that I don't know if I will even finish the series at this point. I've been told that the story really takes off in book 4 and gets darker. To that I say HA!<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="17724880966456528120" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review202737218">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag"  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1573207903" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1573207903" />    <a title="Bec" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4619726-bec"><img alt="Bec" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464308147p2/4619726.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1573207903?book_show_action=false">May 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Bec" class="user" name="Bec" href="/user/show/4619726-bec">Bec</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Audible Audio " href="/book/show/27866461-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4619726-bec?shelf=library">library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4619726-bec?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1573207903" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14695562689238452457">This review first appeared on <a href="http://readerswonderland.com/5-things-harry-potter-goblet-fire/" rel="nofollow">Readers in Wonderland</a><br><br><b>INITIAL REACTION</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1458979851ra/18554840.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>5 THINGS ABOUT HARRY POTTER AND THE GOBLET OF FIRE</b><br><br><i> <u>Look at the precious growing up</u> </i><br>The gang have started to enter their teenage years. They're growing up, maturing, and entering YA territory. It's hilarious watching them go through awkward stages, and puberty, and developing little crushes. But they're also starting to learn more about the world around them and struggle with more complicatedethical concepts (an example is Hermion</span>  <span id="freeText14695562689238452457" style="display:none">This review first appeared on <a href="http://readerswonderland.com/5-things-harry-potter-goblet-fire/" rel="nofollow">Readers in Wonderland</a><br><br><b>INITIAL REACTION</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1458979851ra/18554840.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>5 THINGS ABOUT HARRY POTTER AND THE GOBLET OF FIRE</b><br><br><i>  <u>Look at the precious growing up</u></i><br>The gang have started to enter their teenage years. They're growing up, maturing, and entering YA territory. It's hilarious watching them go through awkward stages, and puberty, and developing little crushes. But they're also starting to learn more about the world around them and struggle with more complicated ethical concepts (an example is Hermione and the welfare house elves). It is these challenging concepts and times that I really like to read about. Another great thing about this was Harry getting smarter and using his brain in the tournament! I was so proud of him.<br><br><i>  <u>The plot is becoming more complex</u></i><br>As the characters grow up and the books get longer. the plot also becomes more complex and I love it! There are more plot lines being juggled, more struggles for the characters to face and overcome, higher stakes and character deaths, and many more feels. There are no longer easy, simple solutions to small problems. It makes reading a lot more interesting and the book harder to put down.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463374635ra/19110486.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>  <u>Magic is awesome</u></i><br>The magical world is so cool. I really love losing myself in it. So many strange magical creatures and gadgets and spells. The creatures add a thrilling, suspenseful element to the story, especially with things like <i>dragons</i> in the tournament. And the magical gadgets I really just want in my life honestly. A TARDIS tent that is bigger on the inside would be so handy, not to mention a time turner for study or a chest that opens into multiple compartments in different dimensions.<br><br><i>  <u>Hello old Voldy</u></i><br>The dark lord has finally graced us with his full presence in a novel! I have been waiting four books for this moment. Voldemort is such an interesting and terrifying villain, it's exciting to have his plans finally start to take fruition and watch him struggle against Harry. And with the return of Voldemort and the death eaters things are finally getting much, much darker and deadly. I'm so ready for more.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463374635ra/19110487.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>  <u>It actually shocked me</u></i><br>Despite having seen the movie before reading the book, I was still completely taken by surprise by a twist I should have known was coming [spoiler] that Barty Crouch Jr. was pretending to be Moody[/spoiler]. I was absolutely shocked. What a brilliant turn of events it was. I can only hope such good twists and betrayals continue in the future books because that's going to start making me feel many emotions.<br><br><b>  <u>In Summary</u></b><br>HARRY POTTER AND THE GOBLET OF FIRE was the instalment I've been waiting for. Things are finally getting incredibly dark and Voldemort is becoming more involved. I cannot wait to continue this story further and see where THE ORDER OF THE PHOENIX takes me next.</span>  <a data-text-id="14695562689238452457" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1573207903">  <td elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1064445920" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1064445920" />    <a title="Sara (Freadom Library)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/24190242-sara-freadom-library"><img alt="Sara (Freadom Library)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471024861p2/24190242.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1064445920?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Sara (Freadom Library)" class="user" name="Sara (Freadom Library)" href="/user/show/24190242-sara-freadom-library">Sara (Freadom Library)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/15729519-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=witches-warlocks-spellcasters">witches-warlocks-spellcasters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=dragons">dragons</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=high-fantasy">high-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=read-may-2016">read-may-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1064445920" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14166575649260614004">Actual rating 4.5 stars<br /><br />This review was originally posted at <a target="_blank" href="https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/</a><br /><br />MINI REVIEW <br /><br /><b>Critically</b><br /><br />Plot U+2013 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Writing Style U+2013 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Characters U+2013 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br /><b>Emotionally</b><br /><br />This book kind of brought down my excitement for the series a bit. It was just so long! The plot is dark. WeU+2019re back at Hogwarts with Harry at a new year. The Twiwizard Tournament is a highlighted plot point with what seems to be sinister plots being mentioned. I donU+2019t want to say this</span>  <span id="freeText14166575649260614004" style="display:none">Actual rating 4.5 stars<br /><br />This review was originally posted at <a target="_blank" href="https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/</a><br /><br />MINI REVIEW <br /><br /><b>Critically</b><br /><br />Plot U+2013 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Writing Style U+2013 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Characters U+2013 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br /><b>Emotionally</b><br /><br />This book kind of brought down my excitement for the series a bit. It was just so long! The plot is dark. WeU+2019re back at Hogwarts with Harry at a new year. The Twiwizard Tournament is a highlighted plot point with what seems to be sinister plots being mentioned. I donU+2019t want to say this book was boring because it wasnU+2019t, but there were definitely sections that were less interesting than the rest of the books and then the rest of the series. The sections between the tasks of the Tournament dragged though I know now that they set up a lot for the last few chapters. Those were completely insane! Everything just got so real and intense and just plain heavy. Voldemort is back and no one but a few people actually believe Harry when he tells everyone. Honestly, I feel like those last few chapters made the overall slow book worth it. I donU+2019t know how I feel about Harry in this book. It felt like there was no real character development with him, I felt him to be the same as in the previous book. All that happened was that he got to suffer and be in pain more which does affect him but really late in the book and you donU+2019t see the repercussions until later. I found Ron to be super shallow in this book. I understood where heU+2019s coming from, it must be hard to be best friends with someone who always has the attention, who always saves the day but thatU+2019s not a reason to turn your back on him and be distrustful of his intentions. ThereU+2019s no way Harry would purposely cheat to get into a tournament where he could die. And it bothered me that Ron would act like a little brat and make it about him, it was annoying. Hermoine is just a plain freaking badass. I love her more and more in every book. She tried to keep the peace, she tried to be honest and true to herself and then she just made sure that everyone knew that she was boss and she wasnU+2019t going to take degradation of her character lying down. I love her so much. SheU+2019s officially my favorite character in this series. Dobby was super duper cute. I love his personality. And now that heU+2019s not ruining HarryU+2019s chances of going back to Hogwarts, I can connect with him a lot more. IU+2019m super looking forward to continuing the series even though things will only get heavier from here.</span>  <a data-text-id="14166575649260614004" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1064445920"> false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1064445920?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1064445920' style='display: elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1335004684" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1335004684" />    <a title="Rebecca (whymermaids)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4713345-rebecca-whymermaids"><img alt="Rebecca (whymermaids)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1347213351p2/4713345.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1335004684?book_show_action=false">Jul 14, 2015</a>      <a title="Rebecca (whymermaids)" class="user" name="Rebecca (whymermaids)" href="/user/show/4713345-rebecca-whymermaids">Rebecca (whymermaids)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1335004684" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3565688364024713967">The Goblet of Fire is perhaps my favorite of the Harry Potter books. <br /><br />It's significantly darker and more mature than the previous three, following on the tone change established in Prisoner of Azkaban, and I loved the break in Harry's perspective (sort of) by starting with a dark scene from the perspective of a muggle. From the very beginning, the reader knows, this book is different.<br /><br />THE TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT! I always loved this part of the books; I love challenges and competitions, and this was</span>  <span id="freeText3565688364024713967" style="display:none">The Goblet of Fire is perhaps my favorite of the Harry Potter books. <br /><br />It's significantly darker and more mature than the previous three, following on the tone change established in Prisoner of Azkaban, and I loved the break in Harry's perspective (sort of) by starting with a dark scene from the perspective of a muggle. From the very beginning, the reader knows, this book is different.<br /><br />THE TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT! I always loved this part of the books; I love challenges and competitions, and this was such a marked difference from the events in the previous three books. While I like quidditch, the Triwizard Tournament tasks were a fresh break from what could have been a stale formula. <br /><br />The Quidditch World Cup! Even though school quidditch was canceled for the Triwizard Tournament, quidditch was still present, but in a different format. It was fun to be introduced to wizards from all over the world and all the different ways they try to live in a muggle world. I also really loved to get the spectator viewpoint of quidditch, rather than that of a player. It's such a fun section of the book.<br /><br />The blossoming love of Ron and Hermione. There are some really great scenes revolving around this and the dynamic between the trio in this book, and I absolutely love it. I also really love the Yule Ball and Ron's dress robes.<br /><br />FRED AND GEORGE ARE MY FAVES, and this book's setup for their future is awesome, and I love where it goes from here.<br /><br />S*** gets dark. Fast. This is the first of the series where I can't stop the tears every. time. I. read. it. It's a powerful moment, and the turning point for the rest of the books. The graveyard scene is terrifying and intriguing and heavy, and the following scenes are like the end to a great mystery.<br /><br />There's less SNAPE/MALFOY DID IT too, thank goodness, because that gets annoying at times.<br /><br />I really hate how Ron treats Harry in the beginning, but it was slowly built over the previous books, and realistic for teenagers to fight, and so it made complete sense and adds more layers to their friendship and Ron's character growth, which is lovely.<br /><br />And finally, Cedric Diggory. <br /><br />Goblet of Fire equals love.</span>  <a data-text-id="3565688364024713967" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1335004684">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1335004684" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1335004684&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1335004684'><a id="like_count_review_1335004684" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1335004684?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1335004684" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1335004684" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=11&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1335004684&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1262551419" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1262551419" />    <a title="Anita Vela" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36710176-anita-vela"><img alt="Anita Vela" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467036808p2/36710176.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1262551419?book_show_action=false">Dec 13, 2015</a>      <a title="Anita Vela" class="user" name="Anita Vela" href="/user/show/36710176-anita-vela">Anita Vela</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788498386349" href="/book/show/25003696-harry-potter-y-el-c-liz-de-fuego">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36710176-anita-vela?shelf=lecturas-2015">lecturas-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1262551419" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18287820454233062743">4.5 estrellas<br /><br />U+00BFQuU+00E9 decir del cuarto libro de la saga y soltar spoilers?<br /><br />Pues para empezar tengo que decir que mi "memoria pez" esta vez no ha funcionado y conforme iba leyendo me venU+00EDan imU+00E1genes de la pelU+00EDcula (insertar carita triste aquU+00ED), entonces no lo he disfrutado tanto como los anteriores, el factor sorpresa ha fallado. Pero... El final me ha pillado totalmente por sorpresa, no me lo podU+00EDa creer. Digamos que las U+00FAltimas 150 pU+00E1ginas han sido las mU+00E1s emocionantes y las he disfrutado mU+00E1s, claro</span>  <span id="freeText18287820454233062743" style="display:none">4.5 estrellas<br /><br />U+00BFQuU+00E9 decir del cuarto libro de la saga y soltar spoilers?<br /><br />Pues para empezar tengo que decir que mi "memoria pez" esta vez no ha funcionado y conforme iba leyendo me venU+00EDan imU+00E1genes de la pelU+00EDcula (insertar carita triste aquU+00ED), entonces no lo he disfrutado tanto como los anteriores, el factor sorpresa ha fallado. Pero... El final me ha pillado totalmente por sorpresa, no me lo podU+00EDa creer. Digamos que las U+00FAltimas 150 pU+00E1ginas han sido las mU+00E1s emocionantes y las he disfrutado mU+00E1s, claro estU+00E1, que la culpa es mU+00EDa y no del libro.<br /><br />En este libro las cosas empiezan a ponerse feas y oscuras, digamos que la trama "Voldemort" ya ha comenzado y admito que me da miedo estU+00E1 nueva etapa, presiento cosas malas y no quiero. AdemU+00E1s se nota un gran cambio en los personajes principales (Harry, Ron y Hermione), ya no son tan niU+00F1os como al principio y se palpa la adolescencia en ellos, que por cierto me han hecho reU+00EDr en muchas ocasiones con los celos y riU+00F1as tontas que tienen entre ellos. Ains... <br /><br />En fin... Me ha gustado pero no tanto como el tercero (que sigue siendo mi favorito), supongo que lo de recordar casi la mitad del libro no ha ayudado, pero que no cunda el pU+00E1nico que voy a seguir con la saga. Tengo muchas ganas de leer el quinto, pero es un poco tochete y me da miedo lo que pueda encontrarme entre sus pU+00E1ginas, nada bueno... Lo presiento. Ya os contarU+00E9, jijiji.<br /><br /><a target="_blank" href="http://anitavelabooks.blogspot.com.es/2015/12/harry-potter-y-el-caliz-de-fuego-jk.html" rel="nofollow">http://anitavelabooks.blogspot.com.es...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="18287820454233062743" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1018369684" />    <a title="Yukino" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9489799-yukino"><img alt="Yukino" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1337156750p2/9489799.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1018369684?book_show_action=false">May 06, 2015</a>      <a title="Yukino" class="user" name="Yukino" href="/user/show/9489799-yukino">Yukino</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788884510495" href="/book/show/43508.Harry_Potter_e_il_Calice_di_Fuoco">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=miei">miei</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1018369684&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1018369684" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17988330233023823248">U+201CCome aveva detto Hagrid, quel che sarU+00E0 sarU+00E0... e quando fosse stato il momento, l'avrebbe affrontato.U+201D<br /><br />Non potevo non dare cinque stelle a questo libro, che mi ha letteralmente travolta di emozioni. Non me lo aspettavo davvero!!! <br />Siamo al quarto anno. Harry Hermione e Ron sono cresciuti. Lo si percepisce subito. I primi amori, i primi battibecchi, i primi litigi tra amici (come sono stata male quando Harry e Ron hanno litigato!!). Vogliamo parlare di Ron che non ha ancora capito ciU+00F2 che io (e pe</span>  <span id="freeText17988330233023823248" style="display:none">U+201CCome aveva detto Hagrid, quel che sarU+00E0 sarU+00E0... e quando fosse stato il momento, l'avrebbe affrontato.U+201D<br /><br />Non potevo non dare cinque stelle a questo libro, che mi ha letteralmente travolta di emozioni. Non me lo aspettavo davvero!!! <br />Siamo al quarto anno. Harry Hermione e Ron sono cresciuti. Lo si percepisce subito. I primi amori, i primi battibecchi, i primi litigi tra amici (come sono stata male quando Harry e Ron hanno litigato!!). Vogliamo parlare di Ron che non ha ancora capito ciU+00F2 che io (e penso tutti quanti) abbiamo capito??? <br />Splendido la coppa del mondo di quidditch. Splendido il torneo tremaghi. Splendido il ballo del ceppo. <br />Sono stata male quando U+00E8 morto Cedric. E chi si aspettava che Voldemort resuscitasse??? I Mangiamorte sono tornati!!! Malfoy si U+00E8 scoperto per quello che U+00E8 finalmente!!! Harry che rivede i genitori..U+00E8 stato davvero commovente. <br />Che dire di piU+00F9? Ah si! Voglio leggere il prossimooooooo, questo l'ho letteralmente divorato di due sere. Inizia piano..e poi ti cattura. Non posso fare piU+00F9 a meno di nessuno dei personaggi. Speriamo che nel prossimo Harry si dia una mossa con Cho...incrociamo le dita!!!!</span>  <a data-text-id="17988330233023823248" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1018369684">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1018369684" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1018369684&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1018369684'><a id="like_count_review_1018369684" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1018369684?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1018369684" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1018369684" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=11&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1018369684&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1018369684" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1018369684, true, &#39;&#39;);    <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1684080889" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2638654862363680370">This was definitely my favourite so far in all of the HP books. As this is my first time reading it, i've just been blown away each time I pick up a new book. <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ When Cedric Diggery died... holy moly, I was legit so so so upset. I had just started to like him and find him to be a generally nice and fun character to read, so it was just so sad that he died. But it had to happen I guess. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I did miss not really having any Quiddich even though it usually freaks me out and</span>  <span id="freeText2638654862363680370" style="display:none">This was definitely my favourite so far in all of the HP books. As this is my first time reading it, i've just been blown away each time I pick up a new book. <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ When Cedric Diggery died... holy moly, I was legit so so so upset. I had just started to like him and find him to be a generally nice and fun character to read, so it was just so sad that he died. But it had to happen I guess.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I did miss not really having any Quiddich even though it usually freaks me out and makes me super nervous to read, I really do enjoy it, so it was a bit odd not reading about it. <br /><br />Basically, as of right now, my favourite book in the series is goblet of fire, but my favourites just keeps going up by each book.<br /><br />1. goblet of fire<br />2. prisoner of azkaban<br />3. chamber of secrets<br />4. philosopher's stone<br /><br />I don't really have any complaints either. It was just fantastic. :)</span>  <a data-text-id="2638654862363680370" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1012982023" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1012982023" />    <a title="Melissa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7488934-melissa"><img alt="Melissa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460663471p2/7488934.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1012982023?book_show_action=false">Apr 19, 2015</a>      <a title="Melissa" class="user" name="Melissa" href="/user/show/7488934-melissa">Melissa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810576" href="/book/show/7979788-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7488934-melissa?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1012982023" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7640124715123994195">It's been a while since I re-read this book and I always thought this one was one of my favs. But this book is really huge and much darker than the previous ones. I still enjoyed it - obviously - but now I realized I prefer the movie over the book... Simply because the parts with Voldemort are very long in the book. Still a great book! I forgot a lot of details, so it was very nice to reread this one ;)<br />And for the millionth time: my heart broke for CU+00E9dric! </span>  <span id="freeText7640124715123994195" style="display:none">It's been a while since I re-read this book and I always thought this one was one of my favs. But this book is really huge and much darker than the previous ones. I still enjoyed it - obviously - but now I realized I prefer the movie over the book... Simply because the parts with Voldemort are very long in the book. Still a great book! I forgot a lot of details, so it was very nice to reread this one ;)<br />And for the millionth time: my heart broke for CU+00E9dric! U+2665</span>  <a data-text-id="7640124715123994195" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1356551303" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1356551303" />    <a title="Abby" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16909720-abby"><img alt="Abby" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1413577299p2/16909720.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1356551303?book_show_action=false">Sep 01, 2015</a>      <a title="Abby" class="user" name="Abby" href="/user/show/16909720-abby">Abby</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16909720-abby?shelf=would-read-again">would-read-again</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16909720-abby?shelf=reread">reread</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16909720-abby?shelf=all-time-favs">all-time-favs</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1356551303" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7135350991990108733">J.K. Rowling is a master plotter when it comes to her books. No character is unimportant. If they're mentioned, they'll definitely appear later in the series. Also, each book gets a bit darker as they go along. The end of Goblet of Fire is where things definitely start to get bad. It's like the books are growing along with the reader, which is a very clever tactic.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review893618597">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_893618597" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 893618597, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/893618597?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_893618597' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/893618597/comments?reverse=true">View 2 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_893618597' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 893618597, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_236519274" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/236519274" />    <a title="U+03A0 U+03AD U+03C4 U+03C1 U+03BF U+03C2" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6984857"><img alt="U+03A0 U+03AD U+03C4 U+03C1 U+03BF U+03C2" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1321523871p2/6984857.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/236519274?book_show_action=false">Nov 18, 2015</a>      <a title="U+03A0 U+03AD U+03C4 U+03C1 U+03BF U+03C2" class="user" name="U+03A0 U+03AD U+03C4 U+03C1 U+03BF U+03C2" href="/user/show/6984857">U+03A0 U+03AD U+03C4 U+03C1 U+03BF U+03C2</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer236519274" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6896346286442011913">Bullshit sport<br />Holy crap Rowling, why are you constantly making your plot holes bigger instead of fixing them? Quidditch now makes even less sense during the world cup, the most important championship in the magic world. ItU+2019s not a school completion where you can ignore the unfairness, this is supposed to treated properly. And yet we see the mascots of each team bribing the crowds with gold or seducing the referees to ignore fair play. The professional players were as civilized as apes on heat an</span>  <span id="freeText6896346286442011913" style="display:none">Bullshit sport<br />Holy crap Rowling, why are you constantly making your plot holes bigger instead of fixing them? Quidditch now makes even less sense during the world cup, the most important championship in the magic world. ItU+2019s not a school completion where you can ignore the unfairness, this is supposed to treated properly. And yet we see the mascots of each team bribing the crowds with gold or seducing the referees to ignore fair play. The professional players were as civilized as apes on heat and didnU+2019t miss the chance to brawl with each other just for the heck of it. As for the actual duration of the match, the players were moving so fast, that the on-lookers needed magic devises to slow down the scenes. It makes no sense, since while they are watching the slow motion, they miss the live action, which is the whole point of being there. And considering how they needed weeks of preparations and disguising their looks to resemble normal people, going to all the trouble just to be in a match where they canU+2019t even see the players moving, just so everything will end in less than an hour is simply not worth it.<br /><br />Misdirected fame<br />HarryU+2019s legend grows even further! Adding to his title of greatest hero for not doing anything and savior of all oppressed people for not doing anything, now he is also the champion of Hogwarts. Guess why. I bet you know it alreadyU+2026 Because he didnU+2019t do anythingU+2026 Anything other than being Harry freaking Potter, the guy who has the writer in his pocket. God how dreadful; he was just standing in a corner not doing anything and all of a sudden everyone is saying he will compete in the Magic Triathlon as the champion of his school. Only problem is, not only he didnU+2019t sign as a contestant, not only he didnU+2019t want to become one, but also his age was not allowing him to participate in the first place. It was like sending a 12 year old to the OlympicsU+2026 by force!<br /><br />Fatalism<br />And of course the teachers didnU+2019t mind at all how such a top important law was broken and went along with it. They just believed what a magic cup was telling them to do without even questioning the reasoning. Just like the sorting hat, an object once again determines their lives without giving them the option to decline. How is this not tyrannical? How are they supposed to be a democratic society with its own freelance news reporters and elected ministry when they let arbitrary objects to control their lives? How do characters even have free will? This is once again proving why magic becomes a cheap excuse to initiate conflict before used again for undoing it in an instant, making the whole thing fatalistic and illogical.<br /><br />Cheating is ok if you are the protagonist<br />ItU+2019s impossible for a kid to win if he is facing epic lever athletes with decades of more experience than him. Unless of course you are Harry freaking Potter, the guy who wins without doing anything and cheats all the time. Each test is supposed to be a secret until the last momen,t and yet teachers and house elves constantly tip him what to do and give him magic gismos to easily pass each test. See that kids? If you want to win, all you have to do is cheat, like your favorite hero does. How educational!<br /><br />No defenses<br />Security is even easier to break now, since more people keep escaping that prison from which nobody is supposed to be able to escape from. You would think they would have doubled the defenses since the last incident, but nah, they just made it easier now.<br /><br />Even if you do something extremely obvious, such as attacking people in the middle of the world cup, the place that is supposed to be super secure so normal people wonU+2019t notice anything, you can have all the fun you like and then just walk away because nobody is going to stop you. By the time the magic police arrives, you will have teleported away. ThatU+2019s right, you can teleport anywhere you want. WhatU+2019s the point of having trains and flying cars and owls delivering messages, when you can just teleport anywhere you like in an instant?<br /><br />As for the all mighty magic police, rest assured that they will never find you, since they will be busy attacking with spells innocent people who were just standing there doing nothing. And now imagine which person they attacked first. Come on, make a wild guess. Yes, it was Harry. He didnU+2019t do anything and yet he gets accused of using black magic only someone with double his age could perform. Yeah, the magic police are geniuses.<br /><br />Magic is panacea<br />But worry not, as there is a spell that can fix everything. Eye witnesses? Amnesia spell! Something broke? Mending spell! You donU+2019t have money? Trasmutate something into gold. Just go asking why RonU+2019s family is poor when you can do anything you like with magic.<br /><br />One of the countless things you can do with it, is brainwashing someone to your biding. You know, like telling you the secret passwords to the most secure places in the world? What is the point of security when magic can undo anything in an instant?<br /><br />Or if you are Harry freaking Potter, you donU+2019t even need to do that since you can guess the password to the archmagesU+2019 room in a few seconds, by mentioning random words. Anyone else would need years to crack a code but Harry does it in seconds by accident. Totally not convenient.<br /><br />Another thing you can do with magic is transforming yourself into a different person. Rest assured that nobody is going to find out you are fake, even if they know the person you are impersonating for decades. There is even a spell that stupefies the target for a few minutes, although I donU+2019t see a reason for having to use that, since everybody is already a retard.<br /><br />And yes, they are retards, since they have alarms that point out when someone is using magic to hide something. Remember, they were in the previous book and they never paid attention to them? And what about the time machine? I mean, they were spamming its use in the previous book just to be in more school sessions. ShouldnU+2019t they use it now to prevent the great tragedy that happened in the end of the story for saving lives and preventing the return of the Lord of All Evil? Well, you can now forget them with an amnesia spell, since as if by magic, they no longer exist. If someone asks questions regarding that, throw a stupefy spell and teleport away.<br /><br />Cheap showdown<br />The final confrontation is once again disappointing, as it has to do with the bad guy spending 50 pages in explaining all his plans to Harry, instead of, I donU+2019t know; killing him right away? And once again we have a plot convenience saving his ass, as dead friends and family return from the dead to save him with some reverse spell bullshit excuse. And the funny part is that when Harry teleports away from there, another bad guy finds him and spends another 50 pages in explaining shit!<br /><br />And despite having to suffer through 100 pages of infodump, this evil master plan still makes no freaking sense. If their plan was for Harry to touch the cup so he can teleport in front of Voltemort, what was the point of helping him join the triathlon and win in every trial? They could have simply used the disguised bad guy to trick Harry into touching the cup at any given moment. Or they could have grabbed him and pushed him on the cup. Or even better, they could have simply teleported him themselves.<br /><br />And not even the second villain is defeated by Harry doing something. Once again he stands idle, as the teachers appear out of nowhere and save his ass. And check this out; they capture the bad guy and interrogate him. What kind of great detective work are they using? Combining hints and solving riddles? Questioning suspects? Using mind games to lure him into revealing things he normally wouldnU+2019t? Nope, they just brainwash him with a spell and he explains everything right away. Why donU+2019t they simply use brainwashing on everybody since the first book and be done with it? Why didnU+2019t they use it in the trials after the war to find all the hidden allies of Voltemort? And donU+2019t give me bullshit excuses about not wanting to bend free will. They just used it on this guy. The worst part is of course that we get yet another 50 pages of monologue!<br /><br />Awful storytelling<br />This whole book is essentially 500 pages of filler, infodumping, plot convenience, and Harry cheating in everything. Retarded beyond belief. This series is complete trash in terms of storytelling. How many childrenU+2019s critical thought did this woman author ruin with them? The fanboys keep telling me that I should focus on the characters instead of the plot holes, but that is impossible. No matter what happens to the characters can easily be undone with magic. ItU+2019s like you are asking me to feel sorry for a guy who has a toothache, in a setting with dentists. Why would you feel sorry for someone who is simply not treating an easily treatable problem? You will laugh at his stupidity, which is exactly what I did. So donU+2019t you dare say I am nitpicking because I certainly donU+2019t. I treat these books as they treat my intelligence. And that is, very-very badly.</span>  <a data-text-id="6896346286442011913" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div
