elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1665363359" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1665363359" />    <a title="Romane" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27353893-romane"><img alt="Romane" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460093055p2/27353893.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1665363359?book_show_action=false">Oct 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Romane" class="user" name="Romane" href="/user/show/27353893-romane">Romane</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1665363359" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13852767337121542199">Me and My Mom love this book the most in the series! <br><br>I loved all of the character's growth phase here as well.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476737626i/20875355.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476737626i/20875356._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>For me this book is so colorful and full of magic. New things and characters are introduced once again. <br><br>Though I wish they included in the movie some totally awesome scenes such as: Hermione fighting for elf rights (S.P.E.W.), the elves preparing food in the kitchen, or even Dobby working in the Hogwarts' kitchen.<br><br><br><br>So yes, what's new in this book you ask? <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a> gives you the <i>QUIDDIT</i></span>  <span id="freeText13852767337121542199" style="display:none">Me and My Mom love this book the most in the series! <br><br>I loved all of the character's growth phase here as well.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476737626i/20875355.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476737626i/20875356._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>For me this book is so colorful and full of magic. New things and characters are introduced once again. <br><br>Though I wish they included in the movie some totally awesome scenes such as: Hermione fighting for elf rights (S.P.E.W.), the elves preparing food in the kitchen, or even Dobby working in the Hogwarts' kitchen.<br><br><br><br>So yes, what's new in this book you ask? <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a> gives you the <i>QUIDDITCH WORLD CUP</i> and the <i>TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT!</i> Those are two of the best parts too.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1476737626ra/20875357.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><br>Ron buying a miniature Viktor Krum during the Quidditch World Cup was so cute.<br><br>I was so happy when Harry was chosen as one of the players in the Triwizard Tournament! But, when Harry started wearing the invisibility cloak to avoid the sneers and judgment of his fellow Hogwarts schoolmates, it just made me sad. I've also realized here that casting a spell is harder than it looks.<br><br><br><br>When Harry opened the golden egg underwater U+2014 that part was fascinatingly beautiful.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476737626i/20875358._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><br>I am a huge shipper of Cedric Diggory and Harry Potter. HEDRIC!!!<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476738083i/20875451._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476738083i/20875452._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><br>As time goes on in the Wizarding World, I noticed the difference between the Weasley twins. Fred is more carefree than George. Yes, they are both rascal pranksters and inventors in their hearts, yet Fred is always the joker, and George is more reserved - not too reserved, just enough to tell them apart.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476738331i/20875459._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><br>During the Yule Ball, it was mentioned in the book that Hermione's dress was blue. Yet, in the movie it was pink. Either way, she still looks beautiful no matter what color of the clothes she wear.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476739476i/20875568._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476740939i/20875715._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476740939i/20875716._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476740939i/20875717._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>I ship Hermione and Draco so much. DRAMIONE getting strong.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476739476i/20875569.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476739477i/20875570.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476739477i/20875571.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1476739477ra/20875572.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><br>I felt sorry for Bartemius "Barty" Crouch Jr. He went under so much pain, maybe that's why he did all those things. Still, he did not deserved to be handed over to the Dementors. And also, some people are shipping him and Luna Lovegood. Is that a thing? Kind of strange, but why not?<br><br>Voldemort is officially back. Yet the Ministry of Magic denies this. It was so frustrating when I read that. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476739477i/20875573._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>In the beginning of the book, I thought that this is all fun and games. But in the end, the story took a dark and grisly twist.<br><br>Superb read overall.</span>  <a data-text-id="13852767337121542199" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1665363359">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1665363359" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1665363359&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1665363359'><a id="like_count_review_1665363359" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1665363359?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">10 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1665363359" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1665363359" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=10&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1665363359&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1665363359" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1665363359, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1665363359?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1665363359' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1665363359' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1665363359, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_933372103" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/933372103" />    <a title="Corey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12949855-corey"><img alt="Corey" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_5f-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/933372103?book_show_action=false">Oct 25, 2016</a>      <a title="Corey" class="user" name="Corey" href="/user/show/12949855-corey">Corey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer933372103&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer933372103" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9441005538693267346">After reading The Goblet of Fire I started to notice that the books were starting to get darker and darker, because I remember this one being slightly darker than the first 3 books. It was still a great book however!<br /><br />The book opens with Harry waking up after having a nightmare of a man being killed by Lord Voldemort, and Harry wakes up with his lightning scar hurting, which happens whenever Voldemort is present. Harry leaves the Dursley's and accompanies The Weasleys and Hermione to the Quidditch</span>  <span id="freeText9441005538693267346" style="display:none">After reading The Goblet of Fire I started to notice that the books were starting to get darker and darker, because I remember this one being slightly darker than the first 3 books. It was still a great book however!<br /><br />The book opens with Harry waking up after having a nightmare of a man being killed by Lord Voldemort, and Harry wakes up with his lightning scar hurting, which happens whenever Voldemort is present. Harry leaves the Dursley's and accompanies The Weasleys and Hermione to the Quidditch World Cup, to watch Ireland vs. Bulgaria. After the match is won by Ireland the site is attacked by Death Eaters, the followers of Lord Voldemort, and they release the Dark Mark, Voldemort's symbol that resembles a skull with a serpent coming from it's mouth like a tongue, and everyone panics because the Dark Mark hasn't been seen for 13 years since Voldemort's disappearance .<br /><br />While at Hogwarts, Professor Dumbledore introduces us to Professor Alastor Moody, AKA Mad-Eye Moody, who is replacing Remus Lupin as Defense Against the Dark Arts Teacher, and also announces that Hogwarts is hosting the Twiwizard Tournament, and 2 schools travel to Hogwarts to compete in the tournament, the Durmstrang Institute, and the Beauxbatons Academy. Professor Dumbledore presents the Goblet of Fire, which is the impartial judge where whoever wishes to compete in the Tournament can place their name in the Goblet and if chosen they can't back out. <br /><br />3 Students are allowed to compete, the champion chosen from Durmstrang is Viktor Krum (who is also the Seeker of the Bulgarian Quidditch Team, and Hermione becomes infatuated with), the Beauxbatons Champion is Fleur Delacour, and the Hogwarts champion is Cedric Diggory, a Hufflepuff student. Even though Harry admits to not entering the tournament, his name is put into the Goblet of Fire, no one knows by who, but everybody believes it was Harry, and the accuse him and call him a cheat because by order of the Ministry of Magic, for their on safety no one under the age of 17 is allowed to compete in the tournament.<br /><br />Harry has no choice since the rule is he can't back out. So Harry and the other champions must face 3 very difficult tasks. What Harry doesn't realize however is that whoever put his name into the Goblet is no friend to him and it involves Lord Voldemort.<br /><br />I remember when I saw the movie in theaters with some friends, at the time I thought it was the scariest one yet, and of course it was the first film to get a PG-13 rating. Some parts just scared the hell out of me, like the fight with the Dragon, and the return of Lord Voldemort. And they also left out a lot of stuff that was in the book, which I hated, it was still good though, and I had the biggest crush on Fleur Delacour when I was a kid, I always dreamed of marrying her, I thought she was so beautiful. I also noticed in this book that Ron and Hermione slowly consider each other more than just friends, even though they still bicker quite a bit, HAHA!<br /><br />In my opinion, probably the second best Harry Potter book, right up there with The Prisoner of Azkaban!</span>  <a data-text-id="9441005538693267346" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review933372103">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link933372103" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=933372103&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_933372103'><a id="like_count_review_933372103" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/933372103?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">10 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_933372103" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_933372103" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=10&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=933372103&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_933372103" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 933372103, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/933372103?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_933372103' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_933372103' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 933372103, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_3599262" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3599262" />    <a title="J.G. Keely" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/84023-j-g-keely"><img alt="J.G. Keely" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1274333636p2/84023.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3599262?book_show_action=false">Aug 16, 2007</a>      <a title="J.G. Keely" class="user" name="J.G. Keely" href="/user/show/84023-j-g-keely">J.G. Keely</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fiction">contemporary-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=novel">novel</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fantasy">contemporary-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=uk-and-ireland">uk-and-ireland</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer3599262" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3019901365287919963">I am beginning to regret reviewing these all in a row, as I feel I need repeat myself. Then again, the theme and structure of the books is repetitious, so perhaps there is little else I can add.<br /><br />By this point, Rowling has caught her stride, and begun that inescapable page-climb for which she became--especially in the young-adult genre--especially infamous. This book is, more than anything, an expansion of the world and of events. She puts off Quidditch at the school--perhaps out of a fear that Ha</span>  <span id="freeText3019901365287919963" style="display:none">I am beginning to regret reviewing these all in a row, as I feel I need repeat myself. Then again, the theme and structure of the books is repetitious, so perhaps there is little else I can add.<br /><br />By this point, Rowling has caught her stride, and begun that inescapable page-climb for which she became--especially in the young-adult genre--especially infamous. This book is, more than anything, an expansion of the world and of events. She puts off Quidditch at the school--perhaps out of a fear that Harry's Gryffindors playing every year would grow dull. Instead, we have the Tri-Wizard Tournament and the World Quidditch Cup (to tide us over). Many critiques of Rowling's world-building--previously grumblings--can begin in earnest here, as she expands the world of wizards from a small cadre into a full-blown, worldwide community of secret-keeping.<br /><br />Not only are there the questions of Why all the secrecy, but now How, as well. The plot leaps around as is its wont, aided by a magical urging here or a convenient villain there, and the promised 'dead character' is, of course, one almost entirely given importance solely in this text. This certainly isn't the most underwhelming that her promise of future deaths will become, but it is a foreshadowing.<br /><br />The characters and conflicts are exciting as ever, and as she finally developed the pacing in the last book to prevent us losing ourself in a plot which twists and turns not so much like a maze, but like a meandering goat trail, we can at least now feel the wind in our hair as we gallop along it.<br /><br />I really wish that the various psychological and foreshadowed elements would resolve themselves, but one often as not finds that the climax comes with a sense of "oh, are we here already?" rather than "I've been waiting for this".<br /><br />Rowling seems to do better when things are darker and more hopeless (or perhaps those are the only moments when she cannot draw into the waistcoats of her child's lit contemporaries for inspiration), and this book continues the trend that began with a darker change in tone in 'Prisoner of Azkaban' and culminating in the next offering.<br /><br /><a href="http://starsbeetlesandfools.blogspot.com/2012/06/suggested-readings-in-fantasy.html" rel="nofollow">My Fantasy Book Suggestions</a></span>  <a data-text-id="3019901365287919963" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_3599262" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_3599262" ref="like" class="jsLike SU+00FCrprizli sonu Azkaban TutsaU+011F U+0131'yla karU+015F U+0131laU+015FtU+0131rU+0131labilecek kadar U+015Fok edici olmasa da, U+00E7ok katmanlU+0131 hikayesi derinleU+015FtikU+00E7e her kU+00F6 U+015Fede bir baU+015Fka twist'le karU+015F U+0131laU+015F U+0131yor okuyucu, U+00FCstelik Voldemort'un yeniden vU+00FCcut buluU+015Funa ve tamamen kendisi olarak Harry'le karU+015F U+0131laU+015FmasU+0131na da burada rastlU+0131yoruz; Voldemort'un gerU+00E7ek anlamda dU+00F6nU+00FC U+015F U+00FCnU+00FC bize ilk kez gU+00F6steren kitap, AteU+015F Kadehi. id="reviewTextContainer1212271265" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14196007548081187000">For the first time I read this book it was in Malay language. To make it funny I read this book in the first line and read Prisoner of Azkaban, Chamber of Secrets and lastly Sorcerrer's Stone. Back then when I was young I'm a spoiler girl...<br /><br />Now after read it in English with orderly manner I found out this is the best (Of Coz!)<br /><br />The character simply more life rather than my own language which I found really enjoying.<br /><br />Well Harry Potter series really fun for me. Reading it as if I'm growing up with th</span>  <span id="freeText14196007548081187000" style="display:none">For the first time I read this book it was in Malay language. To make it funny I read this book in the first line and read Prisoner of Azkaban, Chamber of Secrets and lastly Sorcerrer's Stone. Back then when I was young I'm a spoiler girl...<br /><br />Now after read it in English with orderly manner I found out this is the best (Of Coz!)<br /><br />The character simply more life rather than my own language which I found really enjoying.<br /><br />Well Harry Potter series really fun for me. Reading it as if I'm growing up with them. ;p Even I'm already 23 years old.<br /><br />Lol</span>  <a data-text-id="14196007548081187000" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1406767389" />    <a title="Lauryn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/47419671-lauryn"><img alt="Lauryn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464068300p2/47419671.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1406767389?book_show_action=false">Jul 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Lauryn" class="user" name="Lauryn" href="/user/show/47419671-lauryn">Lauryn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/47419671-lauryn?shelf=owned">owned</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1406767389" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10337161906205900441">Dang, this book took me forever to read. However, it wasn't because it was bad or anything! I really enjoyed it and am glad that I decided to finally read the series. I can see how this book shows the transformation into something much darker. And I'm kind of scared for what is to come next. Nevertheless, I am excited to continue my journey with Harry Potter and all his magical adventures.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_10120562" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/10120562" />    <a title="Alejandro" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/665584-alejandro"><img alt="Alejandro" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1328672389p2/665584.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/10120562?book_show_action=false">Aug 22, 2014</a>      <a title="Alejandro" class="user" name="Alejandro" href="/user/show/665584-alejandro">Alejandro</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=novel">novel</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer10120562" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11427924245666953749">How can I choose just one book of the entire series of Harry Potter? How?! HOW?!!! ;) I was choosing the books for my "Favorites" shelf and when I came to choose one single book of Potter series, I realized that I was in troubles, serious troubles. I didn't want to put the all 7 books in the shelf, since I wanted to use the "Favorites" shelf as my "face" or introductory card in the profile page and I wanted to stick to just 10 books. Those 10 books may change in the road, at least 2 or 3 of</span>  <span id="freeText11427924245666953749" style="display:none">How can I choose just one book of the entire series of Harry Potter? How?! HOW?!!! ;) I was choosing the books for my "Favorites" shelf and when I came to choose one single book of Potter series, I realized that I was in troubles, serious troubles. I didn't want to put the all 7 books in the shelf, since I wanted to use the "Favorites" shelf as my "face" or introductory card in the profile page and I wanted to stick to just 10 books. Those 10 books may change in the road, at least 2 or 3 of them, but I wanted to have just 10 books in that shelf to denote how special those books are for me for different reasons, and well, to "burn" 7 spaces in the Harry Potter books wasn't something that I like to do, so I chose to use the 4th book as a representant of the entire series. And by that, the following review will be about the whole series, and not limited to the 4th book. Don't worry, there aren't spoilers. Well, my reading of Harry Potter books was magical (pun intended) and it was a return to serious active reading duties. I have been reader all my life but for some time (maybe a couple of years) I was like out of the hype of being reading something, much less some book that it was a phenomenon in the readers' world. Usually my novels were horror books by Dean Koontz, Star Trek novels or Buffy the Vampire Slayer novels, so I was like out of what was the rush in current readers' world. I was watching the films but I hadn't read the books. However, a friend lent me the first book after I had watched the 4th film and WOW!!! I couldn't believe how good was the first book! The adaptation to film was very well done here, but the prose and style of JK Rowling was magical (pun intended...again!) and then I knew that I had to read the rest of the books. I started to buy the following books (later I got my own copy of the first one for the collection), when I went to watch the 5th film, I already read the book ;) It was a different experience. Okay, I love the first book and I was way tempted to use that one as the representant in the favorites shelf. I like the second book, it's just that since Hermione is my favorite character, well, there are stuff there that put me out of interest at some point of the book, but still it's a very good book and one of the darkest of the series. The third book is amazing and easily one of the best written in the entire series connecting a LOT of stuff that you even met in previous books. The fourth book is wonderful due the inclusion of the other schools of magic, I felt that the world of Potter just got bigger and the whole competition thing is awesome. The 5th book is some of my most stressful experiences in my life! Not really! I felt really trapped without an exit in that book! But it's a proof of how good JK Rowling writes, since anyone who can provoke that kind of feelings while you're reading a book is mag...mmh...oh what the heck! It's magical! ;) Hehehe Also, in the 5th book I got two other wonderful new characters as Luna and Tonks. My only critique to Rowling is about those two characters that both started so amazing that I think that at some point Rowling was worried that some of those two or both could get more popular with fans than Hermione, so you feel in the 6th and 7th books that their roles and time on scenes are at minimum. Since I was so stressed after reading the 5th book, I embrace the 6th book with a lot of happiness and finally I was glad to see how cool the life can be for Harry finally, at least for a time, and knowing the origin of you-know-who was awesome, it's a great tragedy. I ran to the library the day that the 7th book was out and I read it like in 3 days, totally disconnected from internet or news to avoid to be spoiled of anything in the final book and to be honest, it's my least favorite book of the series. I don't know if was because to read it so quick or because I didn't like much of the events there. There are like 3 chapters that I liked a lot in the 7th book, but honestly it was dissapointing to be reading like for a month a lot of podcasts of Rowling explaining a lot of stuff that she forgot to resolve in the book. I think that using a test reading group to check what things she was missing to explain and to resolve could be valuable. It was the final book! Oh, well, I love the books. Rowling rules! Something wicked this way comes when I started to read this magical series! ;)</span>  <a data-text-id="11427924245666953749" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review10120562">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link10120562" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_10120562" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_10120562" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_10120562" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 10120562, true, &#39;&#39;); return elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1478268453" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1478268453" />    <a title="Patricia Meyer" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/49380315-patricia-meyer"><img alt="Patricia Meyer" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454459829p2/49380315.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1478268453?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Patricia Meyer" class="user" name="Patricia Meyer" href="/user/show/49380315-patricia-meyer">Patricia Meyer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855683" href="/book/show/22844191-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/49380315-patricia-meyer?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/49380315-patricia-meyer?shelf=2015-reads">2015-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/49380315-patricia-meyer?shelf=read-fantasy">read-fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1478268453" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16477489216705800049">Rating: <br />Date Finished: 28/12/15<br />Pages: 617<br /><br />Review:<br />If there was ever a book that deserved more than 5 stars, this is the book. I always say that a major part of a good book is a good compelling beginning and an ending which leaves you gasping for more. The beginning wouldn't let me put the book down. It started off as usual at the Dursleys' and let an unusual moment happen where Vernon gave the Weasleys' permission to pick Harry up from their house (Sunday at 5 o'clock). The beginning made me heave</span>  <span id="freeText16477489216705800049" style="display:none">Rating: U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605<br />Date Finished: 28/12/15<br />Pages: 617<br /><br />Review:<br />If there was ever a book that deserved more than 5 stars, this is the book. I always say that a major part of a good book is a good compelling beginning and an ending which leaves you gasping for more. The beginning wouldn't let me put the book down. It started off as usual at the Dursleys' and let an unusual moment happen where Vernon gave the Weasleys' permission to pick Harry up from their house (Sunday at 5 o'clock). The beginning made me heave with laughter when that little piglet of a boy, Dudley at a Ton-Tongue Toffee and his tongue stretched 4 feet long! It continue to leave me hanging with wonder as everyone within the book was buzzing with excitement over the fact that "something" was happening at Hogwarts except the reader did not figure out what that "something" was until later on. To give you an idea of how grasping the ending was, note that I went to sleep at 3:40 in the morning, face buried in this book. The plot was never dull. The tournament itself had more action and depth than a lot of books, throwing in dragons, merpeople, and a giant maze! This book introduced a character Alastor `"Mad-Eye" Moody, who is one of the best characters ever written in the Harry Potter series. He is smart as well as fierce, <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ which is why I was extremely upset when it was revealed that he had not been Ma-Eye all along. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> The way Rowling described all the new characters was amazing, giving me enough information to paint vivid pictures within my mind of the characters. This book left me laughing yet-- NOT DONE YET. Lets talk about the ending, obviously, spoilers <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[. The ending at the graveyard just ripped out my heart and threw it into a meat grinder. Cedric's death was so sad. His life was just thrown away "kill the extra" as if he wasn't a living, breathing person. The reforming of Voldemort was one of the creepiest scenes I have ever imagined; literally chills. The fight at the graveyard was also sad because Harry had to see the ghost of his parents, of the boy who just died. There are not enough words to accurately portray my anger with Cornelius Fudge. He killed the only witness to not only see the deaths of Voldemorts' victims as well as the rebirth of Voldemort himself. He was the only person who could convince the council that Voldemort has returned. He could have given up the names of the death eaters and Cornelius took that away out of his own ignorance and impatience. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> In conclusion, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is my favourite book of all time. Nothing can compare to the quality of this book.<br /><br />Categories: Fantasy, Action</span>  <a data-text-id="16477489216705800049" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1478268453">  <td elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1282775930" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1282775930" />    <a title="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm"><img alt="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364999103p2/7436809.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1282775930?book_show_action=false">Jun 24, 2015</a>      <a title="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" class="user" name="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" href="/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm">Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=review">review</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1282775930" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15719146760287055186">Warning, this review has spoilers for this book and the entire series.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is the fourth book and, apart from the Deathly Hallows, is the most action packed with the Quidditch world cup and the three tasks happening throughout the book. This book is the turning point where the series changes, with its first death and with Voldemort being back. This book has a darker tone and shows the maturing of the novels and characters. <br /><br />I feel the title of this book should have</span>  <span id="freeText15719146760287055186" style="display:none">Warning, this review has spoilers for this book and the entire series.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is the fourth book and, apart from the Deathly Hallows, is the most action packed with the Quidditch world cup and the three tasks happening throughout the book. This book is the turning point where the series changes, with its first death and with Voldemort being back. This book has a darker tone and shows the maturing of the novels and characters. <br /><br />I feel the title of this book should have been Harry Potter and the Triwizard Tournament as the Goblet of Fire plays a very small in this book. Also Avada Kadavra does not seem the worse way to die, at least it is quick. The film missed out lots of stuff from this book such as SPEW, the twins and Bagman, Hagrid being a half giant and so much more. <br /><br />The hormones have kicked in and you can see the main characters growing up and becoming the adults they later become. Poor Harry, he can never catch a break and is under loads of attention and pressure in this book. Ron, even though he is one of my favourite, did irritate me as he did not stick by his best friend, but this happens often with teenagers and I can understand him always being over looked and second best. I like how we get to know Neville more and about his past. <br /><br />This entire series is very British apart from the Yule Ball which is very American as at most school dances I went to, we donU+2019t partner up but just go as group of friends unless they are already a couple. There are a few plot holes which donU+2019t make sense, firstly the rules said that only 3 people were allowed in the tournament so why did they not stop Harry continuing. Also I donU+2019t get how the people that meant the most to Cedric and Krum are girls that they have only been going out with for a few weeks. The biggest plot hole in this book is how Voldemort got his wand back as he was a kind of spirit when he fled from attacking infant Harry.<br /><br />I cannot recommend Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, and the entire series highly enough. <br /><br />This and my other reviews can be found at <a href="http://amethystbookwyrm.blogspot.co.uk/" rel="nofollow">Amethyst Bookwyrm</a><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="15719146760287055186" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1354077300" />    <a title="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13"><img alt="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1447807212p2/45616064.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1354077300?book_show_action=false">Dec 12, 2015</a>      <a title="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" class="user" name="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" href="/user/show/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13">Melanie (itsabookishthing13)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1354077300" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12464477839140058785">This book was as epic and wonderful as I expected it to be, and then some.<br /><br />As I've said in each of my reviews on the Harry Potter books, I LOVE THE MOVIES. Goblet of Fire is probably the one I've watched the most times, next to Sorcerer's Stone. This book explained so many things I never knew I had questions on. The way J.K. Rowling manages her wit and cleverness throughout the entire book astounds me every time I pick one of her books up. She has the simplest, yet utterly elegant writing, where</span>  <span id="freeText12464477839140058785" style="display:none">This book was as epic and wonderful as I expected it to be, and then some.<br /><br />As I've said in each of my reviews on the Harry Potter books, I LOVE THE MOVIES. Goblet of Fire is probably the one I've watched the most times, next to Sorcerer's Stone. This book explained so many things I never knew I had questions on. The way J.K. Rowling manages her wit and cleverness throughout the entire book astounds me every time I pick one of her books up. She has the simplest, yet utterly elegant writing, where a simple sentence feels like a lifetime of adventure.<br /><br />Goblet of Fire continues Harry Potter's story, this time following him entering a very dangerous competition, which he is thrust upon. The tasks he has to go through were SO EXCITING, I loved every single one of those chapters the most.<br /><br />When the story reaches the end, during the final task....I don't think I blinked during that whole chapter. That speech, man. THAT SPEECH. <br /><br />Yule Ball was EVERYTHING. Hermione & Ron banter was SO BEAUTIFUL I CAN'T DEAL. Watching Ron's jealously toward Krum was my absolute favorite, and I especially loved it through Harry's eyes, because even though Harry notices subtle things that nudge towards Ron having some sort of feelings toward Hermione, through his eyes its not such a big deal, even though its marking the start of something new and VERY EXCITING.<br /><br />I absolutely loved this book, every single part of it. I'M SO EXCITED FOR ORDER OF THE PHOENIX I CAN'T HANDLE IT.</span>  <a data-text-id="12464477839140058785" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_553448693" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/553448693" />    <a title="Roberta" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6612660-roberta"><img alt="Roberta" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1404885825p2/6612660.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/553448693?book_show_action=false">Aug 27, 2015</a>      <a title="Roberta" class="user" name="Roberta" href="/user/show/6612660-roberta">Roberta</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6612660-roberta?shelf=regno-unito">regno-unito</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6612660-roberta?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6612660-roberta?shelf=classicidaleggere">classicidaleggere</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer553448693" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15735787830955850075">Fourth chapter of the saga. Harry is back to school, Voldemort is back to life. <br />The competition amongst schools is quite a nice change from the usual Quidditch games, and it's a clever way to take the plot of the saga a step further. <br />Harry is growing up, and so are his friends. This novel is dark-(ish)-er than the previous ones and more suitable for the adult reader. I think the carachters are taking shapes, they look more complex than before. It's probably due to choice at the end of the book:</span>  <span id="freeText15735787830955850075" style="display:none">Fourth chapter of the saga. Harry is back to school, Voldemort is back to life. <br />The competition amongst schools is quite a nice change from the usual Quidditch games, and it's a clever way to take the plot of the saga a step further. <br />Harry is growing up, and so are his friends. This novel is dark-(ish)-er than the previous ones and more suitable for the adult reader. I think the carachters are taking shapes, they look more complex than before. It's probably due to choice at the end of the book: believing or not in Voldemort's resurrection. Now we have to split the lot into the good and the bad guys, and anyone will have its own role. <br />I've been reading and re-reading this saga since it was published. I'm amazed how well developed it is, I never grow tired of it. </span>  <a data-text-id="15735787830955850075" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>   </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1493864877" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3647715693032915505">5/5 Cada capU+00EDtulo esta hecho para mantenerte enganchada y que tengas ganas de pasar al siguiente. Reniego tanto de ver antes las pelU+00EDculas porque hay secretos por descubrir que ya no me sorprenden, y me alegro de que otros si lo hagan. La presencia de Sirius fue de lo mejor, y ya se llegU+00F3 al esperado renacer del mal..</span>  <span id="freeText3647715693032915505" style="display:none">5/5 Aunque vengo notando la costumbre de la autora por reiterar hechos de <br />los demU+00E1s libros (lo cual es comprensible, pero aveces llega a molestarme), no se le puede dar una nota menor. Cada capU+00EDtulo esta hecho para mantenerte enganchada y que tengas ganas de pasar al siguiente. Reniego tanto de ver antes las pelU+00EDculas porque hay secretos por descubrir que ya no me sorprenden, y me alegro de que otros si lo hagan. La presencia de Sirius fue de lo mejor, y ya se llegU+00F3 al esperado renacer del mal... Desde este punto, todo lo que queda por pasar terminara por hacer madurar a los protagonistas, y muero de ganas por leerlo (y tambiU+00E9n de terror porque son muchU+00EDsimas paginas :D ).</span>  <a I want to marry Krum, Cedric, Harry, the whole Weasley family and even Dumbledore! How does Rowling do that?! I forgot how it ended and ah, couldn't end better. Harry has such a good heart. <br /><br />And for everyone who hasn't read Harry Potter yet, and isn't planning to do it, here's what I have to say to you... GO READ IT! DO IT! It's not childish, or whatever. It's getting better and better every book and ohmy all the feels! JUST READ IT! I'm sure I will probably say that about the next three books because these books are amazing. itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1545159774" />    <a title="Mike Coville" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/23998591-mike-coville"><img alt="Mike Coville" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459706895p2/23998591.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1545159774?book_show_action=false">Feb 19, 2016</a>      <a title="Mike Coville" class="user" name="Mike Coville" href="/user/show/23998591-mike-coville">Mike Coville</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1545159774" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17585003863123413418">The maturity of this book is a jump from book 3. Rowling does a great job of adding more to the story and depth to the characters that I found lacking in the first 3 books. I did find her use of the villain rant to explain the actions of Voldemort and Barty Crouch jr a bit repetitive and unnecessary. As a reader I fully understood how Barty did what he did without having to read him ranting about it.<br /><br />On to book 5</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1545159774">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_6902903" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/6902903" />    <a title="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/395599-shannon-giraffe-days"><img alt="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1420332941p2/395599.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/6902903?book_show_action=false">Sep 28, 2011</a>      <a title="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" class="user" name="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" href="/user/show/395599-shannon-giraffe-days">Shannon (Giraffe Days)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747550990" href="/book/show/864890.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=favourite">favourite</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=2011">2011</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=made-me-cry">made-me-cry</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer6902903" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10680145368881712517"><i>This review contains spoilers.</i><br /><br />This is one I've only read once, when it first came out, and I've only seen the movie once too, so there was lots of "new" details for me on this re-read. This isn't the copy I originally bought back in 2000 (it was first released in paperback; book 5 was the first hardcover edition on release); I had to put that one in the recycling bin and buy a new copy (and I was shocked at how expensive it was: at $32, it's much more than the other children's/YA hardcovers) bec</span>  <span id="freeText10680145368881712517" style="display:none"><i>This review contains spoilers.</i><br /><br />This is one I've only read once, when it first came out, and I've only seen the movie once too, so there was lots of "new" details for me on this re-read. This isn't the copy I originally bought back in 2000 (it was first released in paperback; book 5 was the first hardcover edition on release); I had to put that one in the recycling bin and buy a new copy (and I was shocked at how expensive it was: at $32, it's much more than the other children's/YA hardcovers) because it had water damage and black mould on the bottom from the time when my brother stored some boxes of my books under his house - on dirt, on a steep hillside - while I was in Japan. Idiotic thing to do. I also lost my original copy of <i>Philosopher's Stone</i> too, which is why I have the Raincoast (Canadian) edition of it now.<br /><br /><i>The Goblet of Fire</i> starts, as usual, at the end of the summer holidays before Harry's fourth year at Hogwarts. Because Harry now has a godfather - escaped mass murderer Sirius Black - the Dursleys are being, not nice, but careful not to overtly abuse Harry less this mad protector hears about it. So when Harry is invited to the final match in the Quidditch World Cup by his best friend, Ron Weasley, Uncle Vernon reluctantly agrees.<br /><br />The World Cup final is between Ireland and Bulgaria, and the Weasleys have seats in the top box. After the game, several Death Eaters - supporters of Lord Voldemort - make an appearance, as does the Dark Mark in the sky. It's just the beginning of the signs that Voldemort is on his way back, and when Harry's name comes out of the Goblet of Fire, making him a fourth school Champion in the Triwizard Tournament, it's clear that something foul is afoot.<br /><br />I tend to think of this book as the end of Harry's childhood, because things get extra serious, Cedric Diggory is murdered, and Lord Voldemort returns. The next three books are noticeably darker in tone and deed, and unlike in <i>  <a href="http://www.giraffedays.com/?p=8861" rel="nofollow">Chamber of Secrets</a></i>, people - Harry's friends - start dying. I always felt more tense, here on out (in a good way).<br /><br />The ending of this book always makes me cry. Cedric's death is one of those horrible, senseless deaths. Rowling makes sure you're going to have a personal stake in Harry's drive to defeat Voldemort, after Cedric's death, for Cedric was a genuinely good, likeable boy. Dumbledore's memorial speech at the end is incredibly moving - truly, Dumbledore gets some of the best lines, and is a phenomenal character and role model. To be honest, this series is as good for children learning about right and wrong etc., as the fairy tales used to be. (Fairy tales are cautionary tales using analogies to impart warnings etc.) If children learn morals from books, this series has lots to impart.<br /><br /><i>Goblet of Fire</i> is a busy book, with a great deal happening over the course of a school year. We also learn more about Snape, though we've barely scratched the surface with this complex character. I love Snape as a perfect example of someone who seems bad but fights for "good" - not black and white, in other words. The introduction of two other wizarding schools - Beauxbattons and Durmstrang - as well as learning about Hagrid's giantess mother, also introduced issues of race and prejudice (further from the Muggle and Mudblood prejudices) into the story, as well as some fun new characters. <br /><br />We not only get this wider scope of the wizarding world in terms of learning about other schools, we also get a more political novel - ministry officials not only make an appearance but have important roles in the plot, their "adult" politics filter into Harry's world and awareness: that awareness that adult decisions have huge impact on a child's world, their life, and that adults don't always make the right decision or know everything; that it's more than okay to question an adult. Because, just because adults are <i>adult</i>, doesn't make them irreproachable, or wise, or unquestionable. And when kids realise that, they've taken the first step into the adult world of disabused notions, unfairness, hypocrisy and ulterior motives.<br /><br />And Hermione's determination to make the school's house-elves see that they're slave labour and insist on fair wages and freedom, raises questions not only about workers' rights but also misguided assumptions and placing your own views and beliefs on others just because you're sure you're right, regardless of other "people's" culture and belief system. (Yes they are technically slave labour, but it was more interesting reading it as an analogy for colonialism and/or religious preaching/missionary work in "uncivilised" parts.)<br /><br /><br />The events in this book make it one of the more exciting ones, as well as its climactic ending, but there's still some very nice character development going on. Ron's insecurities, as coming from a large family that overshadows him, comes out again and you have to feel for him, his reaction is understandable (as someone who comes from a family of five kids, all of whom are much louder than me, I know the feeling!).<br /><br />One of the things I noticed this time 'round, knowing who the enemy at Hogwarts is (who put Harry's name in the Goblet), was how much Harry learnt off Moody, who, yes, was making sure Harry won the Tournament, but in doing so taught him much, gave him the tools or motivated Harry to get them for himself (all the hexes and jinks he learns, for instance), to battle Voldemort and defend himself. It's quite ironic really. I always felt equally betrayed by Moody/Barty Couch, because I liked him so much as Harry's teacher and mentor! The real Moody I feel you never really get to know, in comparison.<br /><br />It's funny, I've only seen the movie once too but I was surprised, when reading the book, that it's Dobby who gives Harry the gillyweed and solves that problem for him - Moody plants the information with Neville but Harry never asks around for help. In the movie, Neville does help him in this task, and I loved that. I love it when Neville gets appreciated, he's one of my favourite minor characters and more important than you ever realise. The movie did a good job in changing that around, it worked well for the screen. But I had completely forgotten that it's Dobby who helps Harry, in the book!<br /><br />Overall, the story becomes more complex and more gripping, with this fourth instalment. Things are chugging along at a fine pace, the stakes are higher than ever, Voldemort is a real threat now and the wizarding world continues to be developed and added to so that it's hard (or simply more fun) to remember that it's not real. Now I'm off to watch the movie again! :)</span>  <a data-text-id="10680145368881712517" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review6902903">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1114120196" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114120196" />    <a title="Eman" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15778576-eman"><img alt="Eman" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478757088p2/15778576.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1114120196?book_show_action=false">May 25, 2016</a>      <a title="Eman" class="user" name="Eman" href="/user/show/15778576-eman">Eman</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15778576-eman?shelf=contemporary-authors">contemporary-authors</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15778576-eman?shelf=forever-young">forever-young</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1114120196" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10609772083604214161"><b> <u>This book is on fire!</u> </b><br>I said it before and will repeat it again, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a> is beyond all praise that ever existed. When you think the HP books can't get any better, something like <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a> gets in line. I can't express enough how enjoyable it was. It's apparent how the author devotes herself to the smallest details that build up nicely to construct a seamless plot in the easiest yet most fabulous way.<br><br>The opening chapter is not about the <i>Dursleys</i> this time which is</span>  <span id="freeText10609772083604214161" style="display:none"><b>  <u>This book is on fire!</u></b><br>I said it before and will repeat it again, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a> is beyond all praise that ever existed. When you think the HP books can't get any better, something like <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a> gets in line. I can't express enough how enjoyable it was. It's apparent how the author devotes herself to the smallest details that build up nicely to construct a seamless plot in the easiest yet most fabulous way.<br><br>The opening chapter is not about the <i>Dursleys</i> this time which is surprisingly refreshing. It kicks off with a short horror story featuring <i>Lord Voldemort</i> & Co. It was a great warm-up for this looong yet addictive book. The usual recap on previous installments is there when you need to refresh your memory. <i>Harry</i> is in the midst of adolescence, so you'll notice a correlated development, character-wise, of him, <i>Ron</i>, and <i>Hermione</i>. <br><br>The storyline gets juicier, darker, and far less tweenie. There is room for giggles on many occasions (and a few tears if you're extra sensitive). This book worked its charm and casted a spell on me that attached my hands to it. There were times when I couldn't put it down! What can I say more? Pick it up if you haven't done so yet. You won't regret it no matter how old you are.<br><br>__________<br><br><b>  <u>All my HP reviews:</u></b><br>1) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114119296">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a>.<br>2) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114119668">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>.<br>3) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114119954">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>.<br>4) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114120196">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>.<br>5) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114120533">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a>.<br>6) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114120676">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a>.<br>7) <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1114120730">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a>.<br><br>__________<br><br><i>Sirius Black</i> has some golden words to say:<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445152525i/16608245._SY540_.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>__________<br><br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1508511008" />    <a title="Noa Velasco" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35767732-noa-velasco"><img alt="Noa Velasco" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460918832p2/35767732.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1508511008?book_show_action=false">Sep 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Noa Velasco" class="user" name="Noa Velasco" href="/user/show/35767732-noa-velasco">Noa Velasco</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788478886647" href="/book/show/101558.Harry_Potter_y_el_C_liz_de_Fuego">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35767732-noa-velasco?shelf=viejuvenil">viejuvenil</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35767732-noa-velasco?shelf=fantasU+00EDa-de-nivel-20">fantasU+00EDa-de-nivel-20</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1508511008" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6426294331094875503">Soy de esos lectores tardU+00EDos. Vi primero las pelis, algunas sin mucho interU+00E9s como en esta ocasiU+00F3n... <br>Y me alegro.<br><br>No recordaba prU+00E1cticamente nada de esta pelU+00EDcula, excepto que Harry tiene que tocarle los huevos a un dragU+00F3n y un final bastante intenso. AsU+00ED que ha sido estupendo porque he podido disfrutar el libro como si fuera virgen con nociones. En este caso, me quedo con el libro de calle. Hemos pasado de 350 a 650 pU+00E1ginas y se nota en la profundidad de los personajes, a aU+00F1os luz del metraje d</span>  <span id="freeText6426294331094875503" style="display:none">Soy de esos lectores tardU+00EDos. Vi primero las pelis, algunas sin mucho interU+00E9s como en esta ocasiU+00F3n... <br>Y me alegro.<br><br>No recordaba prU+00E1cticamente nada de esta pelU+00EDcula, excepto que Harry tiene que tocarle los huevos a un dragU+00F3n y un final bastante intenso. AsU+00ED que ha sido estupendo porque he podido disfrutar el libro como si fuera virgen con nociones. En este caso, me quedo con el libro de calle. Hemos pasado de 350 a 650 pU+00E1ginas y se nota en la profundidad de los personajes, a aU+00F1os luz del metraje de 2 horas y media en la que se sugiere todo y faltan innumerables detalles. <br><br>En cada tomo me reafirmo en la idea de que Rowling debiU+00F3 de pensar en esta serie como "Los tres aprendices de magos", pero en cuestiU+00F3n de mercadotecnia era mucho mU+00E1s sabio dejarlo en "Harry Potter". Y es que en las pelU+00EDculas se acusa aU+00FAn mU+00E1s la sensaciU+00F3n de que Harry es un repipiolo al que se lo tienen que dar todo hecho y que su U+00FAnica habilidad es haber nacido con estrella (o en este caso rayo). Pero es porque en el cine no hay forma de adentrarse de igual manera en su personaje y ver los hilos invisibles de la amistad que lo une no solo a sus amigos mU+00E1s U+00EDntimos, sino al entramado de personajes interesantes y carismU+00E1ticos. Harry tiene mucho de esa "potra infinita", pero no podrU+00EDa ser de otra manera ya que, en caso contrario, serU+00EDa un personaje "puto amo" con el que no se puede congeniar. Harry es un chico medio normal envuelto en una historia muy jodida y esa es su fortaleza. Y no me refiero al <i>quidditch</i>, me refiero a que no es un poderoso mago (aU+00FAn) que pueda enfrentarse con seguridad a mil peligros, sino un chaval con mU+00E1s agallas que un grindylow y unos vU+00EDnculos de amor mU+00E1s fuertes que la madre de Hagrid. Pero, en realidad, la que parte el bacalao es Hermione. Se mantiene en segundo plano pero es, para mU+00ED, la mejor. El cerebro en la sombra, jaja. <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1473681653i/20500646._SY540_.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>En resumen: lo he disfrutado mucho. Incluso las situaciones de celos, amor o relaciones entre personajes que por lo general me aburren, han sido de lo mU+00E1s entretenidas y bien ejecutadas. <br>A veces se me hacU+00EDa mU+00E1s lento porque hay mU+00E1s separaciU+00F3n entre puntos fuertes del libro, pero esa sensaciU+00F3n desaparece a las pocas pU+00E1ginas al llegar al premio. Todo era necesario para hacer de este libro una maravilla. <br><br>Edito: Me hubiese gustado ponerle 4,5 pero hay que elegir. Y para destacar los que mU+00E1s me van gustando de la serie... pues redondeo para arriba :) Porque amigos, <i>it was amazing</i>.</span>  <a data-text-id="6426294331094875503" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"            <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23004131-kayla-bookadoodles?shelf=re-reads">re-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23004131-kayla-bookadoodles?shelf=2016-favorites">2016-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23004131-kayla-bookadoodles?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1768817859" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8811017775991683333">I was so distraught after finishing this audiobook a few days ago. So many emotions...I'm pretty sure my 11-year-old self back in 2000 didn't quite comprehend the devastating events at the end of this book. And now, diving into Order of the Phoenix! </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1768817859">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1768817859" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1768817859&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1768817859'><a id="like_count_review_1768817859" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1768817859?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">10 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1768817859" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1768817859" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=10&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1768817859&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1768817859" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1768817859, true, &#39;&#39;);
