Sery-ously?" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2926860-serena-sery-ously"><img alt="Serena.. Sery-ously?" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1456926939p2/2926860.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1546834081?book_show_action=false">Apr 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Serena.. Sery-ously?" class="user" name="Serena.. Sery-ously?" href="/user/show/2926860-serena-sery-ously">Serena.. Sery-ously?</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747546245" href="/book/show/43509.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=eng-2016">eng-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=popsugar-reading-challenge-2016">popsugar-reading-challenge-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=character-alphabet-challenge-2016">character-alphabet-challenge-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=title-alphabet-challenge-2016">title-alphabet-challenge-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=the-every-year-challenge-2016">the-every-year-challenge-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=aty-reading-challenge-2016">aty-reading-challenge-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1546834081" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10838523617404678334">So, I have been listening the audiobook read by <b>Stephen Fry</b> while driving.. 15/20 minutes a day (I don't have to drive much, thanks heaven!), and it has been a long, wonderful journey! <br />Problem was, more often than not, I lingered in the car longer than it was strictly necessary, just because I NEEEDED to be told more.. So, I was there, smiling, laughing and gasping like a creepy weirdo :D <br />Plus, my stupid radio doesn't work unless the engine is running so.. Bye bye gas! But it was totally worth i</span>  <span id="freeText10838523617404678334" style="display:none">So, I have been listening the audiobook read by <b>Stephen Fry</b> while driving.. 15/20 minutes a day (I don't have to drive much, thanks heaven!), and it has been a long, wonderful journey! <br />Problem was, more often than not, I lingered in the car longer than it was strictly necessary, just because I NEEEDED to be told more.. So, I was there, smiling, laughing and gasping like a creepy weirdo :D <br />Plus, my stupid radio doesn't work unless the engine is running so.. Bye bye gas! But it was totally worth it, I swear!<br />Stephen Fry takes HP to a whole new level: never in my reader life a story has been so vivid, so powerful and so touching like this one: my hair stood up during the quidditch match, my heart stopped when Harry's name was called from the goblet of fire, I felt like throwing up waiting for the First task, I was laughing my head off when Ron and Harry made up their predictions for divination, I cried bitterly when I heard that Frank and Alice Longbottom had been tortured by the Deatheaters, I was scared to death once the passkey took us in the graveyard and yes, I cried again during Dumbledore's final speech and his <i>"Raise your glasses, to Cedric Diggory"</i>..<br /><br />I'm seriously concerned about my (in)ability to read HP on my own from now on... How could I feel The same emotions Stephen Fry gave me?<br /><br />Beware, our J.K. has given here all the clues to understand the end.. How could I <b>NOT</b> have seen them?? My Gosh, she played fair but nonetheless she managed to trick me so brilliantly!<br /><br />Ok, Now that I have paid tributes to my goddess, I do have a question that is eating me alive: why on earth the Ministry of magic didn't use the Veritaserum on every deatheater or suspected one? It would have been soooo easy! <br />(I do also have doubts about the passkey bringing back Harry to Hogwarts, but whatever, I'm too much in love with Magic Rowling to let her down with my silly-nilly questions :D)<br /><br /><i>'Severus,' said Dumbledore, turning to Snape, 'you know what I must ask you to do. <b>If you are ready... If you are prepared...</b>'<br />'<b>I am</b>,' said Snape.<br />He looked slightly paler than usual, and his cold, black eyes glittered strangely.</i><br /><b>Oh, Severus. I'm already crying my heart out for you U+2665</b><br /><br />My Gosh, I read this book for the first time when I was 11. I'm now 26. What a wonderful faithful friend, you have been!</span>  <a data-text-id="10838523617404678334" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/912814682" />    <a title="Alice" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30624122-alice"><img alt="Alice" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460366563p2/30624122.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/912814682?book_show_action=false">Jan 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Alice" class="user" name="Alice" href="/user/show/30624122-alice">Alice</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30624122-alice?shelf=favorites-re-read-soon">favorites-re-read-soon</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer912814682" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1719164496843362713">Re-read 2014<br />#HarryChristmastoyou (even though it's over)<br /><br />I was going kind of slow, because i wasn't reading much because of the holydays, christmas excetera... so i picked up the audiobook read by Stephen Fry and it was AMAZING. I think i will focus on the audiobook here, because well... everyone knows how the book is, isn't it? <br />I love the different tone of voices he used for the different characters, and overall it was great to hear a british voice... because, alas, i'm italian, my english even</span>  <span id="freeText1719164496843362713" style="display:none">Re-read 2014<br />#HarryChristmastoyou (even though it's over)<br /><br />I was going kind of slow, because i wasn't reading much because of the holydays, christmas excetera... so i picked up the audiobook read by Stephen Fry and it was AMAZING. I think i will focus on the audiobook here, because well... everyone knows how the book is, isn't it? <br />I love the different tone of voices he used for the different characters, and overall it was great to hear a british voice... because, alas, i'm italian, my english even when I read tends to kind of have an american accent to it (no, i don't have an italian accent when i speak english, at least i think so, and when i read my english is better)<br />Anyway, i loved the book, i loved reading it while listening to the audiobook, and i will probably do it for the other books as well... if i will continue with the re-read...<br /><br />#HarryXmasToYou 2015<br />I FOUND A MISTAKE in the continuity of the story WHOP WHOP. no ok. It's kind of spoilery for the order of the phoenix and the end of the book so... <br />In the last chapter, they are leaving hogwarts and the horseless carriages are mentioned... but by then Harry is supposedly able to see the testrals already, since the whole Cedric thing. Maybe she (the author) added the Testrals and who can see them and who can't in the order of the phoenix just to add to Harry frustration and kind of enphasize the situation even more...<br /><br />nothing to take away from the continuity of the story, because in the rereads you are going to find all the clues j.k. rowling left for what was about to happen.. in fact my status update at 89% was:<br />>"You have been taugh how to duel. Harry Potter" [...]<br />At these words Harry remembered [...] the dueling club at hogwarts [...]... All he had learned there was the disarming spell, EXPELLIARMUS, and what use would it be [...]?<br />ARE WE SERIOUSLY GOING THERE J.K. ROWLING? REALLY? did you anticipate it all along?<<br /><br />So that's a BIG clue that will have a part in deathly hallows, so many hints, so many references to characters who are going to pop up only in later books, Luna Lovegood and her father, Mundungus, Arabella Fig mentioned by Dumbledore... but the Testrals got past J.K Rowling and she slipped.</span>  <a data-text-id="1719164496843362713" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1405698213" />    <a title="Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee"><img alt="Mikee Andrea title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855928" href="/book/show/22037439-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" id="reviewTextContainer1405698213" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14897995956758819911">Rating: {}<br /><br /><b>THIS BOOK GUYS. THIS BOOK.</b><br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire has <b> <i>ALWAYS</i> </b> been my favorite Harry Potter movie of all time and I can finally say with great ease that Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is also my <b> <u>FAVORITE HARRY POTTER BOOK OF ALL TIME.</u> </b><br /><br />I don't even know where to start! This book was just absolutely <b> <i>MAGNIFICENT</i> </b> beyond words.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> the Quidditch World Cup.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> that we got to see a few of the other Wizarding schools.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> the Triwizard Tournament.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> the Yule</span>  <span id="freeText14897995956758819911" style="display:none">Rating: {U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605}<br /><br /><b>THIS BOOK GUYS. THIS BOOK.</b><br /><br />Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire has <b>  <i>ALWAYS</i></b> been my favorite Harry Potter movie of all time and I can finally say with great ease that Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is also my <b>  <u>FAVORITE HARRY POTTER BOOK OF ALL TIME.</u></b><br /><br />I don't even know where to start! This book was just absolutely <b>  <i>MAGNIFICENT</i></b> beyond words.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> the Quidditch World Cup.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> that we got to see a few of the other Wizarding schools.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> the Triwizard Tournament.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> the Yule Ball.<br /><br />I <b>LOVED</b> all Three Tasks.<br /><br />And oh my poor <b>  <i>Cedric Diggory.</i></b> My heart breaks every time I watch the movie and it broke even more actually reading it in words.<br /><br />This book truly is the turning point of Harry Potter for me. This is where we realize, <b>  <i>"Wow. This is real. Voldemort is real. People are going to die however this ends."</i></b><br /><br />I have no words to describe my newfound love for the Harry Potter series ever since I decided to read the books for the first time. Sure there are many changes made in the movies, especially in the Goblet of Fire, but the books and the movie are great all on their own. I learned so many things in the short time that I decided to read this series that <b>  <u>I never could've possibly learned by just watching the movies.</u></b> I'll always be blown away by the fact that the Wizarding World is just so vast that there will always be something new to learn and I'll keep being reminded of that whenever I start the next book in this glorious series.</span>  <a data-text-id="14897995956758819911" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1405698213">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1405698213" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1405698213&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1405698213'><a id="like_count_review_1405698213" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1405698213?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">84 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1405698213" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1405698213" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=84&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1405698213&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1405698213" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1405698213, true, &#39;&#39;); class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/152572639" />    <a title="Meli" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5087694-meli"><img alt="Meli" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1299464046p2/5087694.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/152572639?book_show_action=false">Mar 12, 2013</a>      <a title="Meli" class="user" name="Meli" href="/user/show/5087694-meli">Meli</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5087694-meli?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer152572639" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3733926109035157763">Este siempre fue mi libro favorito de la saga, U+00A1tantos escenarios, tantos personajes nuevos, tanta acciU+00F3n y tanta tensiU+00F3n!<br>Es la primera vez que lo releo despuU+00E9s de haber terminado la saga, y fue una experiencia mezcla de emocionante y destructiva. LlorU+00E9 con cosas con las que no deberU+00EDa haber llorado, todo me pareciU+00F3 mU+00E1s sentido y profundo, vi cosas que -incluso habiU+00E9ndolo leU+00EDdo varias veces antes- no habU+00EDa visto.<br><br>Me encanta, releerU+00EDa esta saga por siempre (y no dudo que asU+00ED va a hacer), y me dejU+00F3</span>  <span id="freeText3733926109035157763" style="display:none">Este siempre fue mi libro favorito de la saga, U+00A1tantos escenarios, tantos personajes nuevos, tanta acciU+00F3n y tanta tensiU+00F3n!<br>Es la primera vez que lo releo despuU+00E9s de haber terminado la saga, y fue una experiencia mezcla de emocionante y destructiva. LlorU+00E9 con cosas con las que no deberU+00EDa haber llorado, todo me pareciU+00F3 mU+00E1s sentido y profundo, vi cosas que -incluso habiU+00E9ndolo leU+00EDdo varias veces antes- no habU+00EDa visto.<br><br>Me encanta, releerU+00EDa esta saga por siempre (y no dudo que asU+00ED va a hacer), y me dejU+00F3 con toda la nostalgia y el aU+00F1oro mU+00E1gico que solo los libros de Harry son capaces de transmitirme.<br><br>Por U+00FAltimo, a pesar de saber mU+00E1s que de memoria que iba a pasar, la escena del cementerio, la del priori incantatem, me sigue dando taquicardia y matU+00E1ndome de los nervios.<br><br>ReleU+00ED este libro para el desafU+00EDo Back to Hogwarts <3<br>Todos, hayan leU+00EDdo o no la saga, estU+00E1n invitados a participar<br><br><a href="http://leyendo-vuelo.blogspot.com/2012/04/desafio-back-to-hogwarts.html?showComment=1335316081067#c3715704178100424468" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380346596i/700991.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="3733926109035157763" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review152572639">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link152572639" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=152572639&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_152572639'><a id="like_count_review_152572639" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/152572639?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_152572639" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_152572639" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=152572639&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_152572639" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 152572639, true, &#39;&#39;); I loved how the author established the environment in the first book, and I absolutely enjoyed how she established the characters of the story in the second and third books.<br /><br />But this one is just different, this one showed me the brilliance of Rowling. I absolutely loved how she utilized everything she established previously, and at the same time introduced many new characters, and in the process, crea</span>  <span id="freeText17454696169574158097" style="display:none">This book, in my opinion, is, without a shadow of a doubt, the best one of the first four books. I loved how the author established the environment in the first book, and I absolutely enjoyed how she established the characters of the story in the second and third books.<br /><br />But this one is just different, this one showed me the brilliance of Rowling. I absolutely loved how she utilized everything she established previously, and at the same time introduced many new characters, and in the process, created a brilliant story. Even though the author didn't spend that much time to revisit some of the details and to stress on some of the attribute of some of the old characters, this book was actually longer than the previous books. The author perfectly utilized everything she introduced in the first three books to create a perfect story with a perfect plot.<br /><br />I absolutely loved how she planted many riddles here and there and finally solved everything in one mind-blowing chapter.<br /><br />As ridiculous as this might sound, for the fact that this is a fantasy book, every single thing made sense.<br /><br />Again, I'm really happy I decided to read the books!</span>  <a data-text-id="17454696169574158097" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_47441495" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/47441495" />    <a title="Alex Ristea" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1669785-alex-ristea"><img alt="Alex Ristea" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1413575351p2/1669785.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/47441495?book_show_action=false">Oct 15, 2014</a>      <a title="Alex Ristea" class="user" name="Alex Ristea" href="/user/show/1669785-alex-ristea">Alex Ristea</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781551923376" href="/book/show/532846.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1669785-alex-ristea?shelf=library">library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1669785-alex-ristea?shelf=hardcover">hardcover</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1669785-alex-ristea?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1669785-alex-ristea?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer47441495" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1109605958831257740">Perhaps I'm getting burnt out by reading these so quickly (or perhaps it's because I finished this book in a fever-addled state), but I didn't enjoy this as much as I should have.<br /><br /><i>The Goblet of Fire</i> was easily my favourite book as a kid. It was when I hit peak Harry Potter fandom, and I probably re-read it dozens of times (just this book alone, not the whole series). By the time <i>Order of the Phoenix</i> came out, I was still a fan, but not as crazy about it.<br /><br />Long story short, I used to love <i>Goblet of</i></span>  <span id="freeText1109605958831257740" style="display:none">Perhaps I'm getting burnt out by reading these so quickly (or perhaps it's because I finished this book in a fever-addled state), but I didn't enjoy this as much as I should have.<br /><br /><i>The Goblet of Fire</i> was easily my favourite book as a kid. It was when I hit peak Harry Potter fandom, and I probably re-read it dozens of times (just this book alone, not the whole series). By the time <i>Order of the Phoenix</i> came out, I was still a fan, but not as crazy about it.<br /><br />Long story short, I used to love <i>Goblet of Fire</i>, and now coming back and reading it as an adult, I fear I may have ruined the magic.<br /><br />Those tight scenes and that pace I admired so much in the first few books is gone. To be fair, this book reads like most fantasy novels I enjoy...but I had come to expect an economy of prose from Rowling and it was a bit of a shock to see how this one meandered.<br /><br />Anyway, I'm going to continue with the series, but I'm already starting to feel that this might be my last re-read ever.</span>  <a data-text-id="1109605958831257740" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review47441495">  <td itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1483078532" />    <a title="~U+2665~ happinesslife" class="left imgcol" class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1483078532?book_show_action=false">Dec 28, 2015</a>      <a title="~U+2665~ Rowling, estoy totalmente enganchada a esta saga. href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1351360141" />    <a title="Drew The Reviewer" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25599529-drew-the-reviewer"><img alt="Drew The Reviewer" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1351360141?book_show_action=false">Nov 19, 2015</a>      <a title="Drew The Reviewer" class="user" name="Drew The Reviewer" href="/user/show/25599529-drew-the-reviewer">Drew The Reviewer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1351360141" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10766710569462596209">*RE-READ*<br /><br />The Goblet Of Fire is a huge game changer for this series. With the return of Lord Voldemort, everything has drastically changed. This will always be one of my favorite books. I love the idea of The Triwizard Tournament and it is so entertaining to read. The graveyard scene with Harry and Voldemort is the best part of this whole book. I just love everything about The Goblet Of Fire. It is so unique and there is so much world/character development in this installment.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16419460112541242492">Another Harry Potter, another 5*. I did not remembered a lot about this book, only a certain someone dying and something under water. So, it felt like a new read to me, and I highly enjoyed reading this. I did not like how the ending was written <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[with the bad guy just telling everything, that felt like an easy option <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>, but I still liked the story a lot. Was very late with reading my september Harry (whoops), wil start my october one sooner ;)</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1340045984" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4820125550748291824">One of the biggest regrets I have in my life was not reading the series sooner. I am in absolute awe, what a drastic improvement from book three to four. If thought the world was marvelous at first, that's nothing compared to now. I am a bit frustrated with a particular character (Fudge @!#$) but I'm excited to see where it'll go.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33039359-liliana?shelf=kindle">kindle</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1503545954" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer474984949801941659">Wonderful. I really, really loved it. There was pretty much intrigue, tension, the first shoots of romance, anguish. Characters and environments are beautifully detailed. It was really a pleasure. This is my first time reading Harry Potter (I haven't seen the movies) so I'm enjoying this pretty much. The story is just getting better and better. U+2665</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1503545954">  <td itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1521289566?book_show_action=false">Feb 10, 2016</a>      <a title="Erika" class="user" name="Erika" href="/user/show/4545375-erika">Erika</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Audible Audio " href="/book/show/27876157-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4545375-erika?shelf=childrens-middle-grades">childrens-middle-grades</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4545375-erika?shelf=21st-century">21st-century</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4545375-erika?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4545375-erika?shelf=ladies">ladies</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4545375-erika?shelf=own-audiobook">own-audiobook</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4545375-erika?shelf=read2016">read2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1521289566" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14035626588539000710">I think this may be my favorite book in the series. Contrary to popular belief, I feel like this book, and not Prisoner of Azkaban, is when the trio really starts to face the realities of the difficult future that lay ahead of them. It was just as kickass the 20th time around,.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1521289566">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1521289566" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1521289566&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1521289566'><a id="like_count_review_1521289566" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1521289566?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1521289566" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1521289566" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1521289566&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1521289566" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1521289566, true, &#39;&#39;); elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1368590918" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1368590918" />    <a title="I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth"><img alt="I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467608785p2/30704264.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1368590918?book_show_action=false">Aug 20, 2015</a>      <a title="I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth" class="user" name="I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth" href="/user/show/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth">I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth?shelf=middle-grade-chapter-books">middle-grade-chapter-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1368590918" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2360075255962381804">Even though IU+2019m a contributor to a comics media outlet, I have to sheepishly admit, I donU+2019t get all obsessive with details about comic book storylines U+2014 I reserve all that fervor for Harry Potter. This is my 4th reread of the series but thereU+2019s always some kind of new detail I notice every timeU+2026....<br /><br />**If you have not read this book yet there are spoilers below.**<br /><blockquote><b>(1) No punishment from the Ministry of Magic for Harry:</b> Oh how this discrepancy bothers me so much! And this won't be the first time tha</blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText2360075255962381804" style="display:none">Even though IU+2019m a contributor to a comics media outlet, I have to sheepishly admit, I donU+2019t get all obsessive with details about comic book storylines U+2014 I reserve all that fervor for Harry Potter. This is my 4th reread of the series but thereU+2019s always some kind of new detail I notice every timeU+2026....<br /><br />**If you have not read this book yet there are spoilers below.**<br /><blockquote><b>(1) No punishment from the Ministry of Magic for Harry:</b> Oh how this discrepancy bothers me so much! And this won't be the first time that Harry won't receive disciplinary action from the Ministry -- this issue will come up again in <i>Half-Blood Prince</i>. ANYWAY. Mr. Weasley majorly bends the rules and gets the Dursley's fireplace connected to the Floo Network so the Weasley's can pick Harry up two weeks before the term starts -- roadtrip to the Quidditch World Cup! However, Mr. Weasley doesn't know that previously, in Sorcerer's Stone, Mr. Dursley boarded up the fireplace. So when the Mr. Weasley, the twins, and Ron show up, they can't simply step out of the fireplace. What are they to do? No worries, it's nothing that Mr. Weasley and his wand can't fix! He just blasts all the wood out of the way! (Magic!)<br /><br />Then one of the twins drops a Ton-Tongue Toffee which Dudley scoops up and eats -- Dudley's tongue swells up and becomes many feet long. ACK! No worries, it's nothing that Mr. Weasley and his wand can't fix! (Magic again!)<br /><br />I HEART the Harry Potter stories so much but it REALLY bothers me Rowling is not following her own rules that she established during her earlier world-building. I certainly don't want Harry suspended or expelled from Hogwarts, but Harry most certainly SHOULD HAVE received some kind of official warning (or punishment) from the Ministry of Magic. It's already been established (<i>Chamber of Secrets</i>) that it doesn't matter that Harry didn't do the magic himself. What matters is that magic was done in Harry's home (a Muggle home) and magic isn't supposed to be done outside of school.<br /><br />For some background info: Harry got the first official warning from the Ministry when Dobby (the Malfoy's now former house-elf) used magic to drop the pudding on top of the Dursley's guest (<i>Chamber of Secrets</i>). However, Harry did not get a second warning in <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> when, in anger, he "inflated" Aunt Marge and then ran away, and later boarded the Knight Bus. I'm TOTALLY OKAY with Harry NOT getting that second warning (or punishment) from the Ministry of Magic because Minister Cornelius Fudge meets up with Harry at the Leaky Cauldron and explains things a bit (and why Harry won't be getting punished).<br /><br />But the lack of a warning from the Ministry of Magic to Harry for this "magical" incident involving the Weasley's does indeed bother me.<br /><br />(Plus, goodness, with all that blasting and Aunt Petunia screaming, it's a wonder how much of all that racket the Dursley's neighbors overheard and how they are going to explain those noises away. They crave normalcy and certainly do not want their neighbors to know there is any magic hanky-panky going on under their roof.)<br /><br /><b>(2) Camping Muggle style:</b> Okay, so the camping tent has a kitchen AND bathroom inside yet Mr. Weasley asks Harry, Ron, and Hermione to go fetch some water. Um, okay. I guess by fetching water the trio were able to WALK through the campsite and SEE stuff and HEAR stuff and INTERACT with people -- but really, I think it would have just been better for them to just go walk around and explore, the pretense of needing water seems a bit silly.<br /><br />And does it really take one hour for a campfire to get hot enough to brew up some tea and cook some sausages?<br /><br /><b>(3) Muggle attire:</b> I am a bit baffled that some witches and wizards simply cannot dress like a proper Muggle and put the oddest garments together to make an outfit. I think Rowling does this more to just show the HUGE segregation (or cultural gap) between the Wizarding World and the Muggle World. But, still, you'd think that witches and wizards wear something under their robes besides undergarments (do they?!?!) and would maybe be able to throw some kind of competent look/outfit together.<br /><br /><b>(4) A very wet Welcome Back Feast:</b> The Weasleys, Harry, and Hermione get rained on on the way to the King's Cross Station. Then the students get rained on again when they arrive at Hogwarts. And to top it off, Peeves was throwing water balloons at students in the Great Hall. So it goes without saying that the students are very, very wet for the Sorting Ceremony (either as participants or observers) and for the Welcome Back Feast.<br /><br />Why didn't Professor McGonagall (or anyone else) perform the "hot-air" charm on the students? Both Hermione (<i>Order of the Phoenix</i>) and Dumbledore (<i>Half-Blood Prince</i>) preform this charm. But even without knowing this "hot-air" spell exists, it makes sense to think that such a spell would exist and wonder why the students didn't get "dried-off" before the feast begins. Although the students seemingly don't complain about being wet or miserable, and no one mentions catching a cold, it does seems likely that all that dampness would put a damper on the enjoyment of the festivities. Although, Dennis, Collin Creevy's brother, certainly was having a blast despite falling into the lake!<br /><br /><b>(5) The Weighing of the Wands:</b> Is it just me, or shouldn't this "ceremony" have been a bit more serious? It's very cool that Mr. Ollivander, the wand maker, examined the wands and described them. But the one spell he did with each of the four champions' wands seemed a bit silly. Shouldn't he have been more concerned to make sure the wands were in tip top shape and functioning properly? That the wands weren't tampered with -- as in somehow given "extra powers" that the wand shouldn't have? (Note: I don't know if it's possible to "give" a wand "extra power" but it's something to think about...)<br /><br /><b>(6) Professor Trelawney's Divination Class:</b> It's obvious that Harry and Ron don't have much respect for Professor Trelawney -- they joke between themselves in class, don't take the assignments seriously, and, even occasionally, get cheeky with her. Like with Hermione, I'm surprised Trelawney hasn't handed out detentions to Harry and Ron. But I'm also curious as to why both continue to take Trelawney's class when they don't like it -- they do have other course options. (I know they both stay enrolled because Trelawney is needed for some of the plot points/twists.)<br /><br /><b>(7) Finding Hogwarts:</b> If Hogwarts is supposed to be unplottable on maps, secretly hidden, etc..... then how did Headmistress Madame Olympe Maxime and her students from Beauxbatons as well as Headmaster Igor Karkaroff and his students from Durmstrang find Hogwarts? (And the champions' families who get to come watch the Third Event?)<br /><br /><b>(8) Beauxbatons and Durmstrang students:</b> Maxime and Karkaroff bring only a select group of students (possibly a dozen each) from their respective schools for the opportunity to have the Goblet of Fire select one of them to be their school champion at the TriWizard Tournament.<br /><br />But what do these "foreign" students do while at Hogwarts? I've gotten the impression that the Beaxbatons and Durmstrang students remain at Hogwarts for the entire duration of the TriWizard Tournament -- there is no mention of them leaving and coming back between events. I am basing my assumption that the students, Maxime, and Karkaroff hang around on three incidents:<br /><blockquote><b>Incident #1:</b> Between the announcement of the Tournament and the announcement of the Yule Ball, Harry, Ron, and Hermione frequently see Victor Krum in the library. We later learn that Krum had been skulking around in the hopes of getting Hermione by herself so he could ask her to the Yule Ball.<br /><br /><b>Incident #2:</b> Padma Patil (Harry's date from the Yule Ball) mentions that one of the boys from Beauxbaton is meeting her during the next Hogsmeade visit. (As a side note, Hogwarts must be in close proximity to Hogsmeade since the students all walk there.)<br /><br /><b>Incident #3:</b> Karkaroff interupts the Gryffindor-Slytherin Potions Class to talk to Snape.</blockquote><br />So if Maxime's and Karkaroff's students are sticking around, what do they do while the Hogwarts students are in class? There is no mention of these students "sitting in on" classes with the Hogwarts students. How are these students continuing their magical education?<br /><br />And getting back to the TriWizard Tournament, for the third event, the families of the champions get to come visit and watch the last event. Prior to this, there is no mention of any other special guests watching the first and second event. The TriWizard Tournament seems like a pretty big deal, so it's a bummer that it seems that only the students and staff from the school hosting the Tournament are able to watch it -- bummer for the students (and staff) from the other two schools who are seemingly missing out. How odd they can't be there in person to root on their own school champion.<br /><br />(As a side note, there is mention of Beauxbaton students (specifically boys) that attended the Yule Ball. It is not known if these students made up part of the small group that Maxime selected herself to bring to the Goblet of Fire ceremony or if they were students that were "left behind" but came to visit.)<br /><br /><b>(9) The Dark Mark Tattoo:</b> For those of us who have already read this book, we know earlier on that Karkaroff is alluding to the Dark Mark Tattoo on his arm when he is talking to Snape. We can assume Snape has one too (at one point in <i>Goblet of Fire</i> Snape grabs his own forearm in response to something that Moody says and later we know for sure when Snape shows his mark to the Minister of Magic, Fudge.) Yet Sirius says (page 530) that "...Snape was never even accused of being a Death Eater..." and that Snape is "...clever and cunning enough to keep himself out of trouble."<br /><br />But now knowing that these "I-Support-The-Dark-Lord" tattoos exist, it seems like it would be easy for the Ministry of Magic to find Death Eaters -- they'd just need to check someone's forearm. However, Karkaroff mentions the mark is getting darker, so at one point it seems the tatttoos had faded -- maybe the marks vanished completely after Voldemort lost his powers when he attempted to kill Harry as a baby? Then maybe each Death Eaters forearm would look like it was never tattooed at all? If so, then that certainly would make it difficult for the Ministry of Magic to identify Death Eaters.<br /><br /><b>(10) The Pensieve:</b> I've always wondered if someone could get "stuck" or "trapped" in the Pensieve (or in the memory itself) as an observer. That would be beyond surreal and bizarre. This won't be the first time that Harry just dives into a Pensieve uninvited -- Harry will do this later with Snape's Pensieve in <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> -- and then is later retrieved. Before Harry "dove" into the Pensieve he was able to see into the memory realm below -- so it is highly likely that Dumbledore (and Snape) could look into their own Pensieve and see Harry in the memory. BUT..... What if the Pensieve owner chooses not to retrieve Harry? Would Harry have been stuck or trapped in that memory or does the Pensieve have some kind of built-in mechanism that spits a person(s) back out when the memory has finished "playing"?<br /><br /><b>(11) Mrs. Figg:</b> Dumbledore tasks Sirius with spreading the news about Voldemort's return to Remus Lupin, Arabella Figg, and Mundungus Fletcher. The surname Figg sounds familiar because Mrs. Figg (in Order of the Phoenix we learn she's a Squib) is one of the Dursley's neighbors and she has "babysat" Harry before in her home. Perhaps due to Harry current exhausted and emotional state, Harry's ears didn't perk-up at the sound of Mrs. Figg's name -- plus there's a chance that he didn't even know that Arabella was her first name and/or there's the chance that Figg could be a common surname in the Wizarding World.<br /><br /><b>(12) The horseless carriages:</b> Since Sorcerer's Stone, the horseless carriages have been transporting Hogwarts students to and from Hogsmeade Station. We learn in Order of the Phoenix that the horseless carriages aren't really horseless -- they are driven by Thestrals. Thestrals are magical creatures that can only be seen by those who have witnessed a death. It's a bit odd that Harry doesn't see them at the end of <i>Goblet of Fire</i> since he was present when Cedric Diggory died. And let's not forget, Harry's mother died protecting him, although I'm not sure if Harry actually witnessed that.</blockquote>Even though <b>(1)</b> and <b>(8)</b> are more like pet-peeves than analysis, <i>Goblet of Fire</i> is still a major wow of a story. It's just so amazing. So many sub-plots. More back-story. It's just brilliant. And even though I already knew about one of the major plot twists -- this is a re-read afterall -- it's still such an engrossing, turn-paging read. I still get caught up in everything. Onto book five, <i>Order of the Phoenix</i>!<br /><br /><i>Goblet of Fire</i> was re-read from August 5, 2015 - Augst 19, 2015<br />(posted 8-19-2015, minor edits made 8-20-2015)<br /><b>all my reviews can be found at <a target="_blank" href="http://www.isniffbooks.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow">www.isniffbooks.wordpress.com</a></b></span>  <a data-text-id="2360075255962381804" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1586526317" />    <a title="Mara" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/48556053-mara"><img alt="Mara"    <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1155215447276671775">Mrzela sam ovaj film, ali je knjiga neU+0161to sasvim drugo. id='like_container_review_1586526317'><a id="like_count_review_1586526317" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1586526317?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1586526317" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1586526317" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1586526317?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=9">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1586526317' style='display: elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1371187173" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1371187173" />    <a title="Fatima  Havilliard" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36812736-fatima-havilliard"><img alt="Fatima  Havilliard" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1951270" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1951270" />    <a title="Namratha" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/114559-namratha"><img alt="Namratha" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1406702134p2/114559.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1951270?book_show_action=false">Apr 20, 2013</a>      <a title="Namratha" class="user" name="Namratha" href="/user/show/114559-namratha">Namratha</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747546245" href="/book/show/43509.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=urban-fantasy">urban-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=childrens-fantasy">childrens-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=ya-lit">ya-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=books-i-love">books-i-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=pottermania">pottermania</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1951270" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17815103262735412162"><a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1201607/" rel="nofollow"> <b>Harry Potter and The Deathly Hallows U+2013 Part 2</b> </a> releases on July 15U+2019 2011. And with it, ends one of the grandest obsessions of our times. <br />No, IU+2019m not mocking it. Far from it. I am an unabashed member of the Potter Brigade. I have read the entire series more times than I can count. I have caught the movies when they hit the theatres (<i>and cribbed about the disparities in plot</i>). I have scoured through exquisite FanArt and imaginative FanFiction. I have followed the wise homilies of the great <b>Dumble</b></span>  <span id="freeText17815103262735412162" style="display:none"><a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1201607/" rel="nofollow">  <b>Harry Potter and The Deathly Hallows U+2013 Part 2</b></a> releases on July 15U+2019 2011. And with it, ends one of the grandest obsessions of our times. <br />No, IU+2019m not mocking it. Far from it. I am an unabashed member of the Potter Brigade. I have read the entire series more times than I can count. I have caught the movies when they hit the theatres (<i>and cribbed about the disparities in plot</i>). I have scoured through exquisite FanArt and imaginative FanFiction. I have followed the wise homilies of the great <b>Dumbledore</b> and treated him as my Spiritual Guru. I have rooted for <b>Hermione</b> and <b>Ron</b>U+2019s <i>almost-there-but-not-quite-yet</i> love story. I have lusted after <b>Sirius</b> and loathed Umbridge, both in equal measures. I have attempted to make ButterBeer (<i>and succeeded</i>). I have done a spot of wishful thinking and hoped that Hogwarts has misplaced my letter (<i>well, not really...but yes</i>). <br />And yes.............I have stuck with <b>Harry</b> till the very end.<br /><br />So obviously, with the end in sight, I HAD to reread the series. And when I reached <u>  <b>Harry Potter and The Goblet of Fire</b></u>, I realized that alas....alackk....and also, erlack....I had not written a review on it. *<i>  <b>shock</b></i>* *<i>  <b>horror</b></i>* *<i>  <b>convincing Victorian swoon</b></i>*. <br /><br />Soon I recovered from the fiendish blow and penned down a wholly biased review. <br />Here goes:<br /><br />-------------------------------------<br />The Quidditch World Cup followed by The Triwizard Tournament form the backdrop for the fourth instalment. As The Quidditch Finals culminate in the sudden appearance of the <b>DARK MARK</b>, a wave of panic spreads through the Wizarding world. The Dark Mark is the sign of <a href="http://harrypotter.wikia.com/wiki/Voldemort" rel="nofollow">  <b>U+2018He-Who-Must-Not-Be-NamedU+2019</b></a>; a mark that heralds the return of pure, undiluted evil. <br />Our wee Potter isnU+2019t feeling too uppity either. The scar on his forehead has been ailing him; another indication that olU+2019Voldy is either very near of is feeling particularly murderous. Sirius (in hiding) is worried and sends comforting owl mails at regular intervals. Hermione is worried and races to the library at regular intervals. Ron is worried and turns an unbecoming shade of red at regular intervals.<br /><br />So when Harry is chosen by the magical <b>Goblet of Fire</b> as one of the contenders for The Triwizard Tournament, itU+2019s only natural that everyone starts having kittens; left, right and center. The tournament which claims to be an attempt to improve relationships in the Wizarding Community is no game of pin-the-tail-on-the-donkey. Past history reveals that the tasks are dangerous and injurious to health in every sense of the word.<br /><br />Soon, Harry is battling dragons, merpeople, unexpected jinxes, hexes and the odd Blast-Ended Skrewt. But itU+2019s the end that decides it all. In a startling twist, Harry will soon face a task that will make The Hungarian Horntail Dragon seem like a mild-mannered lapdog. <br />-------------------------------------<br /><br /><u>  <b>Harry Potter and The Goblet of Fire</b></u> can adequately be summed up in one word : DRAMATIC.<br /><br />Whether itU+2019s the sporting fervour whipped up at The Quidditch World Cup or the wave of excitement and danger that holds together at The Triwizard Tournament, <a href="http://harrypotter.wikia.com/wiki/J.K._Rowling" rel="nofollow">J.K.Rowling</a> is the Mother Monster of Event-Managers. A host of enticing new characters make their entry : Cedric Diggory, Mad-Eye Moody, Barty Crouch (Sr. & Jr.), Ludo Bagman, Madame Maxime, Viktor Krum, Karkaroff, Rita Skeeter and.....The Dark Lord himself. <br /><br />Despite being a fairly heavy book, the pace never wanes. One endearing quality of RowlingU+2019s writing is that no fact or seemingly odd bit of trivia is ever merely that. Somewhere, somehow, she will dip into her own personal Pensieve, extract the minuscule detail and entwine it with the plot. So while reading her books, remember to be in a state of (<i>as Mad-Eye Moody would term it</i>) U+201CCONSTANT VIGILANCEU+201D.<br /><br />The fledgling romances serve as endearing sub plots: Harry and Cho, Ron and Hermione and Krum and ofcourse, Hagrid and Madame Maxime. Snape continues his reign of unabated nastiness. Malfoy is his usual charming self. Cedric (the future Mr.Edward Cullen) is a wholly likeable character who stays with you till the end. Dumbledore is pitching his perfect performance as usual : whether itU+2019s turning a blind eye to the never ending pranks, or giving a fair listening to an improbable tale or doling out wisdom in his unique way or standing tall, eyes ablaze in the face of dark times.<br /><br />Tight storyline, shocking twists and throat-clogging moments. In all, a magnificent read. </span>  <a data-text-id="17815103262735412162" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23841736-sarah-anne?shelf=hugo">hugo</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer894243009" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14407074730553552562">3.5 stars. I feel like this almost has a middle book feel, like we're getting a lot of dead space to set up the future story. What does happen in this book is interesting but there's not 700 pages worth of stuff happening.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review894243009">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link894243009"  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1500503987" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1500503987" />    <a title="Caidyn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn"><img alt="Caidyn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477630172p2/13614926.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1500503987?book_show_action=false">Jun 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Caidyn" class="user" name="Caidyn" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn">Caidyn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=juvenile-fiction">juvenile-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=fantasy-scifi">fantasy-scifi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=harry-potter-5ever">harry-potter-5ever</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1500503987" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10816767593460051034">You know what the worst thing is? When you really want to make a profound statement and can't think of the words to articulate it.<br /><br />Therefore... <b>Welcome to another rambling review!</b><br /><br />The first major thing that I really want to hash out is how I conceptualize the books. It's a bit odd, I will admit. I see the first three books, Sorcerer's Stone through Prisoner of Azkaban, as their own trilogy. I mean, it's not that hard to see. All of them are very light and while they deal with heavy themes -- death</span>  <span id="freeText10816767593460051034" style="display:none">You know what the worst thing is? When you really want to make a profound statement and can't think of the words to articulate it.<br /><br />Therefore... <b>Welcome to another rambling review!</b><br /><br />The first major thing that I really want to hash out is how I conceptualize the books. It's a bit odd, I will admit. I see the first three books, Sorcerer's Stone through Prisoner of Azkaban, as their own trilogy. I mean, it's not that hard to see. All of them are very light and while they deal with heavy themes -- death, loyalty and betrayal, etc -- they don't delve deep into them. Because, Harry's a child and, more importantly, he hasn't gone through any specific trauma that has completely scarred him. He can't remember his parents dying and he recovers well after each adventure.<br /><br />Then, the last three books -- Order of the Phoenix through Deathly Hallows -- are also a trilogy to me. They deal with the darker themes, exploring them. Death and grief, losing someone, persecution, PTSD, etc. Those books explore the themes that were set up very well in the first three books, just not as in depth.<br /><br />So, for me, this book is a stand alone, almost. Yes, it's connected to the whole series. Of course it is. Yet... it isn't. It's not a part of the first three and it's not a part of the last three. It serves as a bridge, tying in things from the first trilogy and bringing it to a place where we can start exploring the darker themes together. That's how I've seen this book for ages, and I couldn't put my finger on why until a couple years ago.<br /><br />Now, this book was my favorite for a long time. Half-Blood Prince has replaced it, so this has to be my second favorite in the series. Five and seven tie for third, then the last three are lumped together for fourth place. (I love them, and they never fail to make me smile when I need a pick me up, but all of my favorite books deal with really heavy themes in depth.)<br /><br />Also, this was the last book in this series -- and in general, come to think of it -- that my mom read to me. Since I was four when this book came out, I wasn't reading it on my own. Sorry guys, but I was not a prodigy. The only memory I have of reading this book is this:<br /><br />Basically, I had an alarm clock in my room. I had been waking up on my own (like a big kid!) since I was in first grade, but my mom would come in my room and she would read a chapter or so of a book to me while I was waking up. I know, I had the best mom ever. Anyways, she must have read the chapter when Harry was with the Death Eaters. I must have been in third grade, or a couple years before the movie came out. So, she read that chapter to me, I bounded aboard the bus after eating breakfast, sat with my little friends, and told them the story of what Harry got up to that day.<br /><br /><s>Let's not forget that I would play Harry Potter until I was in fourth or fifth grade in recess.</s><br /><br />#noregrets<br /><br />Also, since I'm reading this series specifically this time to catch all the little instances that Dumbledore says or does something since I headcanon that he knows all along basically everything that goes down, and that everything he allows happen is a test to see if Harry's ready, I'll add this. <b>Each book I read, the more and more sickened I get with Dumbledore.</b> He's basically a parallel to Voldemort, I gather that much. Just like Snape and Voldemort show Harry what he could have become -- see the Three Brothers story in Deathly Hallows or Tale of the Beedle Bard -- Voldemort and Dumbledore are practically the same.<br /><br />I think my favorite* instance of that was when Dumbledore found out that Voldemort had used Lily's protection to his own advantage:<br /><br /><i>For a fleeting instant, Harry thought he saw a gleam of something like triumph in Dumbledore's eyes.</i><br /><br />That's just.... sickening. Absolutely sickening. Dumbledore gets excited about Voldemort upping the game. Just like how Dumbledore felt about Grindelwald. The more I read, the more disillusioned I become with Dumbledore. The more I see him for who he truly is.<br /><br />*Favorite = most sickening</span>  <a data-text-id="10816767593460051034" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1500503987">  <td colspan="2">    <div comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1500503987?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=9">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1500503987' style='display: </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_629746183" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/629746183" />    <a title="Ksenia Anske" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10221719-ksenia-anske"><img alt="Ksenia Anske" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1447565913p2/10221719.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/629746183?book_show_action=false">Jun 12, 2013</a>      <a title="Ksenia Anske" class="user" name="Ksenia Anske" href="/user/show/10221719-ksenia-anske">Ksenia Anske</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer629746183" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10243570794194416618">If I thought that Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban was complex beyond any imagination, I was mistaken. Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire takes upon such complexity that is nearly unimaginable to produce, yet J.K. Rowling did it, and in such a way that every single little detail has been rounded up, explained and closed at the end of the book, every single mention of every little secret, even down to a bug in the hair, has been dealt with. Now that I finished reading the book, I</span>  <span id="freeText10243570794194416618" style="display:none">If I thought that Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban was complex beyond any imagination, I was mistaken. Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire takes upon such complexity that is nearly unimaginable to produce, yet J.K. Rowling did it, and in such a way that every single little detail has been rounded up, explained and closed at the end of the book, every single mention of every little secret, even down to a bug in the hair, has been dealt with. Now that I finished reading the book, I immediately want to start reading it again, to see how, when, and where all plots and subplots and sub-subplots originate, how they develop, but I know that by the time I'm done reading it, I will forget half of them and will start reading it again. It's a never ending cycle. How is it possible to write something like this? I don't know, but I do know that it's brilliant, and this extreme abundance in detail is what makes the book feel real, what makes Harry Potter's world come alive and grab you and suck you into it, making you turn page after page after page, looking up if interrupted with a glazed look on your face, wondering where you are, being completely swallowed by the book.<br /><br />This book is much darker than the previous three. The stakes have risen dramatically. Lord Voldemort is on his rise back to power, and it's no child's play. Darkness gathers around Harry, innocently starting at The Quidditch World Cup and gathering deeper and deeper, in the form of unexpected news at Hogwarts school about a tournament that hasn't been staged for many many years, where Harry, unwillingly, will be playing a major role, which will eventually lead him to face his ultimate enemy yet again. Not mentioning facing such lovely creatures as dragons, merpeople, blast-ended skrewts, baby unicorns, a giant spider (again), a giant snake, cats, dogs, bugs (well, one cat, one dog, one bug), even a sphinx, not mentioning objects that would appear as trash to a normal observer but can transport people instantly from one place to another. There are also other wizarding schools, and the school ball, and the new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, and a strews Daily Prophet reporter, the elves, the half-giants, the brother wands, the.. theU+2026 I have to catch my breath here, I can't repeat it all. You'll have to dive into the book yourself and read it and reread it and reread it again, discovering something new each time. It's a feast, a dark and grown up feast, where life and death walk alongside and collide in the end.<br /><br />And now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to reading book 5, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix.</span>  <a data-text-id="10243570794194416618" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review629746183">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow"    <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_629746183'><a id="like_count_review_629746183" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/629746183?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">6
