 </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_362649665" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/362649665" />    <a title="Rob" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10743961-rob"><img alt="Rob" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1422270416p2/10743961.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/362649665?book_show_action=false">Feb 03, 2015</a>      <a title="Rob" class="user" name="Rob" href="/user/show/10743961-rob">Rob</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439139595" href="/book/show/49130.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=audio-book">audio-book</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=read-before-goodreads">read-before-goodreads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=read-2012">read-2012</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=not-a-bookclub-club">not-a-bookclub-club</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=read-2014">read-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=author-female">author-female</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer362649665" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer252225493651929499"><b>Executive Summary:</b> This has long since been my favorite book in the series, and each re-read seems to only reinforce it. I think the easiest way for me to describe it is "The Empire Strikes Back" of Harry Potter. It's much darker and doesn't have the sort of "Happy Ending" of the first 3 books. It really is a turning point to the series which sets the tone for the final 3 books.<br /><br /><b>Jim Dale Audio Book:</b> Another great reading by Jim Dale. And apparently that's as much as I wrote at the time I listened</span>  <span id="freeText252225493651929499" style="display:none"><b>Executive Summary:</b> This has long since been my favorite book in the series, and each re-read seems to only reinforce it. I think the easiest way for me to describe it is "The Empire Strikes Back" of Harry Potter. It's much darker and doesn't have the sort of "Happy Ending" of the first 3 books. It really is a turning point to the series which sets the tone for the final 3 books.<br /><br /><b>Jim Dale Audio Book:</b> Another great reading by Jim Dale. And apparently that's as much as I wrote at the time I listened to this one. Though by this point in the series, that should probably be obvious. <br /><br /><b>Stephen Audio Book:</b> Similarly, it's another great job by Mr. Fry. I can't really choose between the two readers, and really why should you? His voice for Moody was excellent among my favorite voices from previous books like Hagrid.<br /><br /><b>  <u>Full Review</u></b><br />I"m including spoilers in the very unlikely chance someone reads this who hasn't read the book (or seen the movie), in which case: What are you doing here! Go read this book/series!<br /><br />This book has so many elements that make it my favorite. As a fan of Quidditch (and really, who isn't?) to open this book with the Quidditch world cup! Which was nice since <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[there is no Quidditch tournament at Hogwarts in this book <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. <br /><br />Then if that wasn't enough the introduce this idea of a Tri-Wizard Cup, which unsurprisingly <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Harry becomes involved in <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />This book has my second favorite Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher: Mad-Eye Moody too (To Lupin in the last book: <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>). <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Yes, I know he's not really Mad-Eye..but how can you not love "Draco the dancing ferret" or some of the fun and amusing things. Plus I never saw the twist of him being a Death Eater in disguise at the end coming on my first read. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Overall I enjoyed the much darker tone of this book as Harry and his friends not only have to struggle with all the comes with becoming an adult, but are forced to face very adult problems that would leave many others in a quivering heap.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Not to mention that this book ends with the return of Voldemort and his death eaters <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="252225493651929499" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review362649665">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link362649665" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=362649665&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_362649665'><a id="like_count_review_362649665" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/362649665?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">7 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_362649665" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_362649665" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=7&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=362649665&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_362649665" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 362649665, true, &#39;&#39;);            swapContent(lessLink);          }        });      });//]]></script>  <script type="text/javascript">  //<![CDATA[      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');      var $copy;      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_35637441" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/35637441" />    <a title="Sherwood Smith" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/162084-sherwood-smith"><img alt="Sherwood Smith" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1409524068p2/162084.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/35637441?book_show_action=false">Mar 19, 2014</a>      <a title="Sherwood Smith" class="user" name="Sherwood Smith" href="/user/show/162084-sherwood-smith">Sherwood Smith</a>          added it                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/162084-sherwood-smith?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer35637441" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18051677836388268518">Rowling's young heroes and villains are now fourteen, and the story is more Young Adult and less middle grade than the previous four: we get good guys using 'bad words', and the beginnings of attraction and jealousy. <br /><br />The dangers are even more fraught, and the adventures take 700 pages to unfold. This was an important milestone at the time, when publishing insisted that kids wouldn't read more than 200 pages max. Even though many of us sought long books as kids. Rowling broke the rigid limits, wh</span>  <span id="freeText18051677836388268518" style="display:none">Rowling's young heroes and villains are now fourteen, and the story is more Young Adult and less middle grade than the previous four: we get good guys using 'bad words', and the beginnings of attraction and jealousy. <br /><br />The dangers are even more fraught, and the adventures take 700 pages to unfold. This was an important milestone at the time, when publishing insisted that kids wouldn't read more than 200 pages max. Even though many of us sought long books as kids. Rowling broke the rigid limits, which contributed to the present flowering of middle grade and young adult literature. <br /><br />As for the book itself, like the previous three, there are good and not-well-thought-out elements combined. The emotional pacing at the end is terrific, despite the long quest being basically a red herring. There are lots of funny bits, and the charactersU+2014 outside of Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle, who continue to be predictable cardboard bad guysU+2014do manage to come alive on the page, despite a preponderance of cliches. The adults in charge continue to be just stupid enough, as usual, to put Harry in mortal danger, and Harry is unswervingly good and true, the Prince in Waiting who is training for the Great War. Somebody good does die, as rumor had it; Rowling hits the reader suddenly, but then makes it just bearable with ghostly reappearances in a key point.<br /><br />The entire houseelf sequence, I suspect, if written by an American, would net the author a major slamdunk for the Uncle Tom attitudes not just in the elves' insistence that they really like not just serving, but being subservient. SoU+2026they 'like' bowing, scraping, running about in fear of offending their masters (and that word is used all the time), their fractured English peppered with honorifics, and their inability to dress properly? It's only Hermione, she who's of 'mixed blood' who insists on their consciousness being raised, but she's held up in ridicule, because subservience is in their natures. As one of the characters says of Mr. Crouch and his house-elf Winky, "You can judge a man by not how he treats his peers, but by how he treats his inferiors." <i>Inferiors</i>. Well, kid readers sloughed it off, just as we oldsters sloughed off unfortunate aspects of our own young reading.</span>  <a data-text-id="18051677836388268518" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_542217229" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/542217229" />    <a title="Mizuki" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16842102-mizuki"><img alt="Mizuki" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1368277474p2/16842102.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/542217229?book_show_action=false">Mar 10, 2014</a>      <a title="Mizuki" class="user" name="Mizuki" href="/user/show/16842102-mizuki">Mizuki</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer542217229" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13855955675901144552">MAJOR THUMB DOWN HERE!<br /><br />A few reasons why I don't like this book:<br /><br />(1) Massive plot holes.<br />(2) The book being long and thick for no good reason.<br />(3) Stereotyped foreigners in the book.<br />(4) The 'slavery is okay as long as the slaves enjoy being slaves' BS.<br />(5) Stupid villains and their equally stupid evil schemes.<br />(6) The very uninteresting, unlikable <s>Harry Potter</s> Mr. Special---a nick name by <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/202737218">another reviewer</a>, and it suits HP perfectly.<br />(7) The plot about Rita Skeeter and the <b>ALL EVIL paparazzi and tabloid</b></span>  <span id="freeText13855955675901144552" style="display:none">MAJOR THUMB DOWN HERE!<br /><br />A few reasons why I don't like this book:<br /><br />(1) Massive plot holes.<br />(2) The book being long and thick for no good reason.<br />(3) Stereotyped foreigners in the book.<br />(4) The 'slavery is okay as long as the slaves enjoy being slaves' BS.<br />(5) Stupid villains and their equally stupid evil schemes.<br />(6) The very uninteresting, unlikable <s>Harry Potter</s> Mr. Special---a nick name by <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/202737218">another reviewer</a>, and it suits HP perfectly.<br />(7) The plot about Rita Skeeter and the <b>ALL EVIL paparazzi and tabloids</b>.<br /><br />I could have said more, but I read the book from too long ago, so I can't remember all the little details that pissed me off.<br /><br />PS: I actually am *okay* with the first three books of the Harry Potter series, but this fourth book had done me in big time. After turning the last page and felt REALLY cheated, I never go back to read any other HP book.<br /><br />PSS: I read in somewhere that one of the appeals of Harry Potter series is that Harry as a character satisfies a common childhood fantasy about an orphaned/abused child getting away from the bad family (Harry's aunt and uncle) and goes into a world when he has a perfect family (Harry's real parents, they're perfect because they're dead), and everyone in this new world thinks he's important.<br /><br />Who hadn't imagined our parents aren't our real parents and we had a perfect family somewhere else, back when we were kids and our parents were giving us grief? And who hadn't imagined there's a secret world somewhere, where our importance and significance would be acknowledged and recognized, when as in reality we aren't so very special? Harry Potter plays into this child fantasy perfectly. But sadly when I read it, I was already too old to take this fantasy seriously. <br /><br />Extra Link: Amazing article by MakingFunOfStuff: <a href="http://www.deviantart.com/art/How-to-Judge-a-Book-by-its-Cover-437055930" rel="nofollow">How to Judge a Book by its Cover</a></span>  <a data-text-id="13855955675901144552" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review542217229">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link542217229" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=542217229&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_542217229'><a id="like_count_review_542217229" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/542217229?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_542217229" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_542217229" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=10&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=542217229&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_542217229" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 542217229, true, &#39;&#39;); elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_7692491" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/7692491" />    <a title="Annalisa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/542037-annalisa"><img alt="Annalisa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1226336540p2/542037.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/7692491?book_show_action=false">Oct 13, 2007</a>      <a title="Annalisa" class="user" name="Annalisa" href="/user/show/542037-annalisa">Annalisa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">everyone! please read this series</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Annalisa by: </span>      Dayne  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=movies">movies</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=cover">cover</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer7692491" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4350509583962358355">I first started reading the series at the release of book 4. Books 1-3 were interesting but could stand on their own. Book 4 left me needing a resolution, not necessarily because of the cliff hanger, although that helped, but because of the evil that tainted the final chapters. I was not expecting such a prevalence of evil in a children's book. I needed to know that evil had not overtaken the world and I realized I was caught up into the fantasy land Rowling created. <br /><br />I thought the Quidditch matc</span>  <span id="freeText4350509583962358355" style="display:none">I first started reading the series at the release of book 4. Books 1-3 were interesting but could stand on their own. Book 4 left me needing a resolution, not necessarily because of the cliff hanger, although that helped, but because of the evil that tainted the final chapters. I was not expecting such a prevalence of evil in a children's book. I needed to know that evil had not overtaken the world and I realized I was caught up into the fantasy land Rowling created. <br /><br />I thought the Quidditch match at the beginning was a little long and the last-minute discovery of gillyweed a little far-fetched, but overall there is way more to like than dislike: the challenges, particularly the last, the dark arts lessons (especially the forbidden curses), the confusion with the map, and of course the ball with the beginnings of a romance blossoming between Ron and Hermionine, so teenage boy and girl. I loved Mad-Eye Moody: the paranoia, the double entendres (not sexual), and the scene where Crouch senior dies in the forest. Fabulous. <br /><br />The inevitable turning point in the series certainly sparked intensity into the story. This is the book that turns the series from a fun adventure with a predictable saves the day outcome, to the beginnings of a true battle between good and evil when the bad don't give up so easily. It's not child's play anymore. This is where the fan obsession begins where one can move from thinking they liked Harry Potter alright to feeling invested in the characters and the story. You can't understand how adults can claim Harry Potter as their favorite series until you have at least read book 4--and I say that knowing once you read 4, the cliff hangers only get better and you'll invest in the rest of the story.</span>  <a data-text-id="4350509583962358355" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review7692491">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_7692491" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_7692491" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=7&rating[page]=10&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=7692491&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span id='comments_for_review_7692491' style='display: none;'></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_403851658" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/403851658" />    <a title="Veronique" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12371602-veronique"><img alt="Veronique" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1346344137p2/12371602.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/403851658?book_show_action=false">Oct 10, 2016</a>      <a title="Veronique" class="user" name="Veronique" href="/user/show/12371602-veronique">Veronique</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747546245" href="/book/show/43509.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=favourites-5and4-5">favourites-5and4-5</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer403851658" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9237660562668992142">4.5<br /><br />'Spine' or 'hinge' book of the series, where it all changes.<br /><br />I remember being surprised at the size of this book when my eyes first set on it, and then of being super happy since this meant I'd have more hours of fun and escapism. The scope this time widens to include other wizarding schools and events. We are not just in our little bubble anymore. Rowling adds quite a lot to our much loved world and the danger of course becomes much more palpable.<br /><br />Apart from the fantasy elements and school set</span>  <span id="freeText9237660562668992142" style="display:none">4.5<br /><br />'Spine' or 'hinge' book of the series, where it all changes.<br /><br />I remember being surprised at the size of this book when my eyes first set on it, and then of being super happy since this meant I'd have more hours of fun and escapism. The scope this time widens to include other wizarding schools and events. We are not just in our little bubble anymore. Rowling adds quite a lot to our much loved world and the danger of course becomes much more palpable.<br /><br />Apart from the fantasy elements and school setting, these books are really mysteries at heart, and this fourth instalment doesn't disappoint. Who put Harry's name in the cup? Is someone really after him, and who might it be? Is Voldemort coming back? What are the three tests and will Harry survive them? The reader is invited to follow our main heroes, gather the various tidbits of facts and try to find an explanation before coming to harm. Your typical crime novel.<br /><br />Our characters shine as always. Particular mention should go to Hermione however. She is not just a sidekick but a fully fledged character with her own interests and feelings. We see her juggling her friendship with Harry and Ron as well as her belief in fairness and justice. It is comical to see her battling preconceived ideas with S.P.E.W., and yet, deep down we know that she is right and that the circumstances at Hogwarts are not the same as in the rest of the magical world. This universe, albeit wonderful and amazing, is not devoid of ugliness and prejudices, which are already visible here and there. <br /><br />And now I really want to get to the next book... (although I know what happens - it IS a drug!)<br /><br />PS: Stephen Fry excelling once more ;O)</span>  <a data-text-id="9237660562668992142" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review403851658">  <td elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1640779420" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1640779420" />    <a title="Katriina U+2746" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13511873-katriina"><img alt="Katriina U+2746" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474896661p2/13511873.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1640779420?book_show_action=false">May 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Katriina U+2746" class="user" name="Katriina U+2746" href="/user/show/13511873-katriina">Katriina U+2746</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13511873-katriina?shelf=in-english">in-english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13511873-katriina?shelf=in-original-language">in-original-language</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1640779420" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3412853774677312481">I am finally, finally, finally through this book. <br />It was a bit of a pain to read this book as it's extremely long and I have seen the movie adaption only about two weeks ago, so the plot was still very vivid on my mind. And when you know all of the plot to an almost 800 page book, well, you'd basically expect your reading experience to be a bit tiresome. Especially since, and I'm sorry for claiming so, the prose is plain, and I'd even go as far as saying crude. I'm sorry, but conversations writt</span>  <span id="freeText3412853774677312481" style="display:none">I am finally, finally, finally through this book. <br />It was a bit of a pain to read this book as it's extremely long and I have seen the movie adaption only about two weeks ago, so the plot was still very vivid on my mind. And when you know all of the plot to an almost 800 page book, well, you'd basically expect your reading experience to be a bit tiresome. Especially since, and I'm sorry for claiming so, the prose is plain, and I'd even go as far as saying crude. I'm sorry, but conversations written in such a basic fashion as <i>  <br /><blockquote>"...", said Harry.<br />"...", Hermione said.</blockquote></i> really hurt my poor eyes. I am not one to prefer prose over plot, but I do prefer a coloured writing. <br /><br />Anyhow, prose aside, J.K. Rowling really stepped up her game. With the Goblet of Fire, the Harry Potter series has evolved in something dark and mature, and no longer is something that reads like a series of childrens book. Eventually, I liked this book a lot. Not only did the Dark Lord rise at long last - which changes everything and makes it ten times more interesting - no, I finally got what I was longing for: lots and lots of interhuman relationships, intrigues and drama. <br />And Dobby. There can never be such a thing as enough Dobby for me, so I was delighted to read a lot about him and, ofcourse, the other house elf, Winky. We've also been introduced to Bill Weasly - my favourite Weasly - much earlier than in the movies, so this is another huge plus. <br /><br />All in all, I'm excited for the next book. </span>  <a data-text-id="3412853774677312481" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1640779420">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1640779420" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1517903279" />    <a title="Alycia (aly_reads)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/51744742-alycia-aly-reads"><img alt="Alycia (aly_reads)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476441179p2/51744742.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1517903279?book_show_action=false">Jul 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Alycia (aly_reads)" class="user" name="Alycia (aly_reads)" href="/user/show/51744742-alycia-aly-reads">Alycia (aly_reads)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855928" href="/book/show/22037439-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1517903279" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14083557896255800491">First of all, I put a 4/5 stars because I think this book is less interesting than the previous ones. Don't misjudge me, I really enjoyed my reading, but I found this book was pretty long without any justification. I think there were less suspense and actions than in the previous books. As I said in my updates, the year began around the 120th page and I don't think it was a really good idea to take so many pages to talk abour the Quidditch World Cup. Moreover, there are chapters which are really</span>  <span id="freeText14083557896255800491" style="display:none">First of all, I put a 4/5 stars because I think this book is less interesting than the previous ones. Don't misjudge me, I really enjoyed my reading, but I found this book was pretty long without any justification. I think there were less suspense and actions than in the previous books. As I said in my updates, the year began around the 120th page and I don't think it was a really good idea to take so many pages to talk abour the Quidditch World Cup. Moreover, there are chapters which are really long and I think it could have been shorter because there were repetitions about what had happened in the last novels. <br /><br />However, I enjoyed my reading. Especially because Lord Voldemort had risen again and I know the story really begins now. This book reminds me also of Robert Pattinson as Cedric Diggory and I remember that I really loved it when I was young :p<br />I also liked the description of the Triwizard tasks, even if there were too many spiders for me (eww!). But I have to say that it was almost a minor part of the book even if it was supposed to be the main subject and I think this is sad not having developed it a little bit more.<br />To finish, I still love the relationship between Harry and his friends (Ron, Hermione and Hagrid), but also with Sirius and Dumbledore. There is something strong between them that I deeply appreciate.</span>  <a data-text-id="14083557896255800491" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_2798836" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2798836" />    <a title="Jeff Richey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/135553-jeff-richey"><img alt="Jeff Richey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1183782376p2/135553.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/2798836?book_show_action=false">Jul 08, 2007</a>      <a title="Jeff Richey" class="user" name="Jeff Richey" href="/user/show/135553-jeff-richey">Jeff Richey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Harry Potter Fans</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer2798836" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6110739700584275486">I haven't been as avid a reader of the Harry Potter books as most Harry Potter fans have been. I have to say though that they are getting better. The best part about Book Four is the character Mad Eye Moody. He is by far one of the most interesting and dynamic characters so far in the series. Also, there is a nice twist to this character later on in the novel. This additon to the series also displays how truly evil the Lord Voldemort character is in a way the other books had not done, which made</span>  <span id="freeText6110739700584275486" style="display:none">I haven't been as avid a reader of the Harry Potter books as most Harry Potter fans have been. I have to say though that they are getting better. The best part about Book Four is the character Mad Eye Moody. He is by far one of the most interesting and dynamic characters so far in the series. Also, there is a nice twist to this character later on in the novel. This additon to the series also displays how truly evil the Lord Voldemort character is in a way the other books had not done, which made it a more adult read. The downside of the Goblet of Fire is the unnecessary length of the book. Rowling takes much too long getting the story rolling. The first seven chapters could have been condensed into two or three, and the Quidditch World Cup seems to never end. However, the tasks in the Triwizard Tournament are fun, and once again, the twists at the end, as with the other Potter books, make it a worthwhile read. I recommend it. Just be ready for it to take a couple hundred pages to get interesting and for the character of Ron to be annoying and irritating on a whole other level throughout the book.</span>  <a data-text-id="6110739700584275486" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1728266880" />    <a title="Amber (bookstacksamber)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12603405-amber-bookstacksamber"><img alt="Amber (bookstacksamber)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1427849715p2/12603405.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1728266880?book_show_action=false">Aug 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Amber (bookstacksamber)" class="user" name="Amber (bookstacksamber)" href="/user/show/12603405-amber-bookstacksamber">Amber (bookstacksamber)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582957" href="/book/show/17347382-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12603405-amber-bookstacksamber?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12603405-amber-bookstacksamber?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1728266880" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6692214320375228425">It's crazy to think that the last time I read Goblet of Fire cover to cover was in preparation for the release of Order of the Phoenix. GoF is my least favorite in the series, so any time I've attempted a series re-read, I always get stuck on this one. I chose to listen to the audiobook this time, and that completely changed my reading experience. I think it's still my least favorite of the seven, but that doesn't mean much since all the books are five star reads for me. I've heard great things</span>  <span id="freeText6692214320375228425" style="display:none">It's crazy to think that the last time I read Goblet of Fire cover to cover was in preparation for the release of Order of the Phoenix. GoF is my least favorite in the series, so any time I've attempted a series re-read, I always get stuck on this one. I chose to listen to the audiobook this time, and that completely changed my reading experience. I think it's still my least favorite of the seven, but that doesn't mean much since all the books are five star reads for me. I've heard great things about the audiobooks and I can't believe I've never picked one up before this. I've heard some people complain that Jim Dale reads too slowly, but I typically listen to audiobooks on 1.5-2x speed anyway, so it wasn't an issue for me. Audiobooks are always more enjoyable when the narrator does voices for all the characters, and this was especially entertaining because there are so many different characters in Harry Potter. <br /><br />My only complaint is that the way he pronounced Voldemort (he doesn't pronounce the T at the end) drove me crazy. I got used to it eventually and in 2x speed it isn't as noticeable, but it took me awhile to get used to. </span>  <a data-text-id="6692214320375228425" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1728266880">  <td href="/user/show/38576843-akai"><img alt="Akai" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1420041287p2/38576843.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1744637800?book_show_action=false">Sep 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Akai" class="user" name="Akai" href="/user/show/38576843-akai">Akai</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788478886647" href="/book/show/101558.Harry_Potter_y_el_C_liz_de_Fuego">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1744637800" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6888952890004407157">Aunque al principio se me hizo un poco pesada la relectura (la parte previa a la llegada a Hogwarts es absurdamente lenta XD), sigue siendo de mis libros favoritos de la saga. <br />No sU+00E9 decir cuU+00E1l es mi favorito, y mucho menos sin haber terminado de releerlos todos, pero la trama de El cU+00E1liz de fuego es la mU+00E1s "guay", a mi parecer: las pruebas del torneo, alumnos de otros colegios, Moody (y todo lo que conlleva xD), la presentaciU+00F3n de los mortU+00EDfagos... <br />Es un libro muy largo en comparaciU+00F3n con los an</span>  <span id="freeText6888952890004407157" style="display:none">Aunque al principio se me hizo un poco pesada la relectura (la parte previa a la llegada a Hogwarts es absurdamente lenta XD), sigue siendo de mis libros favoritos de la saga. <br />No sU+00E9 decir cuU+00E1l es mi favorito, y mucho menos sin haber terminado de releerlos todos, pero la trama de El cU+00E1liz de fuego es la mU+00E1s "guay", a mi parecer: las pruebas del torneo, alumnos de otros colegios, Moody (y todo lo que conlleva xD), la presentaciU+00F3n de los mortU+00EDfagos... <br />Es un libro muy largo en comparaciU+00F3n con los anteriores, pero tiene muchas subtramas y se mantiene interesante en todo momento.<br /><br />En fin, tengo muchas ganas de releer La Orden del FU+00E9nix (y eso que es el que menos me gustU+00F3 en su momento XD), pero por ahora voy a hacer un parU+00F3n para leer algo que me urge mU+00E1s jojojo!!!<br />De todos modos no creo que tarde mucho en retomar la relectura :3<br /><br />PD: aU+00FAn me pregunto cU+00F3mo casi todos mis amigos del camping podU+00EDan creer que Harry y Hermione terminarU+00EDan juntos despuU+00E9s de leer este libro. elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1253978689" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1253978689" />    <a title="Roberta Jayne" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21250003-roberta-jayne"><img alt="Roberta Jayne" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1462975869p2/21250003.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1253978689?book_show_action=false">May 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Roberta Jayne" class="user" name="Roberta Jayne" href="/user/show/21250003-roberta-jayne">Roberta Jayne</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408834992" href="/book/show/18245256-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21250003-roberta-jayne?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21250003-roberta-jayne?shelf=excellent-fantasy">excellent-fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1253978689" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5181037657144604169">I really bloody loved this one! So much more complex than the movie and it's really intriguing to see, particularly as the books get longer, how clearly different the stories are from their film versions. It's a damn shame I didn't read these books before I saw the movies but, hey, I don't have a time turner so I can't change the past. I'm also loving how chunky the HP books are getting as the series goes on; I'm finding them to be a lot more immersive and descriptive which has, literally, been</span>  <span id="freeText5181037657144604169" style="display:none">I really bloody loved this one! So much more complex than the movie and it's really intriguing to see, particularly as the books get longer, how clearly different the stories are from their film versions. It's a damn shame I didn't read these books before I saw the movies but, hey, I don't have a time turner so I can't change the past. I'm also loving how chunky the HP books are getting as the series goes on; I'm finding them to be a lot more immersive and descriptive which has, literally, been a magical thing to read. <br /><br />I absolutely love how practically every character in this series is linked in with other characters and events and how wonderfully the story is written. And, my god, my favourite part of this book was definitely at the start of the story, when the Dursleys were connected to the floo network and the Weasleys came to collect Harry to go to the Quiddich World Cup but the chimney is blocked, oh my god. It was just brilliant. Loving it!</span>  <a data-text-id="5181037657144604169" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1172480082" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6335959696431939699"><blockquote> <b>U+201CRemember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.U+201D </b> </blockquote><br />My favourite <i>quote</i> in my favourite Harry Potter book!<br /><br />I love this book. Love it so much! Its my favourite in my series because it really sets the dark atmosphere of the rest of the series. It's also one of the most heartbreaking book in the serie</span>  <span id="freeText6335959696431939699" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>U+201CRemember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.U+201D </b></blockquote><br />My favourite <i>quote</i> in my favourite Harry Potter book!<br /><br />I love this book. Love it so much! Its my favourite in my series because it really sets the dark atmosphere of the rest of the series. It's also one of the most heartbreaking book in the series with the innocent death of Cedric Diggory. <br /><br />The quote that shattered me into little pieces: <br /><blockquote>  <b>It was Voldemort, Harry thought, staring up at the canopy of his bed in the darkness, it all came back to Voldemort....He was the one who had torn these families apart, who had ruined all these lives....</b></blockquote><br />I can't say anything more about this book without feeling sad for the rest of my life. Dramatic, but true. </span>  <a data-text-id="6335959696431939699" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer286054086" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11675093481390938726">Outstanding series. Though the movies followed the story line very closely there is just so much more in the book that has filled in a few gaps for me as well as showing me some tangents that were just left out of the movie. Even if you've seen the movies these books are definitely worth a read! So set down that channel remote, put on some good music and crack a book open or launch your Kindle/Nook/Pdf application. You'll be glad you took the time to read the written word.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer259499330" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5674117331278350593">Ein Reread von Harry Potter lohnt sich alleine schon deswegen um zu sehen wie viele wichtige Details man U+00FCber die Jahre vergessen hat und um auf fast jeder Seite vor Augen gefU+00FChrt zu bekommen wie durchdacht J.K. Rowlings Geschichte vom Anfang bis zum Ende ist. Mehr als bewundernswertes Lob fU+00E4llt mir dazu einfach nicht ein!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border id="reviewTextContainer87029392" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12158978872888578986">This is my favorite book in the Harry Potter series. I loved the maze, the challenges, the dance. Awesome book!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review87029392">  <td
